google.address: 4900 S Syracuse St, Denver, CO 80237, USA

reviews.author: Jeffrey Perkins
reviews.text: I attended a conference and was incredibly impressed by the venue. The hotel has great breakout rooms for smaller groups to meet for presentations. The main stage area was fantastic! Multiple large screens and cameras that displayed the speakers made it very easy to follow the presenters which kept me fully engaged in the content instead of trying to see the stage.

reviews.author: Brian Ross
reviews.text: Had an amazing stay here! The rooms were a bit outdated, but aside from that, they were very well appointed and spacious! What really made our stay stand out was the incredible service and the massive breakfast that the hotel took care of for my girlfriend and me! High marks for the front desk and restaurant staff, definitely went above and beyond making this such a memorable stay! Thank you all!

reviews.author: Matthew Spicka
reviews.text: Really enjoyed the room with a couch. Room was clean and fresh. Enjoyed the pub in the lobby and the smoked brie cheese. The only down side would be our hallway 7th floor, was messy. Maybe they missed vacuuming the floor, lots of small garbage everywhere.  The lobby bathroom could also use some attention. At a high-end hotel I would expect the management to have attention to detail. Overall good experience though.

reviews.author: Arijana Mrkiƒá
reviews.text: We got upgraded to a mountain view room with balcony and stayed here a whole week of Christmas. Rooms are spacious, quiet, clean with an amazing beds/sheets/pillows and delicious coffee.  Front desk employees made sure we had everything needed for a comfortable stay! üå≤

reviews.author: Evan Crumm
reviews.text: We had a great experience at this hotel. Thanks to the winds that cut power to our house & shop, we stopped by. They let us check in early and had a room for us for Friday & Saturday. We met 1/2 of Evergreen & quite a few of our clients that were staying there! The prices were GREAT!!! Thank you again for everything! Great place!!

tripadvisor.name: Courtyard by Marriott Denver Tech Center
tripadvisor.address: 6565 S Boston St, Greenwood Village, CO 80111-5312

reviews.title: Great place - would stay again.
reviews.text:
This is a fantastic hotel, especially for the price. 
1) great service at front desk, and breakfast/coffee/drink bars
2) newly renovated - rooms & gyms were very well appointed and modern
3) convenient location with semi-walking distances to a Target if needed

reviews.title: Stay somewhere else
reviews.text: This place is joke. I booked my room through Expedia for $137. Then when I get there and check in, they tell me that they‚Äôre running my card for the hundred dollars deposit and ended up charging me an additional 238$. After speaking with the front desk, they told me that there is nothing that they can do and cannot refund my money. Find somewhere else to stay.

reviews.title: A little disappointing.
reviews.text:
No clock in the room.  No spare blanket.  No free breakfast (despite paying $134/night).  No room service.  Small room.
When I arrived, the way I was directed to my room caused a walk around 80% of the hotel.  Perhaps this was to give access to the small elevator at around the 50% point?  I'd rather have taken the stairs and walked just the 20%.
On the other hand, the staff were quite nice.

reviews.title: Land of Confusion (apologies to Genesis)
reviews.text:
I have never stayed in a hotel which is more confusing to navigate in my life, and I have stayed at more than 150 hotels. 
If you don't know exactly where you are in the hotel, you will get lost and you will become very frustrated, sad, angry and hopeless. You will immediately regret your decision to stay here. I regretted it the moment I pulled up and became lost.
The only elevator I could find when I arrived was not working. Fortunately, maintenance got that fixed. Then it was an extremely long walk down a narrow corridor to my room. The thin air of Denver makes it far worse for fat slobs like me. 
There were no luggage carts in the lobby. I had to make four trips to unload my car. walking down those long, narrow corridors with a bunch of stuff which was very heavy. 
Whenever you book this hotel, the staff should send a detailed map to show you what the best place to park is and what's the best way to get to your room, or else you will find yourself questioning your sanity. 
The two-room suite was nice. Too bad I needed GPS to find it.

reviews.title: Nice place, would definitely stay for a quick overnight stay again.
reviews.text: We needed a place to stay that was near Park Meadows and downtown and this location worked out for us.  It's newly renovated and our room was nice.  As a platinum member, we were upgraded to the King suite and opted for the points instead of breakfast. The front desk was super helpful and very nice, none were grumpy!  It's the perfect place if you just need a night to stay and don't need the frills of a bigger hotel.  It's in a safe area near a few restaurants. In our room we smelled smoke whenever someone was outside smoking, but not sure if it was due to our patio door not having a good seal once closed, or if it came through the air conditioner/heater.  Overall, it's small, quaint, nice people at the front desk, and perfect for a quick stay.

reviews.title: DISGUSTING ü§Æ
reviews.text:
Check the room before you settle in found a used condom in ours! I‚Äôm am still beyond disgusted! I dropped something on the floor next to my side of the bed and there it was! This has truly been the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. 
All the manager said was oh sorry about that!

reviews.title: Nice stay!
reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay at this newly renovated property (the construction seems to be finished). Friendly and helpful staff, clean room, and comfortable bed. The hotel is walking distance (in a nice area with plenty of sidewalks and walk signals to cross a busy road) of many restaurants as well as a Target and a Starbucks. Would definitely stay here again when visiting this area!

reviews.title: A stressful situation soothed by exceptional hospitality
reviews.text: My family and I became stranded in Colorado due to a cancelled flight.  We were lucky to snag a room at this hotel, given low inventory of available hotel rooms, due to Taylor Swift‚Äôs visit to the city.  My family arrived stressed, frazzled and upset to this property.  Our room (an interior room) was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable.  To lighten the mood, we reserved a space at the Top Golf experience, right in the building.  Jesse and Natalie graciously helped us out, and then again later, for desert. Their kindness, warmth, and compassion truly helped to turn around a stressful and challenging situation.  As a frequent business traveler, there are few hotel employees that embody the true spirit hospitality. It makes a difference for guests, and meant a lot to my family and I.   Thank you!

reviews.title: Terrific staff
reviews.text:
This hotel was awesome. First off, the bartender Jessie was the best. She was attentive, hilarious, patient and professional. There was an incident with an intoxicated woman that she handled perfectly. We weren‚Äôt going to come back because of this angry drunk woman, but after seeing the response of the staff in the bar, we came back the next night for dinner. 

Also, the Top Golf room was perfect for our business meetings and a ton of fun. We will be back.

google.address: 1717 Denver West Marriott Blvd, Golden, CO 80401, USA

reviews.author: Joseph McGuire
reviews.text: Excellent experience staying here.  Great location with easy access to nearby businesses and shopping.  The staff were very friendly and informative.  Facilities were very clean. It is an older hotel but has been maintained well, is clean and safe.  Definitely a location that caters to business travelers/meetings with lots of meeting/conference space.  Very nice lobby lounge and room service.

reviews.author: DebMarie Phillips
reviews.text: If you have an event to plan, this location puts out an impressive buffet dinner.  We've been here two years in a row and we're impressed both times.  Food is delish and the staff is top-notch. Life is short ~ don't skip dessert!  This year, the Reese's Peanut Butter Pie was fantastic.  Clean and bright environment, as well.

reviews.author: Corinne Taylor
reviews.text: Marriott has apparently gone exclusively to an AI model of customer service, which makes it impossible to resolve problems. They demand an itinerary number, which is never provided, even on the statement. They provide a reservation # & folio # but no itinerary number. Both numbers I called were answered by AI with no option to get a person. When you push "0", AI hangs up on you. The receipt they provided didn't explain the extra $150 charge that is on my credit card. In addition, this suburban location with a huge, empty parking lot has decided to start charing for parking. Hate to be yanked around in AI merry-go-round hell and to be nickled and dimed. Typical corporate BS - do everything yourself online or on your phone and if you have a problem, too bad. We are simply here to take your money. This old hotel with small rooms isn't worth the AI aggravation that dealing with Marriott has apparently adopted as their customer service model.

reviews.author: Kyla Hines
reviews.text: I don't even know how to begin saying how grateful I am for the incredible staff at the Denver Marriott West. We live in Evergreen and had been out of power (and running water since we are on a well pump) since Wednesday and by Friday morning we were hungry, tired, and in desperate need of a flushing toilet. Denver Marriott West staff were incredibly helpful over the phone, made sure there was space for us, and warmly welcomed us when we got here (even though it was HOURS before regular check-in time). Even amongst the chaos of so many people without power they were so generous, patient, and kind. My heart was so full seeing so many families (and their pets!) here taking shelter (and showers!). Thank you for taking care of us Denver Marriott West!!

reviews.author: Terrance Truxillo
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel along I-70 that is a great place to stay with many restaurants and shopping just advertise the highway. All of the staff, from the front desk to the bar tenders, were friendly, responsive and accommodating. I really enjoyed the grounds, a perfect environment to walk your dog.

tripadvisor.name: SpringHill Suites by Marriott Denver West/Golden

reviews.title: Breakfast
reviews.text: Nelly is the best what a nice breakfast girl. Good job üëçüèª  working by yourself getting all the coffee ready you made the morning enjoyable.

reviews.title: Nice hotel for car-based travel
reviews.text: Breakfast good, rooms clean and fairly new/up to date. Customer service great. Parking easy.  All in all, a great convenient hotel for car-based travel.

reviews.title: Convenient, Comfortable, and Wonderfully Accommodating
reviews.text:
SpringHill Suites truly lives up to its good ratings. While it‚Äôs not a five-star property, the level of hospitality feels just as exceptional. The staff were very communicative and accommodating, making sure our requests were met with ease.

We chose this hotel to be close to family for a wedding, and it turned out to be a great decision. Check-in was smooth, and we were promptly given a room upon arrival. A few hours later, however, I noticed the room felt like it was lightly shaking (we are unsure why), which unsettled both me and my infant. When I requested a room change, the staff responded quickly and moved us without hesitation. Both rooms were spacious, and I especially appreciated the little study nook in the room, which I made good use of.

Since our stay was only two nights, I can‚Äôt comment much on housekeeping‚Äîwe declined service when it was offered‚Äîbut overall, it was a very good experience.

reviews.title: Pleasant but service lacking
reviews.text: Front desk staff was very helpful. Housekeeping services were lacking. Room was serviced only once during our 5 night stay. Had to dispose of garbage ourselves. Pool is small but was not crowded during our stay. Breakfast consists of powdered scrambled eggs, okay sausage, and various breads, waffles, yogurt and fruit. Overall acceptable, but nothing to get excited about. Breakfast served only until 9 a.m. on weekdays and 9:30 on weekends. Coffee was not very good, when it was available. Convenient location in the Lakewood area.

reviews.title: Clean and fairly new, good shower but weird bathroom design
reviews.text:
The first thing we didn't like is that they only clean rooms every other day, no taking out trash, no making beds, nothing.  Although the rooms and common areas were clean the refrigerator in the room smelled bad and the public toilet needed more attention as the waste basket there was not emptied for a couple of days.

The other item we found very uncomfortable is that the bathroom is located in the middle of the room across from the beds and it has a glass door.  Although it is  opaque if one uses the bathroom in the middle of the night the entire room lights up.  The bathroom has a pocket door and  it makes a lot of noise when you open and close it and, of course, it does not provide total privacy.  So overall no good sleeping quality if you are not traveling solo.

The breakfast bar has enough selection for this type of hotel, but the quality of the items was kind of low.  For example, the muffins were halfway frozen, the coffee was pretty bad under any standards.

The staff overall was nice but inefficient for the most part.  It took two days and speaking to two different people to repair the broken pocket door in the bathroom in our room.

reviews.title: Red Rocks trip
reviews.text: This hotel is incredibly quiet. The pool was nice and the room was very clean. The only negative is that room 435 backs up to the laundry so you can feel the bed shake due to the machines. Apparently they do laundry 24 hours. lol It was walking distance to shopping and dining which was very convenient.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We spent one night at Springhill Suites Denver West before heading to the mountains/Keystone Resort.  It‚Äôs a great starting point, close to I-70 and about 60 miles from Keystone.  We liked the location with lots of shopping and dining options nearby.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Customer service was great.  We spoke to three different people at the front desk and they were all very helpful.  They provide free parking, free Wi-Fi and complimentary breakfast.  We recommend staying at Springhill Suites for a comfortable stay.

reviews.title: Nice place to stay in West Denver area.
reviews.text:
Stopped by the Springhill Suites for an evening.  Great place to stay.
What we noticed when we entered the lobby was the cleanliness and lack of odors.  I don't have pets in my house, and don't like to stay in places that accommodates pets.  There were no funky pet odors in this place. We talked to the staff and they said they don't allow them.

Room was clean and odor free.  The room we had was furnished with 2 queen beds and a sofa the made into a bed.  The beds were comfortable.  We were in a party of 4, so I ended up on the couch.  I slept very well.  The room had a desk area that separated the beds from the sofa/ sitting area.  Great place to work.  I was up until about 2AM working on some things for work.  The folks in the room never knew that I was working; there is a sliding partition between the beds and the desk, so I shut that and kept on working.

A couple of preferences.  The bathroom has a sliding door, with a milk glass insert.  Great for staying alone or with a significant other, but not so good when staying with friends.  A little uncomfortable.  

The second is the food/ beverage service.  For breakfast there was a selection of cereals, yogurt, waffles, etc.  The quiche was undercooked and not pleasant.  The meats were either a turkey sausage or something like that but not pork.  There were bagels with egg and some type of meat were prepackaged and reheated, we couldn't do those either.  On the positive side, the juice dispenser was open all night and the tea/ coffee bar was stocked.  However, there was no hot water after a certain hour.¬†

The big thing for me is the cleanliness and service.  The SpringHill Suites at this location knocked that one out of the park for me.

reviews.title: A nice hotel at a great price
reviews.text: This place was great! Very clean, friendly staff, well located on the outskirts of the city. We tend to stay at Springhill Suites as having two queen beds with a trundle bed works for our family of four (two kids). Would have been nice to have an indoor pool and a non-low-flow toilet (I hate those things with a passion), but terrific deal for the price.

reviews.title: One of better Springhill Suites to stay out
reviews.text: The hotel seems new and the lobby and rooms were in excellent condition. The hotel host was extremely personable and helped with a quick room change. The breakfast simple and just okay. The eggs tasted like powder. I rated this five stars based on most Marriott hotels as this was one of the best.

reviews.title: The most friendly and accommodating staff.
reviews.text: The staff was so very accommodating.  If you are gluten intolerant they have GF bagels. If you fly all night and need an early check in they try to get you in early.  We loved the outdoor pool still being open and the location near restaurants and shopping.

reviews.title: No EV chargers as advertised.
reviews.text: This hotel advertises EV charging stations, but when we arrived, there were only Tesla chargers, hidden in a corner behind the garbage bin.   We had to drive elsewhere to find chargers for our e-car (not a Tesla).   This hotel is in the middle of big-box stores and chains, not the nicest location.

reviews.title: Solid, clean Hotel
reviews.text: This is a lovely, well run and clean hotel. Springhill Suites‚Äô rooms are large and comfortable. The free breakfast had nice choices. Free parking and walking distance to Colorado Mills mall- also with easy access to parkways. The staff is great- shout out to Nik and others who were friendly and professional and recognized my Titanium Elite Status. Before we arrived I had some questions and called and Jason was very helpful. The pool is ok- small but adequate. We will surely stay here again

reviews.title: Large Clean Quiet Rooms
reviews.text: This beautiful, clean, quiet hotel is steps away from Colorado Mills.  No car needed.  Head out the back door and you are in the mall parking lot.  Amazing staff. Super clean and spacious rooms.  Continental breakfast and snacks/drinks in the lobby.  Loved staying here!!!

reviews.title: Good Location, Quiet, Clean w/ Nice Room Layout
reviews.text: My son and I stayed here for three nights so we could visit Denver area colleges.  Room was nicely laid out with couch, working desk, two queen beds and a large closet.  Really like the layout of this room with the bathroom along one whole wall instead of at the entrance.  Had a fridge and microwave, but no safe which is a minor negative.  Was close to Red Rocks, Colorado Mills Mall, Colorado School of Mines (10min), CU Denver (25min) and nearby hiking.  Plenty of food options for lunch and dinner as well.  Breakfast was typical and just decent enough, nothing special though.  Overall the room was quiet and clean.

reviews.title: Not good
reviews.text: Fire alarm went off at 2 am, staff was not apologetic about it sadly. Even an apology or points would of been appreciative even if they are not actually sorry. Breakfast closes early so you better be down there by 8 AM, even on a Sunday. Go somewhere that actually cares.

reviews.title: Excellent location and amenities nearby, New all Suites rooms are great value
reviews.text:
Excellent Location, Comfortable, Quiet, Free Parking, Great Value! 

Location:  Inside the Colorado Mills Outlet Mall complex, so lots of food and shopping right there.  

I‚Äôve stayed in several hotels in downtown Denver/cherry creek and they were all over $250 this week + daily parking fee. 

Choose this hotel about 15-20 mins outside downtown, plenty of free parking on site.  

Lobby:  Hotel looks brand new, huge lobby,  free breakfast buffet.  Has an outdoor patio seating with firepit, 24 hr gym. 

Room: All suite, so spacious.  A nice size desk,  sofa bed,  big bathroom (shower only).  Bed is comfy, linens are soft. A/C is an older unit next to window that blows directly over the bed and makes some noise.  Due to location,  rooms are very quiet.  

The best part is really the location in the mall complex, all the amenities are close by.  

Loved our stay, will be back.

reviews.title: Great visit
reviews.text: We were traveling across the country and use this as an overnight stay. It exceeded our expectations. It is a quiet hotel and a great location next to many restaurants and shopping. It is close to the freeway in the morning. Breakfast was fantastic. Front desk staff was friendly and kind and we had a great day.

reviews.title: Quiet, Clean Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean.  This is my most important criteria.  The bed was very comfortable.  The towels were soft and plush.  The shower head was nice and high and had great water pressure.  The staff was friendly and helpful with their recommendations for dinner.  There is a shopping area that can be accessed by some steps to walk to dinner.  And even though it is a busy area, the room was very quiet.

reviews.title: Great stay near Red Rock Amphitheater
reviews.text: Great stay! Front desk associate, Colin, was lovely and welcoming. Hotel is about four years old and is very clean and modern. Very short drive to Red Rock Amphitheater and short walk to shopping center and close to many restaurants. Typical hotel free breakfast but was plentiful and decent.

tripadvisor.name: Embassy Suites by Hilton Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile

reviews.title: Awesome hospitality from May May
reviews.text:
Staying here for 10days. Awesome experience especially during breakfast. From afar, I could hear May May greetings and laughters greeting customers full with passion üòä
Really grateful to be able to meet a chinese speaking person during this 10 days stay. It felt so warm üôèü•∞

reviews.title: Police Called, Elevators Broken, Still Charged a Fee
reviews.text:
I had an extremely unsettling and disappointing stay at this Embassy Suites. From the moment we arrived, the hotel felt unsafe and completely out of control.

There was unrestricted access to the elevators and guest room floors, with no keycard enforcement at all. As a result, several groups booked rooms and then hosted large parties for people who were not hotel guests. Many of these attendees were clearly underage and were openly drinking alcohol, smoking marijuana, and blasting loud music late into the night. Hallways were chaotic and intimidating. It reached the point where the police had to be called, and multiple people were arrested. That alone should tell you how badly this property is being managed.

The overall atmosphere felt more like a ghetto than a hotel that is supposed to represent the Embassy Suites brand. We never felt comfortable or secure during our stay.

To make matters worse, one entire bank of elevators was out of service. This caused extremely long waits just to get to our room, adding even more frustration to an already miserable experience.

And despite all of this, the hotel had the audacity to charge a $25 per day ‚Äúdestination fee.‚Äù For what exactly? Broken elevators, unsafe conditions, and police activity in the hallways?

This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. Poor security, poor management, and zero accountability. I would strongly advise anyone to stay elsewhere unless you enjoy chaos, noise, and feeling unsafe during your trip.

reviews.title: Javin Housekeeping Supervisor
reviews.text: I had a issue with my room and Javin went above and beyond making sure I had a great experience. Javin refreshed my room, left a personal snack tray and stopped by to make sure everything was fine. She definitely turned my frown into a smile.

reviews.title: Starting the day right at Embassy suites in Chicago
reviews.text: It was a great way to start my morning on this trip. I‚Äôve stayed at over 50 Embassy suites and Sergio brought the best energy and most positive atmosphere I‚Äôve ever had at any Embassy suites. I want to give him a shout out because he truly was making everybody smile that came through that line for breakfast this morning.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, wait times ruin it
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful, and clean.  Great location.  And the breakfast was really delicious (made to order omelette, so good).  The reason for my 2 star deduction is the wait times here. It honestly was very annoying and off putting.  Long wait for check in, long wait for the ELEVATORS!‚Ä¶.and 30/45 min wait in breakfast line. I understand it gets busy in a popular area.  But are one night I was over it.  While I did have a lot I liked, the wait times for everything will definitely deter us from returning.

reviews.title: Excellent Service
reviews.text: I was really impressed with the service at the breakfast held each morning. Gaby, the hostess at the front area, was so friendly and kind. Then the two chefs at the made-to-order area, Sergio and Luis, were amazing! It was very busy on a Saturday morning but they never missed a beat. So efficient at making the orders quickly and with a smile. It made breakfast so much more enjoyable! Thank you for the great customer experience!

reviews.title: Great family stay near Magnificent Mile
reviews.text: Great location, modern hotel with spacious clean rooms and friendly staff. Nice pool. Great breakfast included and the chefs at the omelette station were exceptionally congenial.

reviews.title: Birthday Celebration (W/ Travel Offer)
reviews.text:
The hotel stay was great and well needed and accomodating. Second year spending it here to celebrate my mom and auntie's birthday. They could use a bit of an upgrade to the gym area (newer mats, stretch bands/equipment). We did enjoy ALL the other amenities (the pool, evening drinks, breakfast, the digital key, and such).

I loved the view in my room as well as the view on the elevators each time üòç

 Cruz with HGV checked us out, gave us bonus points, and a really good travel offer. He was VERY professional, well spoken, and friendly. It was a pleasure meeting with him.

reviews.title: Amazing experience
reviews.text: Margie from HGV has a Great personality & hospitality. Friendly, helpful, and kind. Answered all of our questions no problem and gave great vacation-stay recommendations.

reviews.title: Excellent service & delicious food
reviews.text:
I got great service from every staff member. However, the breakfast team was WAY above and beyond. It's my first morning back home, and I am missing the made to order omelette from folks who go out of their way to make sure you have the best experience possible. 

It was too cold to be out exploring Chicago much, but the breakfasts and evening receptions were great... I spent my destination fee credit on a smashburger that was enough for two, and another day on lunch at Monarch & Lion - which is such a lovely place. We also got some Portillos via doordash, and when the delivery person had trouble finding my room, a staff member escorted her up. 

Can't wait to come back!

reviews.title: Chicago downtown
reviews.text: This is the best hotel on downtown, Peter HGV is great he clearly explained all the packages which I already book for my family great experience

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Peter has been very friendly and informative. Rooms are clean and cant complain to the complementary evening drinks and breakfast.  We typically stay here when we visit Chicago, so its definitely not a miss. Great location and walking distance from the Pair and shopping.

reviews.title: Vacation
reviews.text: Caroline from HGv was a great help for food recommendations and so sweet!! There were so many helpful questions that she answered and was so kind in doing so!

reviews.title: Good spot great staff
reviews.text: This visit was a dream but Kristie the in Reservations was super helpful in explaining everything I needed so I understood exactly what would happen and set my expectations perfectly before I arrived. Darnell was all smiles and I loved being greeted by him! McKayla was amazing for help in checking me in. The elevator was under construction but waiting wasn't bad because the lobby was big and spacious, so I could sit down and set down my things while I waited.

reviews.title: Weekend in Chicago
reviews.text: My daughter and myself came to Chicago for a sport competition. This was the same weekend as CubsFest and the Bears game, so it was quite full.  The Embassy Suites Magnificent Mile had an easy check in process with Jay, and when the room we were initially assigned was not ready, it was quickly switched to another room.  It's nice to have two rooms if traveling with kids to make a bigger space.  The room was clean and well appointed.  We appreciated the two tvs and the easy to connect to internet.  The breakfast buffet was well run and efficient.  We did not do the omelet station, but it was very popular.  Currently an elevator bank is being worked on in the hotel, but waits were never very bad--don't let that discourage you. I liked that the front desk will text you and respond to any questions during your stay.  We also stopped by the small gift shop for gum, and it was nice not to go out into the cold.  When it was time to leave, the Bellhop was able to get us a cab to the airport in about a minute.   I'd definitely recommend the Embassy Suites to anyone visiting the downtown area.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text:
Beautiful rooms, nice and clean 
Great breakfast 
Staff was really nice. Larry the engineer was helpful. Very quiet and peaceful atmosphere in Chicago.

reviews.title: Great sales rep.
reviews.text: Aida with Hilton grand vacation did a great job with information about the getaway deals.

reviews.title: The  Best  Hilton on the planet !!!
reviews.text: This is absolutely the best hotel in Chicago!!!  big spacious rooms instant hot water lots of water pressure ‚Ä¶ free drinks in the evening ready made breakfast. awesome staff‚Ä¶. What else could you ask for?

reviews.title: A Wonderful Weekend
reviews.text:
The location was perfect for us as it was right near all the places we wanted to go. We really enjoyed the atrium feel and the bar area. Our room was a lot bigger than I had expected. Having the extra suite room allowed us the ability to go to sleep and not bother the other person or get up in the morning and go out in the other room and watch TV. The value was higher than other area hotels for the reasons above. 

Also, we experienced great service from a lady from HGV by the name of Erin.  Not only did she answer all our questions but she anticipated many others that we had not considered. Her recommendations on places to go and where to eat were perfect for us. Finally, her personality was fantastic‚Ä¶we felt we were interacting with a lifelong friend, although we had just met her.

reviews.title: Great to come back and see a friend.
reviews.text:
Went for the Cubs convention.  Once again Erin (HGV) was amazing. She greeted us and gave us a few tips on what to do!  

Hotel was as expected as we have stayed here before.  Will always book for Cubs convention and to see Erin.  Thank you for welcoming me and my new convention buddy and hubby.

reviews.title: A Good Time
reviews.text: We stayed the weekend for an event and had the best time! The rooms were clean and service was excellent! Erin H6V

reviews.title: Erin HGV
reviews.text: Love everything about this hotel

reviews.title: Very Pleasant
reviews.text: My experience was really great. The staff was amazing, and the rooms were kept up really well. I would recommend thumbs up

reviews.title: Enrique was the best.
reviews.text:
Enrique from the bar was an absolute delight. Our stays were made enjoyable because of his friendly and welcoming nature.

However, during our check-in at the front desk, we encountered a different experience. The receptionist was not very pleasant and seemed quite annoyed by our inquiries about parking and amenities. We kindly requested her assistance, but she was not very helpful. We hope that the front desk staff can improve their service in the future.

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Chicago Downtown, Magnificent Mile, and had another great experience. The hotel is in a fantastic location, close to restaurants and stores, making it easy to walk and explore the city. The room was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, though ours was located right by the elevator, so we did notice the noise whenever it moved. What really stood out, however, was the breakfast experience. The buffet is made-to-order, and Sergio, the staff member taking orders, was incredibly personable and attentive. When I ordered an omelet with no meat, he quickly noticed I didn‚Äôt eat pork and thoughtfully offered turkey sausage on the side‚Äîsmall gestures like that made a big impression. Despite the elevator noise, the staff, amenities, and overall experience make this hotel a place we‚Äôd gladly return to; this was actually our second or third stay here.

reviews.author: Abbey Jenkins
reviews.text: I had an absolutely fabulous stay at this Marriott. I chose it because it is a full service hotel (restaurant, fitness center, lounge for members, etc) and for the location. The rooms are a little dated, but very comfortable, clean and well appointed. My room had a view of the shopping area and lake and was very quiet. The fitness center is clean and well appointed. The biggest surprise was how good the food was. I only ate breakfast over my two day stay but each entree was incredibly delicious and the menu had so many options. The service - from front desk to restaurant staff to security and bellmen - was exceptional. Every team member is friendly and welcoming. I look forward to returning!

reviews.author: champa gujjanudu
reviews.text: First time at this Marriott for a work trip. Familiar with the area but did not realize how great the location was. The room was superb with a great view of the water and walking distance to great dining options at the Rio. Was here on a work trip and the service was top notch. Special thanks to Sajag Puri who went out of his way to make my stay great and our colleagues feel welcome.

reviews.author: Annette ROMAN
reviews.text: I normally have an enjoyable stay, however this time was different, it seems the hotel is not stocking the rooms with Life Water and then charging guest for the water. The cost is $5.69, luckily I noticed the charge and called the hotel and the manager removed the cost. This is a preferred hotel for our organization and one of my associates said he had the same charge on his bill. Marriott you can do better. Wonder how much money they have made charging for the water?  Check your bills

reviews.author: Homestead Lynden
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Maryland, let alone Gaithersburg, so we were a bit nervous about navigating unfamiliar streets.  When we arrived at the Marriott, the first smiling face we saw was a young man standing at the reception desk named Sajag.  He showed us the walkway behind the hotel, and the restaurants and theaters that lined it.  He asked us what kind of restaurant we were looking for and then circled those that would be a good match for us. We were only there one night but the next morning it was Sajag who would once again be a friendly face, ready to help us with any questions we had.

reviews.author: Himanshu Upadhyaya
reviews.text: What makes this hotel great is the service. I had a freaky accident of dropping phone in the elevator shaft (yes, it can happen so secure your phone before getting on an elevator!) and the whole staff went above and beyond to retrieve the phone and had it delivered to my office next morning. Special shout out to Desmond! I visit the area frequently and always stay at this hotel for the service.

tripadvisor.name: Courtyard by Marriott Gaithersburg Washingtonian Center

reviews.title: An Oasis On A Saturday Night!
reviews.text: I examined all the Marriott properties in the DC area several times and chose to stay at this property for 4 days.  I made the right decision.  I recommend upgrading to a King Suite.  It was very spacious and clean and comfortable.   The couch in the living room may be uncomfortable for a tall person but I'm short so it was fine. The parking is different, you have to park across the street at a garage.  I was worried because I had a lot of stuff to take to my room (I tend to overpack and buy too much at the grocery store for my stay) but there was a space in the 15-minute parking in front of the hotel and there was a luggage cart, so it was pretty easy unloading.  The parking is free which is getting pretty rare these days with Marriott properties.  The garage does get hectic on a Saturday night, but you just have to be patient.  It felt like an oasis when I stepped in the Courtyard, so peaceful compared to the streets outside.  I will definitely be returning to this hotel!  One thing which was annoying was I like to do my laundry early on a Monday, but no one had emptied the coins from the machines, so they were inoperable, so I had to go to a laundromat 5 miles away.  You would think they'd be emptied on Sunday evening.  Also, I was charged $160 extra but it was taken care of the day I mentioned it.  Overall, I had a great stay here!!

reviews.title: Free water in July ;-)
reviews.text:
Honestly, it started when I checked in at the front desk person took 15 minutes to get me my key because he was busy‚Ä¶ And then he said I could take a water because they do not offer free water any longer but then apparently they charge me for it‚Ä¶ I hate to say it but the service wasn‚Äôt great‚Ä¶ The room was very good though. I can‚Äôt comment on the food‚Ä¶ And there is a mini Starbucks in the actual establishment but for titanium members there are no benefits except getting your basic or whatever they give us‚Ä¶ and even when I question the new front desk people about the water, they said free water is coming in July‚Ä¶ I was like OK July is in two days‚Ä¶ Can you take the water out of my tab and the answer was no :-) 

Is that Marriott customer service?!? No benefits at all.

user.userLocation: Cabo San Lucas, Los Cabos, Baja California

reviews.title: Mixed feelings.
reviews.text:
I have mixed feeling here but most likely would stay again. 

Pros-
1. Excellent location surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. Cute area for a staycation as well.

2. Very nice staff especially at the FD. 

3.  Clean.

4.  As a Platinum, preassigned me a nice view. Also had 10$ credit each day.

5. Free parking across the street.

6. Starbucks brewed drinks for sale.

Cons-
1. One elevator was scary. This elevator had no lights (used phone flashlight)  and the buttons did not work Saturday morning. You just ride it and hope the door opened on the the floor you wanted. No one closed it down so people were riding up and down. This one elevator really needed to be turned off for safety. An elderly woman asked me not to get off and ride with her as she was so scared. 

2. This may sound trivial but caused me a headache. I ordered  a wake up call and it was never actioned on. I didn‚Äôt wake up as intended and missed most of the group breakfast and had 13 minutes to get dressed for a wedding to make it in time to the shuttles. Not a good start and didn‚Äôt look good for the wedding.

The next  day I called the FD and asked them please to not forget and they told me they don‚Äôt take wake up calls and I need to program it myself on the phone. Why did the gentleman the night before not tell me that?

The FD was kind and offered a courtesy point service recovery  but that never happened. I had to email Marriott to get the points. Mistakes happen.

reviews.title: a must stay if in this area.
reviews.text: this hotel was fantastic. super friendly staff. ideal location. walking distance to tons of restaurants and entertainment. free parking. very clean and comfortable. we went on Memorial day weekend and they were very busy but never looked stressed or annoyed with a lot of ppl looking for a lot of different things. great job to everyone there.

reviews.title: Not what I expected!
reviews.text: I was visiting Maryland for two days and checked in on Sunday. It's in Avery good location, lots of restaurants nearby, and on a small lake. But, Service was really bad. Paid full did not get bottle of water. Service was below par and these guys do not respect or value ambassador elite members. Never, ever came across a property that offered basic services.

reviews.title: Room stunk of weed
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location near shops, restaurants, a movie theater and there‚Äôs free parking at the garage across the street. Our room was clean, but stunk of weed as it appeared that the people in the room connected to ours were smoking all day. We let it go at first, but when we came back later in the evening, it still smelled and they still had the Do Not Disturb thing on their door. We told the front desk and they gave us a new room. Not the hotels fault, but no one asked us how our stay was when we checked out.

reviews.title: Don‚Äôt accept a suite next to the elevator!
reviews.text: Avoid rooms next to the elevator. I have just changed my room in the middle of the night - I have had 3 hours sleep due to the noise level. After checking in and hearing the noise every minute or so, I called check in. He knew exactly what the issue was and offered me to change my room immediately. It was late, I was tired, I guessed the elevator usage would drop off. What an idiot I was. I slept from 1 until 4am and then tries to drown out the noise with my own ear plugs, then by listening to music on my iPhone earbuds. I gave up just after 5am and changed rooms from a large suite to a twin. I don‚Äôt care that the room is smaller, I‚Äôm simply hoping to sleep well tonight (I am 6 rooms away from the elevator and can still hear it. It‚Äôs cacophonous) Learn from my mistake and ask for a room far away from the elevator.

user.userLocation: Allithwaite, Grange-over-Sands, Lake District, Cumbria, England

reviews.title: Bed Bugs - Please be warned. Children bitten and bad reaction
reviews.text: I am not an alarmist but needed to write this review to warn others. There are bed bugs at this hotel. My children, husband and I all ended up with bites. After looking at the bites and understanding what bed bug feces look like, we realize our beds had bed bugs. I know it's so gross, but you should be warned. This was not a nice hotel, but the location was great, and the staff was friendly. My son had a very awful reaction to his bites, and we had to take him to urgent care for it.  We sent the hotel a message about the bed bugs, but now reading other reviews, it seems as though this is a common problem, and they don't care.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: The location is perfect for walking around and the shopping and restuarants within walking distance plus the hotel make it the best place to stay in the area.  Good Staff and clean rooms.  The only downside is the highway noise you get from the lakeside rooms otherwise its 5 stars

reviews.title: Medication found on floor from previous guest
reviews.text: Hotel was very accoodating with early check in and comfortable bedding and pillows. Unfortunately cleaning staff missed medication on floor that could have been very harmful as I was traveling with my 3 children, the youngest being 2!

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: Great location with a number of restaurants within walking distance.  Enjoyed our 5 days. Parking is included at no charge.  Room tips ask for an upper floor facing the lake.  Did not use the hotel restaurant.

reviews.title: Comfy stay, close to restaurants and entertainment
reviews.text: For someone on business, the rooms are large and comfortable, and the showers work well. Rooms are equipped with a mini-fridge, and you're in the middle of a mall, so there are plenty of places to eat. Don't bother going to the restaurant at the hotel.

user.userLocation: Gothenburg, Vastra Gotaland County, West Coast

reviews.title: Fridge/cooler but no actual mini fridge in rooms.
reviews.text: This is a very busy area, it has lots of eating places within walking distance. I‚Äôve never heard of a cooler fridge, that‚Äôs what the rooms have, meaning you need to push a button every 2 hrs to cool.‚òπÔ∏è How disappointing for such a high end hotel.
