reviews.author: Rachelle Slaughter
reviews.text:
Stayed here for the Houston Marathon weekend. The rooms and everything were maintained really well. For being all booked for a busy weekend they managed it all well.
One note, they need slightly better customer service with check in and check out.
Offered to help with my bags after I already walked in and before I checked in- this could be offered at or after check in.
At check out, it was confusing if I was good to go or if I they needed anything else. A simple, ‚Äúthanks for staying, have a nice day‚Äù would‚Äôve been clear that I was good to go.

reviews.author: Tyler Anthony
reviews.text: I always have good experiences at this hotel but I wanted to highlight the level of service on my check in on 1/26. I had a long travel day and was getting into the hotel after midnight and was thinking how awful the day had been. I get up to my room to find an amazing assortment of desserts as well as a birthday card from the staff. This level of going above and beyond really made my day and all of a sudden the travel wasn‚Äôt so bad. Thank you!

reviews.author: bill roberts
reviews.text: Here for work, my stay was pleasant. Everyone from top to bottom was curtios and friendly. The room was serviced daily, the best comfortable and those pillows were out of the world. The restaurant was inviting and cosy and the food was delicious, with a wait staff eager to please. The downtown rail system was my only contention, making the parking experience a little inconvenient.

reviews.author: JB
reviews.text: I stayed at the JW Marriott Houston downtown on NYE with my girlfriend. Michelle at the front desk greeted me warmly and welcomed us in the room with a welcome card and a free bottle of prosecco. The service is truly above and beyond. We slept a little late towards the morning and the curtains were so dark that we couldn‚Äôt tell üòÇü•π The furniture and bathroom are also really modern. Highly recommend booking this property!

reviews.author: Jon Todd Koenig
reviews.text:
Stayed two nights for work in the building next door.  Overall my stay was fine.  I liked the room very much, and the front desk service was good.  My only complaint was with the breakfast service in the Griffin Lounge; it seemed to be short-staffed as it was pretty chaotic with all the guests jostling each other for breakfast, drinks, etcetera and the poor woman who was making the omelettes had to do double duty fixing the coffee machine, cleanup the mess at the coffee bar and bus the tables.

That said, I'll be back, as the hotel is very nice and I liked the staff and proximity to my office in Houston.

reviews.title: Great place and amazing people! Highly recommended!!!!
reviews.text:
We recently stayed at JW Marriott Houston while attending my niece‚Äôs ballet event, and we had a wonderful experience. The highlight of our stay was Ana, a Filipina J1 staff member, who went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. My sister were looking for a Filipino food and she provided great recommendations  and kindly walked us to Finn Hall across the street from the hotel.
We also encountered Ana again at Griffin, where she ensured our dining experience was excellent and made sure we had everything we needed. During checkout, she assisted us once more at the buffet area. Her professionalism, kindness, and attentiveness truly stood out.
Additionally, the entire team was friendly and welcoming, including the chef at the omelette station, who was fantastic.
Thank you to Ana and the JW Marriott team for making our stay memorable. See you soon‚Äîmaybe in San Antonio! Give us a call!

reviews.title: Thank you, Ana! You‚Äôre the best :)
reviews.text: So we just went for a little vacation with my family because of the freeze watch. Ana is so attentive and very kind. She makes sure that we are comfortable and we got everything we need.  She even took care of our baby so I can eat my food. And of course Bruno for assisting us with no hesitation. We‚Äôll be back for sure guys! You are the best!

reviews.title: A  vaguely pleasant stay
reviews.text: The front desk and bellman were very helpful and friendly, otherwise this place needs a lot of improvements. Two nights in a row I had to remind them to clean the room, don‚Äôt expect an upgrade if you are a bonvoy or Amex platinum member which is usually given especially when the hotel is almost empty as it was during my stay. I have never stayed in such a JW. Marriot with poor attention to room details

reviews.title: The only thing poetic about the "Poet" room is that it was reminiscent of a coffin
reviews.text:
Until this weekend, I had not had a bad JW Marriott experience.  That streak is now broken.  

First, be advised that there is construction at/near the entrance of the hotel.  It has made a dicey valet situation worse.  And while you will get a VERY long email about the valet move, it's difficult to locate and the signage is bad. Also the relocated valet stand is just bad -- where we had our choice of WALKING THROUGH a labrynth of dumpsters on one side of the road, or the incredibly foul smell and waste water runoff of (hidden) dumpsters on the other side of the street.  The valet service is pretty slow, and due at its relocated spot, now requires the valet folks to drive around the block (adding to the time it takes to get a vehicle).  You are supposed to be able to text to add your car to the que for pick up.  That worked for us on Saturday.  But on Sunday morning, it did not, and instead we received a text back saying we needed to come down to the valet stand to request retreival of the car.  We did, and since we were checking out, it was with all of our bags in tow.  Once there, we were told it was going to be "quite a long wait", with absolutely no estimate provided, and only 2 guys shagging cars from the garage (one with zero amount of hustle).  We waited for 45 minutes, standing on the corner with all of our bags.  There was no where to sit.  Fortunately the weather was decent as there was no awning or weather protection for us or the valet stand attendant.  DO NOT RECOMMEND THE VALET SITUATION AT PRESENT. Self park, use an Uber/Lyft, or stay somewhere else.  

The room was also unfortunate.  I often stay at JWs, and book a standard room.  The "Poet" really did not meet my minimum expectation for JW standards.  The room itself was coffin-like -- too small for the JW cost level.  The TV was located in a bad spot.  The curtains on the widow overlooking nothing did not close fully.  The bathroom was a motel style bathroom with the sink exposed to the bedroom, and the toilet and shower stall in a WC.  The barndoor of the WC both did not close fully, and had such a large gap on the back side (unrelated to the lack of closing) that you could clearly see whatever was happening on the toilet from the bed.  Inside the WC was truly depressing, as the light was connected to a fan that rattled loudly, and the shower was old, small, and in need of renovating.  

At $450 for a single night, I shouldn't have to scrutinize the representative photos for potential issues.  While the photos show the weird bed/window/kinda TV set up; they do not show the shower/WC, indicate that the sink is in the bedroom, show the tiny closet, or otherwise convey just how small and cramped this room is.  

At checkout, the front desk representative said the rooms were due for renovation.  I would agree.  And I wouldn't stay there again until that happens.

reviews.title: Just fantastic
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve stayed at this hotel for a total of about 20 nights this year. The staff is what makes this an exceptional hotel. As a Bonvoy Elite member I appreciate the Executive lounge for morning breakfast. Good selection.
rooms are spacious and clean. The bar has an excellent selection of drinks and good food options. 
Staff quality is high. Special call outs to Lexi at the front desk and Ike tending the bar. Really make me feel special. 
One improvement opportunity: as a Bonvoy Ambassador member, I have yet to receive a gift‚Ä¶hint..,hint 

Basically this hotel has spoiled other so so hotel experiences for me.

reviews.title: Almost Perfect_DvB
reviews.text:
Excellent stay and almost perfect. From check-in with Michelle, who was clearly a UH hospitality student or graduate based on her precise delivery of welcome and check-in, to the two gentlemen offering help with my limited luggage, to the restaurant staff, every single person on the premises contributed to the brand perception in a positive way. 

I was using a loyalty reward, so I can‚Äôt speak to the value of the price. It was a great value to me. My room was upgraded with request as well. Another kudos to the team. 

The photos do not do the large room justice it was expansive and hard to depart. 

Parking is a challenge unless you pay a hefty valet‚Ä¶ or are local. Locals know how to park for free on the street. Still, property crime in the city may give one pause choosing this option. Also, views are not skyline or otherwise glamorous. 

Still, I think this is my new lodging of choice when staying downtown. Besides the phenomenal club, front desk, and cleaning teams, the rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable.

reviews.title: The absolute best hospitality ever
reviews.text:
When I tell you this hotel has the best hospitality I've ever seen, I mean they have the BEST hospitality I've ever seen, and this is coming from someone who lives in Las Vegas and has stayed in some of the premium suites at those resorts.  Everyone from the front desk staff, to the room service waiters, to the in-house chauffeur were incredible.  Always customer-focused, always friendly and helpful.  This morning when I ordered room service for breakfast, I put a note on the order asking to sub the side of potatoes for french fries if possible, figuring it's no problem if they can't do it.  When they delivered, they apologized profusely that they had no fries available, and instead the chef insisted on making me an entire order of french toast (in addition to the actual meal I ordered) as an apology.  Talk about above and beyond!  The breakfast sandwich and the french toast were both amazing as well, and reasonably priced as far as room service in a high end hotel goes.

Extra special shoutout to Zoe and Yesenia at the front desk who provided some fantastic suggestions of where to go when we had a few hours to kill, and quickly arranged a complimentary car to take us.

We were also upgraded to an Executive suite which was fabulous.  Spacious living room, large dining room table, the bed was very comfy, and the bathroom had a massive bathtub that was perfect for relaxing after a long day of walking.   Everything was clean and exactly as it should be.

This hotel has basically ruined all other hotels for me, and I'll ensure I check availability here any time I'm in Houston in the future before I even start to look anywhere else.  This hotel embodies everything that all Marriott properties should strive for, and the management should be proud of their staff for not just meeting but exceeding expectations at literally every single opportunity.  I hope this review finds its way to them.  We'll be seeing you again for sure!

reviews.title: Ok - better options in the area
reviews.text:
The room was nice as was the lounge. The front desk was friendly. 

There is  construction activity which has been going on for months. 

The valet across the street is confusing and difficult if there's traffic and you're unfamiliar with the area.

Only one functioning elevator during our stay so long waits and crowded elevator for every trip up and down. 

A few weeks out and still no record of stay, credit in nights and points in the Bonvoy app. 

There are many options downtown even within Marriott - I would recommend staying elsewhere until they get their act together here.

reviews.title: Would never stay here again
reviews.text: I feel like the hotel should have let me know about the construction prior to booking. It was literally right outside my window. In addition only 2 of the 4 elevators were functional. I waited over 10 minutes multiple times during my stay. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Great experience at JW Marriott May 31-June 1, 2025
reviews.text:
My husband and I checked into the JW Marriott before attending an Astros game on Saturday.  We were able to check in early and stayed in room 607.  We had a great experience.  No line to check in or out, Lisa at the front desk who checked us in and out was very friendly and professional.  We were given access to the executive lounge which had a very nice continental breakfast for free which was a nice suprise.  The room had a king size bed, big screen tv with the ability to stream netfix, hulu, and amazon prime, and a mini frig.  The room, lobby, and elevators were really clean and the hallways had strong air conditioning, which I really appreciated.  

The staff were fantastic.  We called down to the front desk with a plumbing problem and maintenance was in our room in 5 minutes fixing the problem and very apologetic.  
My husband and I have stayed in lots of hotels and have never seen a hotel fix a maintenance problem so quickly and efficiently.

  Downtown Houston was a mess with all kinds of construction.  The valet was very good with carrying our bags to the front desk and with having our car ready after we called.  Valet was $60 but I think that is expected when parking downtown.

I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to return!

reviews.title: ABANTE PINOY!
reviews.text: Wednesday Morning and was about to get some coffee, planning to buy Starbucks but the host standing in the restaurant area greeted me with a smile and ask me if I want coffee, good thing she‚Äôs a Filipina! Well you can‚Äôt deny the fact that Filipino people are approachable and hardworking! I stayed in the hotel and tried to dine for a breakfast since she is so nice and very accommodating and Yamile the server took care of me. Well you can‚Äôt deny the fact that Filipino people are approachable and hardworking! Nice to meet you, Ana! You‚Äôre doing a great job! I‚Äôll be back soon!

reviews.title: Great Stay at JW Marriott Houston Downtown
reviews.text: I visited Houston for business and had a fantastic stay at the JW Marriott Houston Downtown. The location was perfect, with the office I was visiting nearby and plenty of excellent restaurants around. My room was incredibly comfortable and clean. The staff was both friendly and accommodating. I'll definitely choose this hotel again when I'm back in Houston!

reviews.title: Very nice hotel but fails at food offerings.
reviews.text:
The hotel was very nice and modern.  Very spacious, clean, and bright room. With a separate shower and bathtub.  Service was good throughout the hotel.  We really liked the location,  close to many restaurants and bars. You are walking distance from the baseball stadium.  

Unfortunately,  I had to deduct a full star because of the breakfast problems and the really poor execution of dishes at the restaurant. 

The breakfast buffet is very limited for a supposedly upscale hotel.  Also, it was extremely crowded, and they ran out of plates and cutlery.  Overall, some service and table areas were very dirty.  They were lacking staff.
Needless to say, after our first experience, we never came back and ended up having breakfast outside for the rest of our stay.  
At the restaurant/bar,  the cocktails were very good but the food again was terrible.  We ordered the tuna tatar and it tasted stale and bad. We had to leave it.  Same story with the mahi mahi tacos dry and tasting like cardboard.

For us food is very important so we definitely would not go back to this hotel because of that.

reviews.title: Construction
reviews.text: Great hotel, stay here regularly.  Bonvoy member.   Service is quick and rooms are week cared for.  Be aware that there is construction going on now, with hammer drills vibrating the entire building from 7 AM.  No warning of course.  Shame, Marriott.

reviews.title: Fabulous experience at the J W Marriott Houston Downtown
reviews.text: We love Marriott hotels but this hotel in downtown Houston is by far the best.   The attention to every detail from when you walk in the door was amazing.  We really enjoyed the restaurant and bar.  Andrew Gallaher came by and so delightful.  He was checking on us to make sure we had what we needed, and that the food was good.  My husband was really impressed by his knowledge of the wines and cocktails.  Our experience here was fabulous. I‚Äôm looking forward to our next trip now back to Houston.

reviews.title: Thank you
reviews.text: My stay felt like home away from home. I was greeted and treated very well. I would like to recognize an employee Mario. He treated me with so much respect and gratitude. He helped with any accommodations if i needed them. I will definitely be back.

reviews.title: Top Notch Staff
reviews.text: Very amazing, hospital staff! Michelle greeted us instantly at the front desk when we checked in. She was a delight, welcoming us on Christmas Day. Each day we were shuttled via their complimentary shuttling service. Drivers Logan and George took good care of us, driving us to various venues such as dinner at McCormick & Schmick's, ticks to Trans-Siberian Orchestra at Toyota Center, and our experience at Meow Wolf. Logan was great at suggesting many different spots in the downtown area. The staff in the downstairs bar was very friendly. The club lounge also had some of the greatest people daily, serving a very indulging breakfast. The omelet station was a definite plus! I highly recommend this hotel. JW Marriott rarely disappoints, just in general.

reviews.title: JW MARRIOTT HOUSTON DOWNTOWN
reviews.text: Had a great stay. The beds are the "Best"!  The food in Main Kitchen is always the highest of quality and the service delivers a classic luxury experience. Centrally located in the heart of downtown Houston,  the decor of the hotel is impressive. Andrew Gallacher, Director of Food & Beverage - excellent host & representative of the hotel!

reviews.title: Mario Rodr√≠guez
reviews.text: Mario Rodr√≠guez was amazing! Very welcoming to the property and very accommodating to my needs. Mario went above and beyond during my stay with my daughters . He was very patient with me as I was traveling with little ones . I would highly recommend the property 10 out of 10  . He was great !

reviews.title: The best
reviews.text: : Was a good experience. All was nice and very friendly. Front desk staff was very polite helpful especially Mario.Room was very neat smelled good.Bed was very comfortable.I also enjoyed the food and service,food was nice and hot dinning area was really clean.

reviews.title: Staycation
reviews.text: Mario, Michelle, and Zoe are truly BEST IN CLASS! Mario warmly welcomed our family with enthusiasm while guiding my husband and me through the check-in process. Michelle greeted us with such grace and positivity, making us feel instantly at home. Zoe was incredibly kind, offering our family samples of the signature hibiscus elixir, which was both refreshing and delightful. My husband and I were amazed by the hotel‚Äôs luxurious atmosphere and the exceptional attentiveness of the front desk team. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

reviews.title: Best in class
reviews.text: Mario was exceptional and went above and beyond from check-in to check-out. He assisted me with arranging dinner reservations at Guard and Grace and coordinated a personal black car for transportation to and from the restaurant. Great experience

reviews.title: Greatest experience
reviews.text: Mario and his front desk team were a Gem throughout our stay.They were always friendly and accommodating. Their knowledge of the area and  suggestions of things we could enjoy was certainly top notch. The hotel was unique yet intimate at the same time.I would definitely stay again.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text:
First of all, I would like to say the experience was great. The staff members were respectful, but there was one staff member that really
stuck out to me was Mario. Mario was very respectful, kind,and helpful. Mario made my family feel very welcomed to the hotel.

reviews.title: Vacation
reviews.text: Mario was an amazing help. His service was awesome and I would love to have him again when I go on another vacation! He was helpful and very respectful towards me and my family. His service was just awe striking and just brilliant. Mario is just a amazing help!

reviews.author: Ricardo F
reviews.text:
The JW Marriott at Lenox Square offers an exceptional stay from start to finish. The staff is consistently friendly and welcoming, providing excellent service that makes you feel taken care of the moment you arrive. The lobby is beautifully kept‚Äîspotlessly clean and made even more inviting with festive Christmas decorations that create a warm, elegant holiday atmosphere.

The rooms are just as impressive: clean, comfortable, and thoughtfully maintained. And you can‚Äôt beat the location‚Äîdirectly connected to Lenox Mall, making shopping, dining, and exploring incredibly convenient.

Overall, it‚Äôs a perfect blend of comfort, service, and convenience. Highly recommended for anyone visiting the area.

reviews.author: Niels-Jakob Harbo
reviews.text: We stayed here due to a flight cancellation and were treated exceptionally well. They allowed an early check-in to an excellent room and were warm and friendly from start to end. Thanks especially to Vladimir in the front desk, who were so friendly to us. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Jimmie Sanders
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at the Baldiecon 2025 conference. Staff was so pleasant. Was greeted before entering the hotel. Ambience was so on point. The room was so stunning. I hate I didn't wear the bath robe, lol. The restaurant was nice and the ballroom and catering was 10 out of 10 thanks to those Southern Grits!!! Would recommend and so easy to access from the airport via the train. Convenience!!!!

reviews.author: Chantal Koessemaeker
reviews.text: very friendly and helpful staff. They make you feel welcome from the first moment you arrive. Clean, quiet and comfortable rooms! always a pleasure to stay here

reviews.author: Ashley Summers
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the JW Marriott Atlanta and was blown away by the exceptional service. Everyone was so nice, attentive and made sure I was taken care of. I feel terrible for not remembering the kind man's name at the front desk but he's a "military brat" from Portmouth...incredibly sweet. Him and Jamari (I think that's how you spell it..nice gentleman from the Virgin Islands) made sure I had everything I needed. I'd definitely stay here again if I visit Buckhead.

reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Stay the JW Marriott
reviews.text:
My friends and I stayed at the JW Marriott Buckhead, and it was absolutely amazing. Better yet, is absolutely beautiful, spotless, and screams true luxury. In fact, we booked a large room with adjoining rooms for our daughters, which was perfect for our family and friends stay and the rooms were really large. 

Additionally, might I add, that the front desk customer service receptionist was beyond pleasant and welcoming, including the valet to the lounge staff (Sheron). We also stayed on the 16th floor and the window views of Atlanta were unbelievable. The rooms were indeed spotless, the king-size bed and sheets were extremely comfortable, and the pillows were like clouds. 

The 25th floor lounge food and room service food were very delicious; in addition to the lounge being beautiful and super clean. 

Lastly, The JW Marriott is right next door to Lenox Mall. This was a major plus. Therefore, the JW Marriott Buckhead is now in my top three for superior hotels in Atlanta, and I will definitely be returning. I was extremely satisfied with my entire experience.

reviews.title: Pure Room Experience
reviews.text: Decided to stay here for one of the Pure Rooms. In theory, a Pure room should help with creating an allergen free environment with the air quality and cleaning protocols. Having the air purifier is a big bonus in these rooms. I also think it would be helpful if the Pure rooms were in better condition overall and were absent of other environmental allergens like mold. This property is quite old and is showing signs of its age. The bathroom had mold and there was cracking in the mouldings in the room. The bed was comfortable but some of the sheets were dirty. Compared to other JWs we‚Äôve stayed at, this one didn‚Äôt meet the luxury experience you expect for the JW name and rates unfortunately. I think the standards for Pure rooms need to be reviewed at the execution level as the marketing is on point with many hopeful travellers looking for a solution to environmental allergens.

reviews.title: High Quality JW
reviews.text: I am a lifetime Titanium member and don't understand some of the poor reviews, this is a high quality JW Marriott with excellent staff, amenities, and well maintained property.  Also a shopper's paradise since connected to Lenox Mall.

reviews.title: Not the JW brand I remember!
reviews.text: Difficult to get to from street. Clearly, this a conversi√≥n property (under another hotel company at one time.) The JW Portfolio of hotels are intended to be upscale and vibrant properties. This is not. Hotel check-in area is the kind to be found in Courtyard Hotels. This main floor is dark, even with Lighting. Common areas, bar, restaurant  are scattered throughout main level but placed haphazardly. Rio, at check-in was pleasant and professional. Rooms are nicely appointed and clean. Service staff were competent. Hotel is connected to Lenox Mall.

reviews.title: Very nice stay!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights over Labor Day weekend. Did not know what to expect as I had read several negative reviews as of late. We had w GREAT STAY! Everyone was so kind and helpful. From the doormen to front desk, to service people. Our room was lovely, comfortable, and well-stocked. We used our VISA $25 gift cards each day at Lenox square. Went to the Atlanta History Museum using our complimentary tickets. It was really nice! Don‚Äôt miss the Swan House there! Ate at New York Prime, brunch at 5 Church, and ordered pizza from California pizza kitchen one night. Would recommend all again!  Would be more than happy to stay here again!

reviews.title: Avoid the end of hall deluxe king
reviews.text: Checked into the hotel with plenty of available rooms.  The front desk put us in an accessible room with an old shower curtain and a floor that was soaked immediately after one family members shower.  I went to the front desk to ask why they put me in that room, the answer was ‚Äúwe made a mistake, let us change you to a deluxe room‚Äù.  I agreed, packed up, and moved to the ‚Äúdeluxe room‚Äù.  It was an end of hall room, triangle shaped.  It was quite possibly the smallest deluxe hotel room I‚Äôve seen this side of the Atlantic.  Can practically touch the door from the end of the bed and there is barely enough space to squeeze between the end of the bed and the credenza.

reviews.title: Attempted 'fraud' by front desk manager.  Very distressing indeed.
reviews.text:
Worst experience ever checking out.  I asked the receptionist Hannah for a price for late check out until 6 p.m.  she quoted 60 US and then wrote a document for me to sign stating the agreed rate  and asked me to sign it.
When we came to check out, we were astonished to see the amount charged was 120$
We asked to see the Manager, Megan ,who told us we had been quoted the wrong rate. I asked to see the paper document I had signed and to our astonishment the amount had been altered in felt tip pen and amended to 120 $, We can only assume it was the manager who altered this.
We then told her this was fraudulent.
After a huge argument where she was mostly intransigent and full of 'attitude' from her, she took off the additional 60$
I asked for a copy of the document I had signed.
She said 'its now 'trash' and tore it into four pieces in front of us and then went to throw it in the bin in the back, even though we asked again for a copy!

The most disgusting experience  from a company like J W Marriott.
We asked for the manager Mr Mbye who said it did not reflect Marriott, however as it had just happened it definitely did!
He refunded the 60$ however we feel he should have offered us a one night credit for all the stress involved.
We are sure the whole incident would have been recorded on the cameras in the reception.
Megans attitude throughout was not a bit contrite, blaming the incident on a junior member of staff. However once we had signed the document it was binding between us and the Marriott.

reviews.title: Completely Unacceptable Stay ‚Äì Four Rooms in Two Hours and Zero Concern from Staff
reviews.text:
We are currently staying at the JW Marriott, and our experience has been nothing short of frustrating and disappointing. In just the first two hours of arriving, we‚Äôve been moved to four different rooms due to repeated issues:
	‚Ä¢	Room 1: The shower only produced scalding hot water ‚Äî unsafe and unusable. We were told we had to move.
	‚Ä¢	Room 2: The air conditioning didn‚Äôt work.
	‚Ä¢	Room 3: The bed setup was incorrect.
	‚Ä¢	Room 4 (our current room): Once again, the air conditioning doesn‚Äôt work.

To make things worse, the lack of concern from staff has made it abundantly clear that guest comfort is not a priority. We‚Äôve received little more than empty apologies and no real effort to make things right.

This is not the level of service or quality expected from a JW Marriott. Instead of relaxing and enjoying our stay, we‚Äôve spent our entire evening being shuffled from room to room without resolution ‚Äî and feeling like no one here actually cares.

Extremely disappointed.

reviews.title: Not up to JW Standards.
reviews.text:
Moving beyond the $47 self parking fee and the $25 facilities fee (both per night), I was surprised by the lack of recognition by staff of my Ambassador Elite status.  A welcome gift or letter would have been a long shot.
The hotel is tired and dysfunctional.  The lobby is cramped and pure chaos.  The lounge was a mixed bag-no one in site during the evenings, but did an adequate job for breakfast.   
Overall a disappointing stay for a JW, definitely the worst we‚Äôve stayed in over our 2000+ nights.

reviews.title: Very disappointing
reviews.text:
What a disappointing experience, if you're going to pay these rates there are much better choices. 
1) On arrival I attempted to enter a door which was apparently not the main entrance, there was a door man there at the glass doors that just stared at me, he did not direct me to another entrance or even point in the right direction. I had never been to this hotel and was unaware that was not the main entrance, it did looked like it, I rang a bell that was near the doors and the front desk unlocked the door for me to enter. Later I found out it was an entrance it was just locked at that time. The doorman proceeded to borate me for entering that way this is horrible service.
2) I used the Bonvoy app to check in and received my room number and key ahead of my arrival. However this hotel requires a separate physical elevator key which I had to wait in a check in line to obtain, this was a holiday weekend and they were busy. The convenience of check in on line and mobile key is pointless.
3) I purchased access to the lounge with my stay, at the lounge the coffee and tea station was closed with a sign that indicated the machines were not functioning and they did not offer another option, they also had no fresh fruit or other snacks as advertised.
4) My room did not have coffee, tea or even a machine, I brought this to the attention of 3 employees who were all in disbelief and said I just needed to look in the drawers. I advised them I had and they were all empty, their response was it should be there. I ended up waiting till the cafe was open in the morning and purchased a coffee and advised the desk clerk again of the lack of coffee or even a machine in my room, he had the same response as the others.
An employee did came up to my room  to "check" and thought it was funny, he stated, "what do you know you were right". This is terrible service from multiple staff, rude and very disappointing. 
5) I had dinner at the hotel restaurant where I ordered the Salmon with fresh vegetables and arugula, no vegetables were served and the arugula was warm and wilted. At this point I didn't say anything as I didn't think the staff would do anything about it.
5)The description of the room is for premium bedding, I have to say the mattress was so uncomfortable I slept on the couch and decided to spend the rest of my stay in Atlanta in a different hotel even though I had already paid for the Marriott.
5) During checkout the clerk asked how my stay was as I was walking out the door I told her not good and she said she would send me a survey, I have not received a survey.

reviews.title: Last minute family visit
reviews.text: From the minute we drove up - Stephen, the friendly bellman greeted us and we proceeded to check in with Christian. Christian was helpful and professional - minor hiccup with self parking. Christian was quick to remedy the situation. Sofia in the elite lounge was charming and professional each morning assisting with breakfast. The housekeepers on 17th floor was like ninjas-efficient and professional. Ms. Cassandra assisted with check out and remind me I need my room key to get out of parking deck. The hotel was clean and tidy. Plenty of staff to assist with any needs. Highly recommend this hotel and will be back in the near future!

reviews.title: Nice stay for business
reviews.text:
Nice stay for business. 
Conference rooms were great, the hotel provided great snacks and drinks for the meeting as well as a Buffett style lunch. 
Rooms were clean and spacious. 
Hotel is attached to a shopping mall. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Terrible place to stay
reviews.text: Terrible service, there were a good amount of customer service persons that treated me really awful, I will never come back here. In my opinion you should stay away from this hotel. Terrible. I am Hispanic doing tourism. Also there is a really bad package delivery service.

reviews.title: RUDE Front Desk
reviews.text: Hotel staff is RUDE. Christian at front desk should not be working in hospitality. Spend your money at The Ritz or somewhere nicer. This hotel is run down and not a place I felt safe. I called before I checked in and asked about a car to take us to dinner because I had my teens and was told they had a car but they only went 2 miles away. The restaurant was 3 miles away - they said it would be okay but it was first come, first serve. I went downstairs and they took a couple who called in the elevator and told me and my children they wouldn‚Äôt take us. I then received a manners lesson from the jerk at the front desk and had to call an Uber. Gross and unacceptable.

reviews.title: Great hotel for conference
reviews.text: I was in Atlanta for a conference that was at the Wyndham Buckhead (formerly the Marriott Buckhead) and decided to stay at the JW Marriott. The hotel was perfectly situated to my conference and within walking distance to the Wyndham. The hotel staff were great from check-in all the way to checking out. I had a king room on the 14th floor which had a great view of the city skyline. The executive lounge for Bonvoy elite members was very nice and provided a nice breakfast each morning and snacks in the evening along with a great view from the 25th floor. The hotel is attached to a mall which provided different food options and was just nice to walk around. I did not have a car but did notice that parking was $45 / night, so be aware of that. There is a MARTA station right next door, so the train is an option from the airport to the hotel. If given the chance to be in the area again, I would definitely stay at the JW again .

reviews.title: Great hotel and location!
reviews.text: My husband and I attended my father's funeral last week and had the pleasure of staying at this location. The wonderful young lady at the front desk granted us a very early check- in which was greatly appreciated. Our room was located on the top floor with an awesome corner view of the city. We had access to the lounge where we met Dominique. This employee went above and beyond to ensure our needs were met. We will definitely return to hotel on our next visit to Atlanta.

reviews.title: Atlanta side trip
reviews.text:
Stayed here when we got stranded from the Delta July fiasco. We were returning from Europe when our flights were cancelled at Atlanta airport. 
Hotel was always clean, friendly staff especially the doormen. We had club access and food was always available & area clean. Hotel is adjacent to a mall-needed clothes since Delta had our luggage. Hotel had complimentary car shuttle to nearby areas within 1 or 2 miles of hotel. Shuttle driver was informative and gave us tips on the area/dining options.

reviews.title: Disappointing Room
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it was close to restaurants etc. unfortunately we were not impressed. The room smelled stale and the pillows were flat. We had a very uncomfortable sleep due to the pillows and the hot room that would not cool. Our room was on the top floor due to my husband‚Äôs Ambassador status but we were next door to the lounge and heard the staff banging the door repeatedly getting ready for breakfast before 6am. Not an experience we expected and will probably not stay here again.

reviews.title: Good Atlanta Option.
reviews.text:
The five star experience started with the valet parking and carried on through.

Smooth check-in

Pleasant enough room with comfortable bed, good views and good bathroom.

Very convenient covered access to the mall.

Brunch was also very good.

reviews.title: Replace the coffee makers
reviews.text: Staff were outstanding.  At check on we were asked if we would take a room with 2 queen beds instead of one king.  We did but the room only had 1 comfortable chair to sit in.  The coffee maker was impossible to operate and had no instructions.  We were not offered complimentary coffee when we complained.  Breakfast buffet was good but very expensive.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, boring location
reviews.text: Great room.  Very clean hotel.  Not much to do near the hotel, very business like feel in the near vicinity.  We took the Marta into downtown Atlanta for a football game at the Mercedes Benz Stadium and a visit to the aquarium, the Lenox station is right next to the hotel, that was very easy.

reviews.title: Lovely stay
reviews.text: The hotel inside and outside is very clean. This is a top notch hotel. I loved everything about this hotel. The lobby staff was welcoming. I loved the minute I stepped into my room. It felt very clean. Very spacious, comfortable, luxurious room. The bathroom was really nice. I just loved everything about this hotel especially the fact that you can walk to the malls. I loved the breakfast they provided. I wish I was staying longer at this hotel. the time went by too fast. Convenience guarantee.

reviews.title: Incredibly Nice Staff
reviews.text: I was in Atlanta for a conference which took place at this hotel. I came in a few days early and stayed at another hotel in Buckhead. It was meh! Once I moved over to The Marriott, the experience was remarkably different. The level of professionalism as the hotel is not something I have experienced as a business traveler in years. Bonus, it is located in Buckhead and right next to Lennox Mall. Plenty of bars, restaurants, and shopping nearby.

reviews.title: High end Hotel in the heart of Buckhead
reviews.text: Great hotel in the heart of Buckhead. The staff was great and the room was clean without issues. Full length mirror, great lighting for women makeup, spacious bathroom, iron and in room safe. Valet parking was fast and elevators had minimal wait times.

reviews.title: Perfect place Buckhead
reviews.text: Perfect place for a brief three night visit.  The entire staff was exceptional; check in through check out.  Felt like we were visiting old friends with every staff encounter.   Everybody helpful and delivered on a great experience. Great location for all we needed to do. WILL RETURN

reviews.author: Katalina
reviews.text: The hotel and hotel room was very clean and comfortable. However, I paid for the couples package and didn‚Äôt receive what I paid for. They offer wine and strawberries upon arrival‚Ä¶ we didn't receive those until we called and asked but were only given little macaroons and water. (The macaroons were super good) however still didn‚Äôt receive our wine until a different guy at the front saw us. He then informed us that we didn‚Äôt get breakfast included.. which was in the package. They also have a package for free parking but when asked the woman at the front desk said they didn‚Äôt own the parking ramp and couldn‚Äôt do free parking for the hotel. So super weird but overall, it was a good stay (just maybe stay away from the packages)

reviews.author: A F
reviews.text:
Pros: location, friendly staff

Cons:
- all "amenities"  listed cost money
- no microwave in hotel room (in 2026!)
- no free breakfast (buffet gatekept by elite status), a standard amenity in most hotels.
- no free parking or benefits of being a hotel patron (it's just a public lot next door)
- not designed for long term stays (claims to be family friendly)
-housekeeping once a week if staying over a week
- airport prices at lobby convenient store
-lobby is nice but no coffee/tea bar, no water dispenser either
- pricey for the average traveler, perfect for a business executive who likes to pay money for everything for tax write-offs
- great marketing for Hilton

Summary: Downtown hotel charging premium for being centrally located while offering no free basic amenities which are usually included at most hotels in 2026.

reviews.author: Brian Pauley
reviews.text: I have previously stayed at The Emery but decided to give this place a try.  Parked in garage because valet never came out to take my car.  It turns out, he was inside on his phone.  The shower in my room wasn't very warm.  Engineering came to fix it, but it wasn't fixed.  A pet peeve of mine is when a server isn't trained or empowered to solve a customer's issue.  I encountered such a situation at Aurora (the lobby restaurant).  It wasn't a capacity issue because the hotel was completely dead.  I am Ambassador Elite with Marriott with 200 nights/year and wouldn't come back here.  I will leave a similar review on Marriott.com.  Sorry, they had every opportunity to fix these issues.  The bad reviews of this place are accurate.  I get the impression the workers are counting the minutes to leave.

reviews.author: Joycelin VC
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend at a conference hosted in the same building and it was excellent. The food, although a bit pricey, was tasty and the staff were incredible. The housekeeping staff were especially wonderful, and always greeted me with a smile when we ran into each other in the hallway. I have never felt so taken care of in a hotel! It's a great location downtown too and connects to the Minneapolis skyway walking paths between buildings. It's also close to the metro in case you need to get to and from the airport easily.

reviews.author: Ryan Nacho
reviews.text: Overpriced dump with lazy, rude staff. Coffee shop wouldn‚Äôt make coffee 30 minutes before closing. Staff refused to clean my room when I asked. Got locked out at 5am‚Äîno one at the desk, then they show up 20 minutes later and say they‚Äôre on break and won‚Äôt help. Plus they gouge you for everything: $8 canned coffee and a $5 delivery fee for room service. Never again.

reviews.title: Probably good
reviews.text:
The hotel was nice and staff was as well. Spacious and comfortable bed. Unfortunately, there was an electricity test going on and while we had been told that the generators would kick in, they did not. No heat, no WiFi, no electricity and the elevators stopped for a bit. 
And also‚Ä¶ no discount.

reviews.title: Nice hotel; fancy for a reasonable price for downtown.
reviews.text: Very nice hotel.  The lobby, bar, and club lounge were all very well maintained and worked well to meet up with my group.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Most importantly, my room was clean and spacious.  I had a great view of Minneapolis from the 30th floor (not sure if that changes depending on which side of the hotel you stay on).  I would stay here again.  Location is great: downtown Minneapolis within walking distance of the basketball arena and the baseball stadium.  There are a lot of restaurants to choose from in walking distance also.  If the weather is bad, you can use the skywalks to get around downtown.

Do not stay here.   Hotel inflexible.  Needed to leave early and staff quoted a 48 hour policy to modify a room reservation.  Charge a night of hotel otherwise.   Not documented on any of my paperwork or reservation documentation.   First time in 20 years of travel I have encountered this from a hotel.

reviews.title: Standard Downtown Marriott
reviews.text: Superb short and no-fuss 2 night stay. Was upgraded to junior suite which was quite spacious. Room had outside noise issues, but apart from that no real complaints. Bed was comfortable. Location was outstanding and walkable everywhere in Downtown.

reviews.title: Fine for a quick business trip
reviews.text: Really just your standard Marriott, front desk wasn't particularly friendly but the room was modern and spotlessly clean. I was disappointed by the selection of the room service menu, and food arrived in a paper bag in disposable containers with plastic cutlery. Wasn't a big fan of that.

reviews.title: Horrible service!
reviews.text:
I phoned months in advance to book a suite with a bathtub. I didn‚Äôt book online because I wanted to make sure I had tub. I was assured that the room I booked had a bathtub. 
Arrived today and am told they DO NOT HAVE A SUITE WITH A BATHTUB. the Manager could not cared any less about me not getting a bathtub. MARRIOTT DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

reviews.title: Overbooked and never notified -
reviews.text:
Booked and paid for a guaranteed reservation for Saturday August 24, 2024 back in May from earlier this year.  We booked for two rooms at the downtown Marriott, so that we could attend the Zach Bryan Concert at US Bank Stadium, about 5 blocks away that evening.
We received an email about my upcoming stay the day before our reservation and then received an email that Saturday, welcoming us to the Marriott City Center and to go ahead and check in (email states: "Check in now and get ready for your stay") and did that online as we pulled up to the hotel.
Went into the hotel to check in and get keys and after a few minutes with the front desk clerk, they walked away and came back with a piece of paper stating that they were overbooked and our reservations would NOT be honored at the City Center Marriott Hotel. We were given the excuse of it's the "Minnesota State Fair" weekend and the concert was there that night, which is why we booked for this hotel at the beginning of the year.
The letter was from the Mall of America Marriott stating that they were going to pay for one night's room at their location, which is over 10 miles away... 
At NO POINT, did anyone ever contact us to inform us of what they did.  
At NO POINT, did anyone ever apologize for NOT honoring our reservation that the location we booked and had already paid for.
AND FINALLY, the BIG kick to the rear-end ... they KNEW they were going to do this days in advance, AND never bothered to tell us!
I've attached the letter we were handed... the date they wrote the "you don't get what you paid for letter" that moves us 10+ miles away... was 4 days BEFORE our arrival at the hotel.
Never even bothered contacting us ahead of time... which would have saved us a few hours and $50 in parking at the location we couldn't stay at.
NOT
ONE
SINGLE
APOLOGY
from anyone at anytime.

reviews.title: Not what you expect for the price.
reviews.text:
I have to say, for the price I paid to stay at the Marriott City Center, I expected a bit more than what I got. We were on the 14th floor, and the noise level at night was ridiculous. I get that it's downtown and noise is part of the package, but I would have thought the windows would provide at least a little bit of soundproofing. But hey, maybe that's too much to ask for.

Then there‚Äôs the fact that they charge extra for turndown service. I know hotels need to make money, but charging guests for something that used to be standard is just absurd.

But the real kicker? Walking into the room to find a bottle of water that comes with a $6 price tag. It's not gold, it's not crystal‚Äîit's just plain plastic. Thankfully, growing up in the '80s, I‚Äôm no stranger to tap water, so I survived.

And what‚Äôs with only having two full-sized towels in the bathroom? Are we cutting costs here, Marriott? I‚Äôve stayed in budget motels where I got five oversized towels and more washcloths than I knew what to do with. I guess my expectations are higher than what Marriott considers ‚Äúfancy.‚Äù But hey, maybe I‚Äôm just out of touch with what people expect from a 4-star hotel these days.

If you‚Äôre charging close to $200 a night, I‚Äôd expect more than two towels and a $6 bottle of water. But clearly, Marriott and I have different standards.

reviews.title: EXTREMELY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE BY HOTEL MANAGEMENT. BEWARE OF ATTACHED  MARRIOTT PARKING" PARKING GARAGE.
reviews.text:
DO NOT STAY HERE. EXTREMELY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE BY HOTEL MANAGEMENT. BEWARE OF ATTACHED 
MARRIOTT PARKING" PARKING GARAGE. HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING SOMEWHERE ELSE.

Stayed here the past week with my Nephew celebrating his high school graduation. We had a fantastic time in the city and were a quick walking distance to Target Field and the Target Center. The Twins were in town all week so we attended three of their games. We also went to the Vikings preseason game vs the Raiders, which was also within walking distance. Tonight we went to the Lynx game at the Target Center vs the Mystics.

BEWARE if parking in the attached parking garage! The one plastered with all the signs that say ‚ÄúMarriott Parking.‚Äù Apparently they aren‚Äôt affiliated with the garage. I was told tonight by the manager that their contract ended 4 months ago. I guess that is not enough time for the garage OR the Marriott to take down all of the signs saying ‚ÄúMarriott Parking.‚Äù I guess it also isn‚Äôt enough time for the Marriott to train their front desk staff on the fact that they should no longer instruct guests to park there anymore since the contract for the affiliation no longer exists. I can‚Äôt help but feel like it's a flat out lie. If your affiliation with another business ended FOUR MONTHS ago, then either party would have ensured by now that all signs advertising the affiliation would be taken down. 

I have been grossly overcharged multiple times during our stay for parking in the attached garage. The Marriott manager wants no part of helping me, accepts no responsibility for me being told to park there, and offered absolutely no assistance in helping me contact the garage or secure a refund for the overcharges.

The front desk attendant I first spoke to about it called ‚Äúthe manager‚Äù who was allegedly in his car driving on his way home. He made some incorrect statements to ‚Äúthe manager‚Äù and neglected to correct himself when I pointed out what he said was not correct. When the call ended I asked for the manager's business card. The front desk attendant went ‚Äúout back‚Äù to get one for me and came back with ‚Äúthe manager.‚Äù When I asked if this was the manager that was just on the phone driving home, I was informed this was a ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù manager. Why in the world would he have called a manager who wasn‚Äôt working when there was a manager on duty and IN the hotel? Why was this on duty manager not the one contacted in the first place? I definitely feel like there was some shady business being pulled. I've never had a situation handled like this at a hotel before. 

So just beware that even though there are about 20 signs in the garage that say ‚ÄúMarriott Parking‚Äù, and the front desk staff may tell you to park in the attached garage, that is NOT actually Marriott Parking and if you get overcharged or have any issues in or with the garage labeled as ‚ÄúMarriott Parking‚Äù, Marriott will give you the brush off and NOT assist you with said issue. The only effort the manager will make to help you is to take every opportunity to tell you they can‚Äôt. 

Having stayed at many Marriotts in my travels, I have never received such poor customer service or felt like I was being lied to or brushed off. This hotel location is great, the hotel itself is very nice and clean, but it is the last place I would recommend anyone to stay that is visiting Minneapolis or the Twin Cities.

reviews.title: Great Staff, Great location!
reviews.text:
WOW! What a great stay. I booked a block of rooms here for an event and the entire process was simple. Hotel provided an easy booking link for the group which made it easy.  The hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating and  I got nothin but positive feedback from the group. 
I look forward to staying here again!

reviews.title: Nice comfortable enjoyable stay
reviews.text:
Minneapolis Marriott City Center is a great place to stay and located close to everything!  I was here pre-covid since then the hotel had a major renovation. I like that they got rid of the carpeting in the rooms. 

Check in took all of about 3 minutes as Pearla already had our room keys waiting. The suite was clean, scenic, spacious, comfortable and quiet. 

The breakfast buffet is typical but very good and had plenty of fresh fruit options. Hot foods varied each day which was nice. Although it would have been nice to see croissants and/or a few donuts/rolls like other sister properties. 

The concierge is a cozy place and offers a nice outdoor seating option that many properties don‚Äôt have. Phillip took care of everything flawlessly. He went around to every table to see if we needed anything and always greeted me every morning with a cheery smile to start my day! Bezawit was very friendly and there in the evening replenishing beverages and snacks. 

They have a nice bar and restaurant that also offers takeout food in a hurry. The gift shop is larger and has nice selection of souvenirs. Parking is easy and next to the hotel. 

Great stay with nice staff including the GM (very visible everyday around the hotel)!

reviews.title: Sub-standard Marriott
reviews.text: Noisy bed due to broken bed spring. Terrible breakfast buffett. Room service delivered in paper bag wirh disposible containers, tacky & not sustainable. Item left for us at front desk misplaced by staff. Key card system did not work well, required numerous tries to access room.

reviews.title: Marriott Minneapolis City Center
reviews.text: Horrible experience. I came for the Engage for Good Conference.  The escalators were mostly all broken and the food was blah. Severely understaffed and doesn't even have a bellman. The staff that was there were rude. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
reviews.text: Warning about Marriott Minneapolis City Center. Booked reservation that included self-parking. Showed up to hotel to find out they no longer have a relationship with the parking garage. Offered me valet parking. Problem is they have 1 attendant for valet during the day. So nobody was answering phone when I wanted my car so I left my room to go request my car in person and had to wait for valet attendant for over 5 minutes to return to valet area to even request my car. Spoke to front desk and their response was that I could self-park elsewhere at my own expense (even though I paid extra for a self-parking package). Unacceptable.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: Nice hotel in the heart of Minneapolis close to the Target Center. Rooms appear to be recently updated, as well as the gym. For those with access to the M club, the lounge offered a nice hot breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the area

reviews.title: Perfect stay!
reviews.text:
I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.  Rooms were very clean.  Bed was very comfortable.  The restaurant food was good.  Stayed 3 nights while in town for weekend event and everything was perfect.  

I would like to compliment the following people for their top notch customer service in going above and beyond to be patient and courteous and ensure 110% customer satisfaction.

-  Phillip in M lounge >  WOW doesn't cut it!  We hoped to see him the next two days after having him the first morning - he must have been off and we were bummed.  He is so pleasant and attentive and such WOW service!

- Corrie (sorry if I'm spelling wrong) Room Coordinator >  I spoke to her a few times and she was such a joy!  Wish all people could be as king and patient as her.  She made sure my request was met and I am very thankful for her.

- Natasha (I think in group events/sales maybe) > She followed up with me (whereas most people these days make you call back and forth) - she was so kind and attentive and warm on the phone.  She listened and provided thorough and wonderful service to my request.

- Wanda - Housekeeping > Wanda was very helpful and kind and thorough to clean our 23rd floor rooms and provide us with anything needed, towels, trash removal, etc.  You could tell she cared about what she was doing and wanted to be sure we were happy.  We are thankful for her.

Marriot Minneapolis City Center Management - thank you for a great stay.  Please extend our gratitude to these employees.  You can tell they care about your customers which makes a difference.  Hope to stay at your nice hotel again in the future!

reviews.title: Great Downtown hotel
reviews.text: Great find in downtown Minneapolis!  If you are going to Target Field or Target Center not sure  you can do better than this hotel.  Room was very clean, staff friendly.  Titanium level gets you access to M Club which was always stacked and very good buffet breakfast.  Several good restaurants within very short walk and Skyway connected.  Would definitely stay again!

reviews.title: Location, Location, Location - Great spot with plenty to walk to
reviews.text:
I enjoyed my stay here overall. The staff were all A+. They went out of their way to make sure that I felt welcomed and had eveything that I needed. 

There are plenty of eateries and places to water up within a short walk. The light rail stop is only a 2 block walk. 

The only drawback was that the matress in my room wasn't up to the usual bar that Marriott sets. If it were, this was a 5 star stay for sure. I plan to stay here my next time in Minneapolis. I recommend it.

reviews.title: Very good hotel
reviews.text:
Very good hotel in city centre. My room was in floor 19th and had great views. The room was ample and I didn‚Äôt hear a noise from my neighbours. 

The only thing I didn‚Äôt like is that my status was not acknowledged by the receptionist. I have no clue if my room was upgraded as it was supposed to be or not.

reviews.title: Solid hotel
reviews.text:
Solid hotel.  

Pros
-Good location.  If you have plans in downtown Minneapolis, the hotel is centrally located.
-Staff was friendly and helpful at check in and when we asked for a restaurant recommendation.  
-Room was comfortable and in good shape.  Generally on par for what you'd expect from a Marriott.
 
Cons
-Elevators were not capable of handling large groups leaving a conference.  Wait times could be long.  
-The unit holding the shampoo and body wash needed to fixed right after I check in.  It was quickly addressed, but it would have been ideal to not have to call at all.

reviews.title: Fantastic lodging in convenient location
reviews.text:
I was in Minneapolis for a week for a softball tourney.  As usual, I will write my review listing the pros and cons.

PROS:

1. Excellent employees.  Shout-outs to Cori, who gave me an amazing room with killer views on the 30th floor and to Andrew and Kevin. who were very nice and helpful.

2. M Club (concierge lounge) with good breakfast options.  Evening choices were rather limited for the most part fried finger food.  No beer or wine options.

3. Excellent fitness center with multiple weight machines, free weights and cardio equipment.  A Peloton Bike and three Life fitness Peloton like bikes were much appreciated.

4. Daily maid service (which seems to be rare these days)

5. Very comfortable clean rooms with refrigerator and safe.

6. Excellent location on south 7th street walking distance to both Twins and Vikings stadiums.

CONS:

1. No pool or hot tub.

2. Parking-Hotel uses city lot next door and charges above and beyond if you just parked there yourself.  Valet parking available for between $49-$60 a day.  $29 if you park yourself

Parking lot directly across the street was $7.00 after 4 pm and good until 8 a.m. the next morning.  Even better street parking was free from 10 pm to 8 am each day, $3.00 an hour from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm, four hour limit.

Even better than that the meters on LaSalle between 10th and 11th street, three blocks away were free from 6:00 pm-8:00 am, Monday through Friday and free all day Saturday and Sunday. You could park at these meters for 10 hours for $1.00 an hour

My total parking costs for the week was $32.00

Visit my travel blog at spontaneoustravel-wellplanned.com for other travel tips and recommendations.

Cheers!

Marius

reviews.title: Stay Elsewhere If you want to Sleep
reviews.text:
My observation based on an 8 night stay in Room 2814 in August as a Titanium member:

> As noted in other reviews, I experienced significant noise from the outside, mostly (but not exclusively) on Fridays and Saturdays. Multiple emergency vehicle sirens, loud cars, throbbing bass that you can hear and feel from nearby clubs. Earplugs help but not enough. I did not get to sleep until 3am when things finally start to quiet down.

> The lack of direct street access is an inconvenience that became a hassle the 

> M club lounge is small but nothing special, particularly after hours. 

> Housekeeping passed us by 2 consecutive days. 

> There always seems to be a line to check in starting at 4pm. 

> There was no point to calling the front desk after 4pm - the line was busy or just rang endlessly. 

Bottom Line: The location is good and I did have some positive employee interactions, but if you want to sleep, book elsewhere.

reviews.title: Excellent stay
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights as Quarter Century Club Member, the lady who checked me in was excellent, kind and work very well under pressure. The room was spacious, spotless, Houseman was friendly, polite and helpful. M lounge was excellent, lots of food and the  main course changed daily. Gym was the best part, I  used daily with my son, always staff members cleaning daily. Thank you all for your excellent service and taking care of us. We have memorial Experience and definitely will come back again.

reviews.title: Understaffing left us underwhelmed for such a beautiful space
reviews.text: I was there for one week.  There was no concierge.  It was difficult to get towels (one night we were told they ran out of wash cloths).  At the restaurant in the lobby, they completely forgot to place my order so after waiting 20 minutes for food, I learned nothing was coming.  They barely had any help with luggage - meaning few carts and even fewer bell hops.  The room was clean and smelled fresh.  The ambiance was beautiful.  Although they were aware that four hundred people had registered for the conference, they had only four people checking folks in.  The lines were 30 minutes long inside the hotel.  The location is fantastic.  The staff was courteous and friendly.

reviews.title: Noise issues and unhelpful staff!
reviews.text:
The air conditioning system units located outside can be heard in the rooms.
Staff were not helpful!
Waited hours to speak to manager and waited four weeks for complaint to be answered!!
Stay well clear if you want to sleep !

google.address: Terminal B, One Arrivals Rd, Philadelphia, PA 19153, USA

reviews.author: James
reviews.text: Location is perfect to the airport, hotel has direct walking access to Terminal B on Floor 2! Parking direction is a bit confusing but managed to find it. Parking lot has direct access through a walking bridge to Floor 3. The executive lounge location is a bit interesting, which is behind the restaurant. Room is adequate with no complaint

reviews.author: Jose Martinez
reviews.text:
If you need a hotel that takes the stress out of travel, especially with an early morning departure, the Philadelphia Airport Marriott is a standout choice. The room was neat, clean, and very comfortable, with cozy bedding and a quiet atmosphere that made falling asleep before our 5:00 a.m. flight effortless. Guests frequently highlight how comfortable the beds and soundproofing are, making it easy to rest well even next to a busy international airport.

One of the biggest advantages is its unbeatable location connected directly to Philadelphia International Airport via an indoor walkway, so you can go from your room to check-in without stepping outside. The convenience factor for early departures like ours cannot be overstated. There‚Äôs also a free airport shuttle available on request, which adds another layer of stress-free travel.

Beyond the convenience, the staff at the hotel generally receive high marks for friendliness and helpfulness, and amenities like the on-site restaurant and bar offer a pleasant place to relax before or after a long travel day. Whether you‚Äôre staying for just a night before a flight or returning after a trip, this Marriott delivers a solid, dependable experience that makes airport layovers feel almost enjoyable. Highly recommended if you want comfort, convenience, and a great night's rest before hitting the skies. ‚úàÔ∏è

reviews.author: Smoky Joe
reviews.text: Hotel maintaining Marriott standards at the Philadelphia Airport. Very comfortable place to stay to beat the traffic and catch an early flight. On-time room service breakfast. Porter took luggage from room to airport shuttle, which took bags to the end of the long Delta check-in line. I'm sure he couldn't do that with a full shuttle bus, but he treated us like royalty. And contrary to a couple other posts, there was abundant hot water for a wake-up shower. Great experience!

reviews.author: Alan Twer
reviews.text:
Good place to stay around flights. Small blip this trip as they put us in a different room than reserved.  It was fixed but one diesn't need the agg when tired so tgey can give the desired room to someone else.  Unfortunate they keep their parking floor of garage 90% empty and no longer allow flyers or anyone else use the spaces with parking in garages tight.
Hotel itself serves good and convenient purpose.

reviews.author: Lauren Berkoski
reviews.text: Overall I thought the room was good and the staff was really nice. There were several issues that I would point out. The parking is slightly confusing and we ended up paying more than what we were supposed to with the validation situation. Two out of four elevators did not work causing major backups trying to go up and down. In addition there is just a small coffee shop which was fine but very limited on food early in the morning so be prepared for that.

tripadvisor.name: Philadelphia Airport Marriott
tripadvisor.address: One Arrivals Road, Terminal B Terminal B, Philadelphia, PA 19153

reviews.title: Thanks for making my travel stress free
reviews.text: I booked the hotel since I was flying to the West Coast.and the weather conditions were awful.  The check in process was easy and there was everything you could want at your fingertips.  Room was clean and comfortable.  They have a bridge where you can walk over to your terminal or a shuttle that I had know wait time.  I'm always a bit nervous when I fly. The restaurant and bar area had lots of good options plus a happy hour from 3 to 6.  If you want a stress free travel day I highly recommend staying here.

reviews.title: Location, location, location
reviews.text: Great location, connected to terminal B via second floor walkway.  Clean and comfortable.  Excellent front desk staff.  Beds are great for a good night sleep before an early flight.

reviews.title: Great hotel for flying out of Philly
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for the convenience of being able to drop off a rental car and being able to walk across the road to the hotel.  In addition, this hotel is connected to Terminal B - so we were able to take the skywalk on the 2nd floor over to the airport.  This hotel is very clean and although it hasn‚Äôt been modernized into looking sleek, the bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. :). Anna at the front desk was amazing and very helpful and courteous. :)

reviews.title: Marriott without lightbulbs, blankets, or restaurant staff, but plenty of excuses.
reviews.text:
I will summarize the experience instead of detailing the poor experience.
- It took two trips to the front desk and two calls to get the bedding for the sofa bed. The staff were not helpful - the platitudes were sickening.
- There were lights out in the foyer. The maintenance man "engineer" tried to fix, but the hotel did not have a spare light bulb. (Side note - he was nice and seamed genuinely like he wanted to help - unlike any of the other staff)
- The restaurant only had 1 server. We waited for over an hour with only a few people in front of us (I don't think they sat anyone). They then said use an app to order food for the room. The app didn't work, and they knew it didn't work. We then called to order food and were informed that we couldn't. It took a trip to the front desk to get any food ordered.

reviews.title: Unexpected travel plans.
reviews.text: Staying at the Marriott Airport was an unexpected change in our plans, and I was hesitant based on some of the reviews. This hotel is definitely showing its age, but our room was clean and quiet, and hotel staff were very nice.

reviews.title: Poor service no hot water
reviews.text:
The location of this hotel is excellent. Unfortunately, the service is terrible.  The rooms are satisfactory.    

We had an early morning flight hence stayed overnight at this hotel.  There was no hot water in the morning.  When I first called the front desk, they told me there wasn‚Äôt a problem. We got dressed and I called down a second time.  I asked him to send somebody up so I can prove to them that we had no hot water. At that time, the gentleman said that in fact, they knew there was a problem. It would be at least 15 minutes to be fixed.  I told him we did not have time because we had to catch an early flight.  When we checked out at the front desk, the manager told us there was no discount or refund despite no hot water.  
We are titanium Bonvoy members. However, that should not make any difference, of course.  We should‚Äôve been refunded the cost of our room.  Instead, the front desk manager was arrogant and rude and not helpful.

reviews.title: Neither furnace nor hot water worked.  Management did not appear to take this as a serious concern for guests.
reviews.text:
I stay at PHL Marriott often. Always a bit overpriced in the market, but it‚Äôs convenient.  This time it was disappointing, particularly at this price point. 

Frequent travelers understand that mechanical things can go wrong in a hotel, but we also expect them to be addressed aggressively by management. First, the furnace did not heat, in my room, for the two days I was there.  Then, beginning at supposedly 5-6pm on 12/1/25, the hot water in the hotel quit working.  It was still that way at 5 am, when I departed.  I‚Äôm not the guy who‚Äôs going to hassle or scream at hotel staff. They were besieged by other guests, and had been given little info to share with guests.   What was most disappointing was that I was told that ‚Äúthe GM and management were coming in early on 12/2, to address the issue with guests.  Where were they all night?

reviews.title: Best option near PHL airport
reviews.text:
This is absolutely a convenient option if you have an early morning flight out of PHL or you have a long layover overnight at PHL. The hotel is connected to the Airport terminal C. It‚Äôs just a 10 mins walk from lobby to check in counter. 
The front desk staff is very professional yet polite. There are no bottled water in the room but I got one while checking in. Room was spacious clean with a coffee maker and view of the airport operational with take off and landings. 
The hotel has a restaurant and a Starbucks so it‚Äôs very convenient if you want a proper meal or something grab and go. Aviation Grill has a decent menu and a very attentive staff.
Over all a nice stay

reviews.title: All Hail Z
reviews.text: Z (the one with the spectacular hair) checked us in and out and shuttled us to our departure area. She is a jack of all trades here. The hotel is huge and clean. No complaints about our room.

user.userLocation: Mt Cobb, Pocono Mountains Region, Pennsylvania

reviews.title: Very comfortable!
reviews.text: I found this hotel to extremely clean, comfortable and all of the staff were very friendly. I had the Philly cheese steak at the restaurant and it was delicious! Prices are fair and being able to walk right to the airport made getting to my flight so much easier.

reviews.title: Very dated hotel
reviews.text:
Hotel is in dire need of a total renovation. From tile bathtubs , carpet in halls/rooms , paint , etc. 
Also the towels were threadbare -worn so thin some had holes in them and musty smell. 
We are Mariott fans but this hotel could easily be rated a 2. 
Also no water in rooms or recognition of Bonvoy membership.

reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would. Currently at the hotel right now. We booked a suite for a one night stay. We arrived at 8;00 pm tonight. We were told our room wasn't ready and needed to be cleaned. The manager was rude and disrespectful and acted like we were the ones acting unreasonable. When I tried to get a picture of his name tag he took it off and said he didn't have to identify himself. He said the previous guest had a late checkout and he would never tell a guest to leave. Excuse me but what? What hotel lets a guest stay so late even when another guest has already paid for the room? What about Marriott's guaranteed 4:00 pm check in which is clearly stated on their website. He said housekeeping was working on another room and when they were finished they would clean our room - btw hotel is not sold out. When I said why wouldn't you pull the housekeeper so they could do our room right away his response was "don't tell me how to do my job". He then went back to the front desk and started helping other customers with no updates at all. I'm embarrassed to say we paid $800.00 for the one night stay here. So far no apology and no compensation. Finally was given room at 9:00pm. AVOID at all costs. Luckily I have video and pics of the whole ordeal and have a case number with Marriott corporate already. I rarely give bad reviews, but in this case is beyond warranted.

reviews.title: Drab
reviews.text:
This hotel is difficult to find, the sineage is poorly placed, had to ask a lot of nice people for directions. Check in, when we found it, was swift and efficient. On entering our room my first thought was: This is not a $400+ room. Drab and run down, scruffy beyond belief. Battered furniture, bathroom from the fifties rusty fittings, water pressure from the stone age. Beds were very comfortable though. Breakfast was a poor effort, very little choice, no cereals, no fruit etc. Staff were very pleasant and helpful though.
Marriott you need to step up, we appreciate we paid for location but this hotel was the same as the last Marriott we stayed at three years ago, poor.

reviews.title: Great location, real 1980s vibe
reviews.text:
Stayed here before a flight from Philly to Toronto. The hotel is well located. Bed is very large and room is clean. Mattress is comfortable. 
No idea how to turn on the shower, and no staff available to assist. Coffee machine looked like a 1980s device, and noisy air-conditioner. You are really paying for the location here

reviews.title: Perfect stay at the Marriott
reviews.text: We stayed here 1 night to catch a early flight the next day.. I booked a double with a view.. My kids loved watching the airplanes out the window.. The room served its purpose. It was clean and quiet. For the price and being a Marriott it could probably use an update.. But you're paying for the convenience which was perfect for us since our flight was out of the B terminal. We are planning on staying here again in May.

reviews.title: Disappointed at PHL Marriott ‚Äì Great Staff, But Rooms Need Major Update
reviews.text:
As a long-time Marriott Bonvoy member who usually enjoys staying at Marriott properties, I was truly let down by my recent stay at the Philadelphia Airport Marriott.

The Positives:
The staff here are genuinely friendly and accommodating. From check-in to check-out, every interaction I had with the front desk and housekeeping was professional and welcoming. They clearly care about guests, and I appreciate that.

The Negatives:
Unfortunately, the property itself does not live up to the Marriott standard I‚Äôve come to expect. The rooms are very outdated ‚Äî worn furniture, aging d√©cor, and fixtures that look decades old. Water pressure in the shower was frustratingly low, making mornings less than refreshing. I also noticed rust on several light fixtures, which was disappointing and gave the room a neglected feel. On top of that, there was a persistent, pungent odor that made the room uncomfortable to relax in.

For the rates they charge (especially on certain dates), the value simply isn‚Äôt there. While I understand airport hotels can be pricey, the condition of this property does not justify the cost.

Bottom Line:
The amazing staff deserve better facilities to match their service. Until the rooms are renovated and the maintenance issues addressed, I can‚Äôt recommend this hotel, despite my loyalty to Marriott.

reviews.title: Quiet airport room??? Yes!
reviews.text: Great place to rest before early flights out. The hotel has an airport shuttle and is conveniently located across the street from the rental car return area. There is a restaurant with a bar, plenty of lobby space, and the atmosphere is quiet once you leave the first floor.

reviews.title: Sketchy, dangerous, ZERO safety, overpriced, outdated ripoff
reviews.text: Long review but please read so I can save you from ever staying here. Arrived in airport on a late flight. Had an hour and a half drive home. Anyone and everyone who wants can walk into this hotel. There were drunks, homeless people, people smoking a huge blunt roaming around the airport with zero security or any employees for that matter in sight.
