Any of them can easily walk right into this hotel onto any floor. The front desk said you need your room key to activate the elevator but that was NOT the case. We got on and off without using our key. The hallways have an eerie unsafe feeling and are outdated. Room outdated but thankfully bathroom updated. I truly had a gut feeling that I wasn't safe. And the entire point of staying here was that it is advertised as being so convenient that you can get to it right from inside the terminal. But, that's apparently ONLY if you don't have baggage to claim. There were ZERO signs or instructions on how to get to it from baggage claim. If not for the one employee I could find simply from passing him going the other way on the moving sidewalk,  who explained how to get to it, I would have been faced with getting an uber to an onsite hotel. To get to it from our terminal baggage claim, the instructions were to go outside, walk along a sidewalk, enter the next building, walk all the way down to a wall where there would be an elevator with a tiny sign above it. Then go up one floor and exit. Go around a corner to the skybridge. Very confusing as there again was zero signage as you exited an elevator into a deserted and desolate parking garage. You know how you can trust your gut? Gut feeling felt SO unsafe. And I travel the world and am not squeamish. Finally found sky bridge after passing multiple homeless people, some camped out sleeping in multiple airline wheelchairs as if they were makeshift beds. Why no one patrolled those wheelchairs, I have no idea. Zero airport employees and zero security. Super sketchy. Entered hotel as any nefarious characters could also do. It was late and I had already paid $284 plus fees making my total $330 something. And when I booked, they made sure to tell me there would be no refund. What a racket. They have you at their mercy and they know it. Take my advice. DO NOT stay here. Oh, and after paying $330 they can't even give you a free breakfast like every other chain. Never again. My advice would be to make a short drive 30 minutes away to the main line area and stay there where it's safe.

reviews.title: The day before an early morning flight.
reviews.text:
We booked a room at this hotel for the day before an early morning flight. I used some Bonvoy points and paid the difference.  Great location at the airport. Convenient parking for the night although I had to move my car to another level for the duration of our trip. (Park and fly option is not offered.)
Service at the registration desk was slow since one staffer was on the phone for quite a long time. No one else seemed available. Our room on the 11th floor was clean and very quiet. Excellent soundproofing! Unfortunately, there were no amenities in the room. No waters, no refrigerator, and no minibar.
We ate dinner in their restaurant and took the shuttle the next morning. The shuttle was ready when we left and the driver was excellent.

reviews.title: Promises not kept
reviews.text: My flight was cancelled.  I called and cancelled and they agreed not to charge me as I am a platinum elite Marriott member.  Low and behold 30 days later I see a charge on my visa.  Now they don't return telephone calls.  Nice.

reviews.title: Unexpected overnight
reviews.text: Stayed here after a flight got canceled due to bad weather. I had no car and a rebooked flight for very early the next morning. Being attached to the airport made it incredibly convenient and allowed me to sleep a few extra minutes too. Hotel check in staff were friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Not the cheapest option, but certainly worth it for last minute convenience.

reviews.title: Terrible experience ‚Äì they kept my $100 deposit
reviews.text: I had a very bad experience at this hotel. They required a $100 deposit as a guarantee, which they assured me would be returned ‚Äî but I never got my money back. At no point did they inform me that I could make the deposit in cash instead. The staff was unhelpful, the attention was poor, and the communication was terrible. I was never properly informed, and now I'm left with no refund and no support from the hotel. On top of that, trying to contact the hotel is nearly impossible ‚Äî you only get an automated answering system that is completely useless and never connects you to an actual person. I truly hope this issue can be resolved soon, but so far, it's been nothing but frustration and disappointment.

reviews.title: Zinga is a star!‚ù§Ô∏è
reviews.text: Zinga was exceptional. So welcoming and professional! Thanks so much. Wonderful wonderful vibes. Great professional team. Loved my stay and the way everyone makes you feel special.  When we arrived everything was perfect. Love Marriott!

reviews.title: Don‚Äôt stay here
reviews.text:
We were given a room on the 12th floor. We opened the door, it was dark but the security lock was on and someone shouted ‚Äústop!‚Äù
We quickly shut the door and went down to the front desk. 
We told them the room we were given had someone already inside!
The clerk said no there shouldn‚Äôt be anyone there.  We said definitely there was someone there. So either the front desk is entirely inept or someone is in that room illegally.
The manager who heard all of this, seemed nonplussed.  He did not see this as a security emergency as I did.   We could have been injured or worse if the occupant of what was supposed to be our room had a gun or was violent.  
We were given a new room on a different floor by the original clerk
The cleanliness was not great. There was hair on the bathroom counter and next to the toilet. 
Carpet and furniture and drapes are tired and  worn. 
The only thing going for this hotel is its location. I will not stay here again. 
Marriot brand has no excuse for poor service, or poorly maintained property.

reviews.title: This hotel is stuck in 1995 - and not in a good way
reviews.text:
If you ever stayed in a full service Marriott in the 1990s and want to travel back in time, stay here. This hotel is stuck in 1995, and not in a good way. The rooms are beyond tired. Haven‚Äôt been updated in 30 years. The only update to my room was the removal of the single serve shampoo/conditioner etc for the larger bottles fixed to the wall in the shower (and my shampoo bottle was completely empty). The room they originally checked me into was frigid. I called the front desk and asked them to send someone to fix my heat and they told me they would have to move me to a new room because the heat in my particular room was broken. So, why did you check in an Ambassador Elite Bonvoy member into a room that has no heat on a very cold day/night? Good question.

The concierge lounge is supposed to be reserved for Marriott‚Äôs best/loyal customers. The lounge here is truly abysmal. The milk cartons that they had in the lounge was spoiled (like the level of spoil that makes you throw up instantly). I told them this and asked for fresh milk for my coffee - so they brought me a slightly fresher carton of milk yet left all of the other cartons of spoiled milk on the little buffet. The full service restaurant is equally depressing. Dark, limited menu, very low quality food.

Bottom line - this hotel needs a gut renovation‚Ä¶or to be demolished and start new. Not much can save this place. I would avoid it.

google.address: Tampa International Airport, 4200 George J. Bean Pkwy, Tampa, FL 33607, USA

reviews.author: Leon Harry
reviews.text:
I just concluded my 3 night stay at Marriott at Tampa Airport. I've never stayed in a hotel within a Airport, what an awesome concept. The rooms are very well maintained and spacious. I'm a bit of a germaphobe, so cleanliness can make or break an experience for me and i had a pleasant stay. The staff were very friendly and accommodating aswell.

I attended a 3 day conference in their main conference room and we also had our breakfast & lunch meals there. They have nice restaurants within the air port. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others in the area for an overnight or extended stay.

reviews.author: Patrick Remington
reviews.text:
Austin at the front desk was incredibly gracious, engaging, and welcoming!
An amazing greeting after a long day of travel. The best greeting I've ever received as an Ambassador level traveler!

reviews.author: Alaska A
reviews.text:
GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! We had a long layover in Tampa and didn‚Äôt want to carry our luggage around so we could go to the beach for the day. Ana was very kind and helpful setting us up for the day. She was so nice, we had a stellar experience with her. Ryan was also really helpful and stored our bags for us and let us get in and out of our luggage as needed.
There‚Äôs a pool you can use and watch airplanes take off in. Even a fire pit outside to relax by. Jorge helped us get the fire pit going and was so very nice to us. There is also a gym and very clean and private shower you can use there.
Marriott very obviously treats their employees well because the service and hospitality was above and beyond. Thank you Ana, Ryan and Jorge for making our layover a lot more comfortable!!

reviews.author: Michael Maxson
reviews.text:
A update to hotel that is great but misses the mark
AC plug on only one side of the bed?
So nice to have new carpet, wall paper etc however bad patch, fill and repainted all doors sticks out
Mattress must have been around a bit.
Yellow aged electrical outlets stick out as well
You can visually see how bad of a job installation of all the new items.
The hotel management company or Marriott better plan capital upkeep as poor workmanship will show up quickly over time. Overall nice but not a perfect upgrade.

reviews.author: Maria Tinoco
reviews.text: Marriott is completely price gouging right now. With all the cancelled flights this week, the room rates suddenly jumped to $390+, clearly taking advantage of people who are stranded and in a terrible situation. It‚Äôs disappointing and unfair ‚Äî during times like this, hotels should support travelers, not exploit them. I expected better from a brand like Marriott.

tripadvisor.name: Tampa Airport Marriott
tripadvisor.address: Tampa International Airport, 4200 George J. Bean Parkway Tampa International Airport, Tampa, FL 33607-1474

reviews.title: Perfect for early morning departures!
reviews.text: The Marriott at Tampa International Airport is a wonderful option for early morning flights or late night arrivals.  I had a rental car to return the day before my early flight and wanted an easy hotel option.  Easy indeed!  After dropping off my car, I just had to take the airport tram for two stops, go down one floor, and walk across the airport 3rd floor to the Marriott entrance.  The front desk staff was so efficient, helpful, and pleasant... I was settled in my room within minutes.  The rooms have recently been updated so everything seemed fresh, bright, and there were plenty of outlets in smart places.  I would have enjoyed sitting outside with my laptop, but that area was under construction.  The lounge is small but cozy and relaxing.  My only negative was the lack of noise insulation.  I stay at airport hotels all over the world and am usually amazed at how quiet the aircraft noise it, but this hotel is not as soundproof... I could even hear the person in the room across the hall using their restroom.  But I would definitely stay here again!  In the morning, it only took me 15 minutes to haul my two bags to check-in, take the tram to the E terminal, pass through security, and settle into the Delta Lounge.  Great experience!

reviews.title: Great staff and location
reviews.text: I arrived and the staff is always so pleasant. I was able to check in for both rooms. The meeting room is perfect, well lit, and spacious. Angel was most helpful with AV. Patricia made sure everything in banquets was handled flawless from start to finish. Helena was also a huge part in making our meeting so successful. These two ladies did an amazing job. Michelle and Jerry at the desk are always two favorites to see. Norly in the restaurant area is also super pleasant and most helpful. Rooms are clean and spacious. They are truly the reason business and staff return. Best location ever without needing transportation.

reviews.title: Great Experience!
reviews.text: I flew up just for the evening from South Florida.  I had an event in the area to attend that evening, still needed to get some work done and take an early flight out the next day.  It hit all my requirements and needs.  Easy access from the terminal - great for arrival and departing.  Access to all landside foot options in the airport.  Great views of the runways, terminals.  A full gym I used both days I was there.  A separate entrance for uber, etc. which is great because the terminal gets REALLY busy.  My hotel room was ready on arrival and they have a bar/restaurant open late.  Room was comfortable.  Price is competitive, but a bit heavier than some Westshore properties  (less than downtown) but you're paying for convenience on this one.   Only downside is you sort of are landlocked a bit or feel like you're in a labryinth if you're trying to leave consistently and visit other areas of Tampa.

reviews.title: Exceptional Airport Hotel
reviews.text: I find this hotel to be super convenient when having an early morning flight out of Tampa.  The Tampa Airport Marriott is located right at the airport and a close internal walk to take the airport trams to your designated airline‚Äôs terminal.  Furthermore, the front-desk staff were super hospitable explaining the features of the hotel and the rooms were clean and well appointed.   Also, the hotel was quiet; did not hear any noise from the airport.  In terms of the amenities, I was pleasantly surprised as to how well equipped the hotel gym was with sufficient cardio-equipment along with other relevant gym equipment.   Additionally, the restaurant/bar was very good, both from a service and food viewpoint.   After staying here a few times, I can genuinely recommend this hotel, and it is even better when you have an early morning flight or a late arriving flight.

reviews.title: New = Better Marriott TPA experience
reviews.text: Newly renovated rooms, hallways, concierge lounge, and thoughtful touches in the rooms with everything new is always welcomed. The rooms very comfortable yet with the lounge chaise, it makes the room feel cramped. Other than that, I appreciate the thoughtful modern finishes, comfortable bedding provided a restful sleep. The walk in showers have not changed and provide a superb experience. It's nice to be greeted as a titanium elite member and most times put on the 6th floor. Shout outs to GinaMarie, Katie, Rose, keiser, Corrine, Michelle, Anna, Yadeira, Akeema, Jade, and Jackie. I love the valet parking here and everyting about the hotel. It would be nice if they had massage center and laundry since they have room for it plus the gym is the best gym anywhere. Thank you for always a super pleasurable experience.

reviews.title: Convenient For Early Flights
reviews.text: Have stayed here quite often when we have an early flight--it is convenient, reasonably priced especially if using points, staff are always friendly and helpful and they have a lounge that is open during weekdays and a restaurant that opens early for breakfast. All positives!

reviews.title: Great location makes flying a breeze
reviews.text: They do park and fly at $21 a night which is so convenient- you walk from hotel lobby right into the airport. There‚Äôs one restaurant bar, nothing special, and the club lounge is a bit small and they charge for alcohol; but the snacks are nice and the staff there are attentive and you can watch the planes moving from there. There‚Äôs room looks like it was recently refurbished and is nice.

reviews.title: Great choice for an early morning flight out of Tampa
reviews.text: This is perhaps the most convenient airport hotel we have ever stayed at.  It is a one minute walk to the airport, couldn‚Äôt be any easier.  Staff were great and room was clean.  Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Peace and Quiet at the Airport
reviews.text: I wasn‚Äôt sure how staying at the airport would work but staying here was a pleasant experience.  We were upgraded due to membership and it was a spacious room overlooking the pool and airport.  This however, gave us an amazing view of the sunset and a fantastic way to end our trip.  It was so nice to drop off our rental car and get to our room on the airport network.  Then, with an early flight how great to not have to return a car and just walk across a hall, take the close elevator to check luggage and on to our flight. The staff were super helpful with all our questions about the airport and car drop.  And a cheerful face at 3am is great anyway.  The room was spacious and peaceful and despite being close to the airport was quiet. Also loved the bed very comfortable.  I would stay again

reviews.title: Perfect spot if you have an early flight!
reviews.text: Had a 7:30am flight back to LAX so I stayed here after the Rays game. It makes it so easy to just walk down the hall to the airport, no need to catch a shuttle, and just check in.

reviews.title: Great hotel in the airport
reviews.text: Lovely hotel in the Tampa Airport. We arrived late tired from our flight and checkin in was easy. As an elite Marriott member we were upgraded to one of the new rooms and were asked our thoughts before leaving in the am to our cruise.

reviews.title: Still our favorite hotel in the Tampa area!
reviews.text: Having Titanium Elite status with Marriott Bonvoy, we travel often and experience many hotels.  After a bad experience at the Westin Tampa Bay (where we checked in and checked out the same day) the Tampa Airport Marriott cordially welcomed us for our 3-night stay in the area.  Corrine, with a friendly smile, gladly let us know there were rooms available.  She professionally worked with Cameron, the wonderful front desk supervisor who is the ideal hotel employee, to find a room that we would be happy with.  Although the 5th and 6th floors were being renovated, they made up for the lack of concierge amenities by providing a delicious free breakfast buffet in the Cafe and a few free appetizers in the Skyye Bar & Grille.  In the restaurants, Bonnie started our days off well with a friendly welcome and great service, and Victoria, Alan, and Norly provided positive energy and exceptional attention to detail as they served flavorful, artistically presented dinners and drinks.  Once again we realized why this is our favorite hotel in the Tampa area, and we look forward to visiting again soon!

reviews.title: Location, location, location
reviews.text: The location was fantastic for an early morning flight...easy walk to the terminal. Luggage carts are not available for self-service but require staff assistance (and tipping). Quiet. Nothing special except the location.

reviews.title: A new benchmark for hotel stays.
reviews.text: The hotel set a new benchmark for my hotel stays.  My room was quiet.  No kids running up and down the hall.  No slamming room doors.  No noisy neighboring rooms.  Not even and noise from airplanes taking off or landing.  The bath towels were high quality and did not exfoliate my skin when drying.  No stains in the carpets in the hallways from spilled coffee.  The front desk personnel were very nice and check-in and check-out were fast and efficient.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and there were good pillows.  Breakfast was hot and tasty.  I highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Filthy linens, poor housekeeping
reviews.text: The dirtiest Marriott we‚Äôve stayed in- no housekeeping for 2 days- had to call the front desk and ask for fresh towels. Linens in the bed were both threadbare and unkempt. Completely poor maintenance. Ice machine had an out-of-order sign on it- obviously for months‚Ä¶ stay in room 447‚Ä¶ will never stay there again. The ONLY thing good- it‚Äôs close to TPA airport. This place needs to close and do a serious cleanup. It‚Äôs filthy.

reviews.title: Convenience
reviews.text: Convenient for early AM flights; valet and porters are always helpful; check in was fast and friendly; room was spacious and comfortable but a bit noisy; lounge leaves a lot to be desired and prices have gone up. Will rebook next time have early flight.

reviews.title: Good Time, Bad Customer Service Experience
reviews.text: Really nice location for a Marriott hotel loved it. The valet manager is very rude!!! Also, manager Cameron needs to be re-trained and was very rude. Breakfast was so good, But I did enjoy my time in Tampa. I'll be back for sure. Tampa has the best Water Parks and Riverwalk was awesome

reviews.title: Great option to waste a few hours before your flight. Pool, showers and luggage storage included!
reviews.text:
Arrived at the airport 8 hours early after disembarking a cruise with all of our luggage. Couldn't check in for our flight until 4 hours before our flight so were looking for things to do in the airport to pass the time aside from paying for access to an airport lounge. Discovered that we could get a day pass to this Marriott with pool, gym/shower, business center access through Resort Pass for $55 per person. This included luggage storage as well. It was a short walk from inside the airport terminal to the check in at this hotel. Check in was quick, staff was pleasant and they safely stored our bags for the day. We were able to use the bathrooms and pool for the day which was great and not busy at all. The pool was nothing fancy, but it was refreshing.  We were told it was heated, but it was a bit on the chilly side. Plenty of seating and loungers in the pool area. Towels are included. It was nice to enjoy some extra sunshine on the last day of our trip. Once we were done at the pool, we went to the gym to shower. The gym was a decent size for this hotel with all the basics. There was one bathroom and one shower located inside the gym. No one was in the gym when we were there and we had the shower and bathroom to ourselves. Shower room included a large walk in shower and sink. There was a hairdryer in the shower room as well as fresh towels and washcloths. There was good quality shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the shower. Room got pretty steamy but otherwise no issues. The bathroom was large. Both areas were very clean. Check out was easy. We got our bags and it was a short walk back to the airport check in counters. 

I was pleasantly surprised and had a great experience in the few hours we spent here. Would definitely consider doing this again in the future. They also offer hotel rooms for the day but in limited quantity.

reviews.title: We did however like the hotel
reviews.text: Used the valet service at the hotel.  Got the car back 6 days later and it was covered with a fine dark dust and had bird dropping.  I'm thinking it was parked in a  open field. For what they charge it should have a roof over it. SAVE YOUR MONEY.  I am supposed to write  200 characters so this is the end

reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel
reviews.text:
My daughter and I stayed here for the Women‚Äôs Final Four. It was 15 minutes from downtown but right at airport. Since we had a very early flight time we wanted to be able to
Just get up and go. Literally attached to the airport.  It was a little pricey but I knew that when I booked. Hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. Would stay again.

reviews.title: Actually connected to TPA Airport!
reviews.text: Staying at this hotel often, we really enjoy the wonderful hospitality and the convenience of being part of the airport.  Since we have Titanium Elite status for Bonvoy, we are treated very well.  All of the employees are outstanding, professional, friendly individuals who create a welcoming environment for guests.  On our recent trip several employees gave especially top-notch service.  At the front desk, Jorge and Cameron made sure our room was to our satisfaction and explained the parking process.  Natasha in the Skyye Bar always gave a cheerful smile as she provided attentive service.  Cherylann in the Concierge Lounge provided a wonderful start to each day as she cheerfully and skillfully served a delicious breakfast.  The pleasant atmosphere and the easy access to flights, shops, restaurants, and car rentals keep us coming back to this hotel on our many trips to the Tampa Bay area!

reviews.title: Sometimes convenience is worth a premium
reviews.text: This hotel is ideal if you are arriving late and don't want to take a shuttle or taxi to an off property hotel.  The hotel is expensive compared to nearby airport hotels but sometimes convenience is worth a premium.  The hotel is a short 10m walk from luggage pick up area.  Hotel is older and worn.  Rooms were typical basic Marriott.  No USB plugs, old school coffee maker with small bathroom.  Room was clean and quite. Check in staff very pleasant and efficient.  Small snack shop of packaged foods was available at midnight.

reviews.title: Another good experience at the TPA Marriott
reviews.text: This is our go to hotel when we have an early morning flight out of TPA. Like our previous stays check in was a breeze and the Desk Clerk was polite and friendly. Room was very clean and the bed comfortable. Bathroom was also clean with enough towels and a great shower head. Recommend staying here if you have an early morning flight out of TPA.

reviews.title: Very satisfied customer.
reviews.text: Elias was very helpful. Car only had 4000 miles in it. Tampa has many toll booths but Elias explained how to get to Naples and avoid them.  We has a print out of our usaa collision policy so we avoided any issues. Shuttle was easy to find and in time. If you do your homework before had you can save big on car rentals.

reviews.title: Perfect for an early morning flight
reviews.text: Stayed one night in April 2024. Good hotel. A bit outdated. Beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Good service - we requested extra towels and they showed up within a few minutes. Highly recommend staying here if you have an early morning flight. Location is 10/10.

reviews.author: Taneila M
reviews.text: I booked a staycation as a gift to myself for valentines wknd.. let‚Äôs just say I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my choice!  I had the king deluxe room on the 19th floor.. it was VERY nice with a great view!  The lady at the front desk when i checked in ( i think her name was Sharice.. sorry if i spelled it wrong) was Amazing and Very Helpful..i ask for a fridge to be sent to my room and she made it happen quite fast my i say. The valet guys were Great especially JP and few others .. both day and night!  Everytime they saw me they spoke and joked with me as if they had knew me for years which made other ppl I‚Äôm sure question who am i lol.  Last night the weather was horrible and help an umbrella over me as i got into my car. Even when i was leaving this afternoon Abdul said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll see you soon Tee!‚Äù This was a great stay and the Staff and Valet guys made my wknd EVEN better!  I know for a fact ill be back!

reviews.author: Dee Perez
reviews.text: The stay was not bad, but it was not the greatest. When paying for a city view. I would expect most of the city but what we got was a large mural wall and then some of the city. It was pretty disappointing. Especially when paying over $200 for a night. When arriving I noticed there was no fridge. Which is very surprising. I called the front office they asked if we would like to be delivered one which was nice. But when it was delivered I guess they thought the best spot was to put it right in the middle of the hall and in front of the door, and when we asked if that‚Äôs where it would be placed. They had an attitude and had to answer as in we were dumb to ask that. Not sure why you would take the fridge out of the hotel in general. Everything seems to be a bit outdated, the couch had stains all over and the shower heads seem a bit rough with ridiculous amount of sounds when turning the water on. We just tried to make the best of it. The bar was nice and the food was great and the front desk also very kind. I personally don‚Äôt see my self ever booking again here. I would definitely bring the fridges back seems like a very important part for guests staying there.

reviews.author: LaQuanda Jackson
reviews.text: Enjoyed my weekend stay at the Laura. Room service was always available and attended to our needs. The room itself was amazing. I loved the layout and the views. However, the room should come with a microwave and refrigerator to better serve the guests.

reviews.author: Kathleen Pinson
reviews.text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Laura Hotel! The hotel decor was elegant, upscale, and stylish!! They had one of the friendliest staff I've ever experienced at a hotel.  I especially was delighted with my Amazing server Ms Toni! She was attentive, accommodating, and a pleasure each morning when I visited for breakfast. You all are blessed to have her on your team.

I look forward to staying here again on my next visit to Houston and will recommend this location to anyone coming to Houston!

reviews.author: Nina Hersher
reviews.text:
Otis at this location is truly AMAZING at supporting guests.
The hotel itself allows pets which I didn't know prior to booking and the pool is not heated but these weren't big issues for me, just depends what you want!

I went out to explore and the Houston Marquise just down the road has heated pools on the roof and is closer to a park but also much busier and frequently hosts conferences. The Laura is perfect if you want an upscale, quiet getaway in the heart of downtown!

reviews.title: One of the best valet experiences I had in recent time
reviews.text:
had an excellent experience with the valet service, especially Hakim. From the moment I arrived, he was professional, courteous, and incredibly efficient. He greeted me with a warm smile, handled my vehicle with care, and made the entire process smooth and stress-free.

Hakim went above and beyond to ensure everything was handled quickly while still being attentive and respectful. It‚Äôs rare to see someone take such pride in their work, and it truly made a great first impression of the hotel.

Thank you, Hakim, for your outstanding service ‚Äî you definitely deserve 5 stars!

reviews.title: Allen valet
reviews.text: What a professional! Felt safe bringing my vehicle to him, coming from a small town his service was extraordinary! I would be give him a promotion to keep work environment on point.

reviews.title: Valet
reviews.text: Great service from zaza and abdul car was  ready and prompt in time also loaded my car with luggage and helped me with my infant loading up

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Great Atmosphere! Hakim and the crew did a amazing job with everyone vehicles!

reviews.title: Excellent Downtown Houston Stay
reviews.text: Excellent stay. Helpful staff. Nice location in downtown Houston. Convenient.  Hood value. Very nice rooms. Great bar.

reviews.title: Dirty
reviews.text:
I stayed at The Laura Hotel following a late flight and went straight to sleep upon arrival. The next morning, I noticed visible stains on the bed sheets. Before leaving for a meeting, I informed the front desk. The gentleman I spoke with appeared concerned and assured me the issue would be resolved while I was out.
When I returned later that day, the bed had been made, but the same stained sheets were still on the bed. I again notified the front desk and was told it would be corrected. After returning to my room a second time, I found the bed had once again been remade using the same stained sheets.
At that point, I was informed that no accommodation could be made. The employee who identified himself as a manager became dismissive, as though addressing the issue was an inconvenience rather than a legitimate concern. Given the circumstances, I chose to book another hotel for the remainder of my stay.
I have contacted Marriott but have not yet received a response. Cleanliness is a basic expectation, particularly for a property marketed as a four-star hotel. As a Platinum Elite member who travels frequently, this experience was disappointing and not in line with the standards I have come to expect. I hope management addresses both the cleanliness and customer service issues so future guests do not have a similar experience.

reviews.title: Great hotel with friendly staff
reviews.text: Allen with valet provided professional, friendly service. Room was beautiful and decor in general within the hotel is beautiful. Dinner and brunch were excellent. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Allen valet
reviews.text: Allen showed me Great service, friendly and professional, I never felt rushed. Took care of me from the curb, waited for me to check in and walked me to my room.

reviews.title: Find another place‚Ä¶.
reviews.text:
Run. Do not stay there and do not give them any business. We held an event there. $30k later, they overcharged my credit card for another $15k and have promised for nearly a week to refund and it never happens. For the money involved and for what they delivered, especially the tying up of credit and lack of service, find another place.

We will not return for many reasons. There are plenty of nice hotels in Houston. Find somewhere else. This place is not worth anything the charge - from the rooms, to the food to the $33 cocktails. I beg you, find another place.

reviews.title: Allen Valet is THE BEST!!
reviews.text: Allen Valet was super friendly and his customer service is top notch! He always made sure our car was pulled around on time and he always had a smile on his face when we saw him.

reviews.title: Austin From New York
reviews.text:
The Laura Hotel in Houston is an exquisitely classy property with an amazing staff.  Guest rooms were well appointed and comfortable.  In all my years of travel, they by far had the most relaxing and refreshing bathrooms of any property I have ever stayed at.  The tilework is amazing, the stand in shower provided a luxurious feel and was very relaxing.  

Keisha, Sharika, Xavier and Otis at the Front Desk were incredibly hospitable, greeting me every time I walked through the lobby, checking in on my stay, and accommodating me with any requests I had through my stay.   

During my stay, I was visited my Monica and Dom (Bartender) who provided a personalized arrival gift which was incredibly nice and made for a pleasant evening! 

And of course‚Ä¶. Layla, my room attendant.  A very sweet young lady and would always smile and greet me throughout my stay.  I have also spent my years in hospitality management, including Director of Housekeeping, and have a deep appreciation for a housekeeping attendant who makes a nice tight bed‚Ä¶ Layla‚Äôs beds are the best I have ever seen, they were like art, so nice that I felt a little guilty undoing the bed to sleep, it was a beautiful bed presentation!  

Great hotel and kudos to the several leaders I had the opportunity to interact with including Erica (Rooms), Michael (ENG) and Adam (GM).  Thank you for a Great Stay and look forward to my next trip to Houston!

reviews.title: Thank you valet staff
reviews.text: Amazing experience with the valet. Had some issues with the app but Alan fixed it promptly and professionally. Great staff overall. Thank you Alan for your amazing customer service.

reviews.title: Overpriced for what it offers - and it does not offer much
reviews.text: Downtown hotel - you can hear train noise. My room has a smell as if someone was smoking in there. Hotel does not even offer free coffee. Just paid $7.5 for a cappuccino.. staying here for a conference. No perks whatsoever as titanium member.. anyways.. would not recommend

reviews.title: Allen from valet gave good recommendations!!
reviews.text: Staff is great and friendly, and the valet parking staff was friendly. Hotel is nice and clean. Location is great. I recommend this hotel for your next visit

reviews.title: Allen the Valet is the best!
reviews.text:
Had a great stay at the Laura Hotel.  All the staff were pleasant and professional.  If you're lucky enough to be greeted by Allen, then you'll be off on the right foot!
Will be coming back to the Laura every trip I make to Houston!

reviews.title: Distinct Experience_DvB
reviews.text:
Context of the stay was a staycation-style weekend stay. Easy book in and smooth check-in led into the relaxing stay at this chic property. Otis offered a warm greeting, thoroughly explain amenities and the property. He was a recurring presence throughout the weekend, each time working efficiently with a bright smile and sense of humor. 

The room was spacious. The design emphasized lounging over business activities, particularly the placement of a television above the desk. Anyone using that workspace would risk blocking the tv from anyone else or having the screen pressed into their forehead. 

I ate breakfast and dinner in the hotel restaurants. Great service and really flavorful food. 

Great nights rest and limited street noise. Valet parking is pricey, but there is a garage for self-park connected via bridge. A bit of a hike. I was able to find free street parking all weekend. 

I‚Äôm looking forward to another opportunity to stay there.

reviews.title: Shower
reviews.text: Great hotel. Outstanding service. A nice bar and restaurant and the best hotel shower. Several murals outside our room.

reviews.title: Allen Valet
reviews.text: Allen was the best Valet we have ever had. There was an issue with unlocking the car and another valet said he couldn‚Äôt unlock it, which took around 10 min. Then Allen stepped in and immediately ran to go to the car to try to unlock it and bring it to us within 2 minutes. Allen is fast, efficient, and very communicative. His boss should give him a raise. Seriously without him, we wouldn‚Äôt be on time with our business travel events. Thanks to Allen, he is the best!

reviews.title: Lovely Art Deco Hotel
reviews.text:
We stayed at The Laura last weekend for two nights. We stay in downtown Houston several times a year for family visits. 

This was our first time staying at The Laura but it won‚Äôt be our last. The interior of the hotel has a cool art deco vibe and our room looked like it had been newly renovated with upscale decor. The Front Desk, Valet, and Restaurant had great service and the food was some of the best we‚Äôve had in Houston!

The real star was Housekeeping. Our room was impeccably clean and honored any request for extra pillow, etc. promptly. I left some very expensive items in the room and was very concerned about this. Joshua Barklage, Housekeeping Manager, went out of his way to send them to my home in Dallas. All items arrived intact.

Thanks to everyone at The Laura. This is our new favorite hotel. We will be back again!

reviews.title: Derek the best Valet Guy
reviews.text: I want to shout out Derek that works with the Valet for the Laura Hotel. I went to a show and needed to go to my car that was a block down from the hotel and it was late at night. He took his time to walk with me and made sure I was safe going to my car and back. Super kind gentleman and wonderful customer service!

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel. You enter on the first floor with grand staircase, you go around to the right to the elevators on the 2nd floor. The 2nd floor has the check in desk, the restaurant and the bar. My room was on the 12th floor- beautiful views of downtown. I really appreciated the 2 free Nespresso pods and Nespresso machine so I could make coffee in my room. The room and bathroom were both very clean and sleek. The hotel is conveniently located near the metro and perfectly located in Downtown near everything. Loved the pool deck on the 5th floor with the views !

reviews.title: Good times
reviews.text: Had a great time at the hotel. Room was cute,  bar and restaurant too. Steven L. was great from the moment we arrived. If I‚Äôm back in the area, I‚Äôll make sure to stay here again.

reviews.title: Easter Weekend at The Laura
reviews.text:
My wife and I spent a long Easter weekend at The Laura Hotel, Autograph Collection while visiting our daughter in Houston. We booked our stay using Bonvoy points. From the moment we arrived, the front desk staff impressed us with their professionalism, courtesy, and enthusiasm.

The hotel was clean and comfortable throughout. We appreciated the thoughtful holiday touches, including Easter decorations and complimentary candy for guests. The rooftop pool area was also clean and well stocked with towels and loungers.

The only drawback was that the pool area felt a bit abandoned. There were no other guests or staff around, which may have been due to the holiday weekend.

Overall, The Laura delivered the quality and attention to detail I expect from an Autograph Collection property. I would gladly stay here again on a future visit to Houston.

reviews.title: I‚Äôve had better stays at different hotels
reviews.text: This hotel charged me three times with zero explanation and stopped answering the phone. Really liked the place, customer service leaves something to be desired. Sad outcome. Still don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm getting my money back from the second charge and no one will answer me on the third charge.

reviews.title: Date night stay!
reviews.text:
I usually stick to other Marriott properties, but I‚Äôm really glad I gave The Laura Hotel a try. CJ was amazing, she checked me in‚Äîher personality and helpfulness totally won me over and made the whole experience feel personal and welcoming.

We stayed in a junior suite, and the balcony was absolutely stunning‚Äîdefinitely one of the highlights of the room. The breakfast brunch was delicious with a great variety of options, and the rooftop pool had an awesome view that made it easy to relax and enjoy the city. 

Parking valet is a bit pricey but adjacent to the Laura is an overnight parking ~$23 and there is a walkway connecting to the The Laura. 

You also get Life Time gym access if you have Bonvoy Platinum and above. 

Overall, a great stay. I‚Äôll definitely consider coming back!

google.address: One Logan Square, Philadelphia, PA 19103, USA

reviews.author: Nicole Sprague
reviews.text: I highly highly recommend this hotel experience. Everytime we needed something they were attentive and quick. They brought up things you would normally need to go down and get yourself. The room we chose (the King Executive Suite) was beautiful and spacious. We traveled with a little one and the room provided plenty of space for the portable bed we brought. Room service was exceptional. Bell hops wer polite and quick. I have not one single complaint about this hotel and its staff. Thanks for a stress free stay in PHL

reviews.author: coco bp
reviews.text:
Our stay at this hotel was truly above and beyond. We were traveling with our dog, and Adriana, who helped us at check-in, was incredibly kind. She made sure we had a good room that was comfortable for us and our dog.

Anytime we needed anything, the housekeeping staff brought it immediately, and they even called back to make sure we had everything we needed. The level of service was exceptional. The parking service was also above and beyond.

Claire at check-out also helped us with everything we needed. We had a wonderful experience, and we will definitely be back and stay here again.

reviews.author: Phayssal Hammouche
reviews.text:
The front desk staff during the registration h were very competent and pleasant.

* Central location
* Nice view from the room
* Many amenities available (spa, pool, valet service‚Ä¶)

However, there was a lot of dust in the room.
The front desk staff on our first night promised a room change due to the dust, but later told us the hotel was fully booked.
I had to complain four times at the reception before receiving any compensation.

Overall, the hotel is very expensive for the level of service provided.

reviews.author: Adrianna Gill
reviews.text: I should have listened to my friend who referred to the logan as "meh. not worth the price." I stayed in an executive suite on a friday. I arrived several hours early and checked in. got a burger at urban farmer and went and hung out at the pool, thinking they might have robes and such for guests to use like the four seasons.. but no. the pool is also not as nice as the photos look but in the winter it is nice and warm. the lobby area is well appointed and makes for a nice area to kill time. lots of various seating and deco. I saw my room ready in the app, and to their credit, the digital key worked unlike a lot of the marriotts I've stayed in. Room was quite large, but not luxury. it was just.. a big hotel room. bland furniture, run of the mill light fixtures. vents and various areas of the room were caked in dust and years old grime. there weren't any small touches or amenities that made it feel like an executive suite I paid a good bit of money for. I upgraded bc I wanted to treat myself, but unless my only goal was to have room to do cartwheels in my room, I could have stayed in a standard room. plus side, bed was comfy and the drapes made it nice and dark to sleep in.

reviews.author: L H
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights as a couple's get away in a corner suite with a fountain view. The room was clean and comfortable but was oddly sparsely furnished. For the size of the room, I would have expected a small area to dine, perhaps a coffee table, and at least two chairs in the seating area. Staff was friendly and the food from Urban Farmer (dine in and room service) was fabulous. The service was just missing that extra spark that would have made this a five star experience. We had two people on the reservation, yet when we arrived, there was only a single robe in the closet. We called to request the robe and two blankets (no extra blankets in the room) but the gentlemen brought up only a single blanket. We ordered room service twice. The first time, they brought up a dining cart and silverware for 4 people but only one single packet of salt and pepper. The second time, they brought no dining cart (problematic because there is no dining table in the room) and only silverware for one person. We had no major problems and overall enjoyed our stay. I would definitely return for the food at Urban Farmer (fabulous brunch items, creative cocktails and outstanding steak) but the little misses by the hotel definitely made this miss the mark slightly.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay
reviews.text:
Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful.  
Latanya at the Front Desk provided exceptional service and is one of the most pleasant people we have ever had the pleasure of meeting at any hotel. She went above and beyond to make sure my husband and I had a fantastic stay and always had a smile on her face.  
Keith at the Commons Bar was friendly and professional. Gave great local recommendations and made great drinks. 
We had breakfast at Urban Farmer and sat at the bar. Service was great.  The smoked salmon Eggs Benedict was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had.  
We can‚Äôt wait to return to this hotel this next time we are visiting Philadelphia.

reviews.title: Stayed due to weather
reviews.text: Stephanie took care of our room & she could not be more pleasant. She had to stay overnight due to snowfall but her attitude was delightful.

reviews.title: Perfect location for an amazing stay!
reviews.text: What an amazing stay we had at the Logan! Perfect location-walkable to so many attractions-and such a classy place with fantastic service. We had a king suite with plenty of room for our kids in the living room area (my son did say that the couch bed was not so comfortable, but it‚Äôs hard to expect a lot from one of those) and the view of the fountain was spectacular. The indoor pool was such a nice cherry on top since my kids love to swim and it made for a great night activity. The valets were prompt and courteous and the desk staff was lovely-shout out to Latanya who provided excellent service when we checked in, and to Samirah who was helpful when we checked out! We will most definitely stay here again when we are back in Philly!

reviews.title: The staff are the highlight
reviews.text: I travel all around the world almost 80 days a year. I would never expect the staff to be this effective courteous, professional, and friendly at a chain Hotel. Congratulations on having a great team.

reviews.title: Good stay for Phillies game.
reviews.text: Stayed here for a summer Phillies game, close-ish walk to subway. All went well! Exterior is a bit industrial looking and unassuming. Room was good, bathroom large. Lobby was pretty. Pool was a bonus! Pretty centrally located in the city.

reviews.title: Walkable Center City Lux Stay
reviews.text: The Logan is in a wonderful location for access to center city. We were able to get around on foot for the whole trip which was important to us. The decor is very modern and elegant, and one day during our stay there was a wedding in the outdoor courtyard that made for a lovely atmosphere. Finally, we had lovely service from Samirah at the front desk, and really from every employee at the Logan.

reviews.title: Great city hotel!
reviews.text: We had a great experience. Samirah was great. She was very helpful at the front desk!  Hotel clean and located near the Franklin Institute and art at the Barnes Foundation!  We enjoyed cheese steaks at Shay‚Äôs Steaks. That was better than awesome!

reviews.title: Good 2 night Hotel
reviews.text:
Quiet room,319,despite location in busy location.
Very clean room despite showing its age.
High volume hotel,reception really efficient.
Valet parking very expensive,best to park yourself just round the corner.
Would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: WAS good - NOW?  Not so much.
reviews.text:
Stayed here for 3 nights on business in early Dec 2025, 1 Kind Superior.  Hilton Honors Diamond status.  Hotel location is very good.  Convenient to local museums, a 3-4 block walk to local shopping and dining.  Probably closer to a 20-25 minute walk to historic parts of Philly (ie, Independence Hall, etc). I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in the past and ALWAYS had excellent stays - hotel/room quality, experience with the staff, meals, hotel facilities, valet, etc were always top notch.  While it‚Äôs still a nice hotel, its quality if starting to suffer.

Pros:

-Valet area/arrival is always excellent.  The team they have in the valet area is the best of any hotel I have ever stayed at.  

-Lobby area is really pretty.  The decor and art work give off a higher-end vibe.  It‚Äôs been the same for yeas, so it‚Äôs getting a little bit tired, but it still looks nice.  Samirah (sp?) at the front desk was friendly during my encounters with her throughout my stay.

-Food/service at Urban Farmer is excellent.  I would argue one of the top hotel restaurants of any hotel I‚Äôve stayed at.  All the food is fresh and feels homemade.  Even something as simple as an English Muffin for breakfast was a treat.  

-There is a fitness center/pool/spa in the hotel basement that used to be good (more to come on that).

Negatives:

-No upgrade available.  Every stay I‚Äôve had previously here, I have always received an upgrade.  I can understand if the hotel is busy.  What was odd is the front desk clerk made an excuse that Comcast was in the hotel and they always get preference on the upgrades.  Ok thanks, but I don‚Äôt really need to know the excuse. (1st world problem I know).

-Parking was $72/day.  Even though I can expense it for business purposes, that price is excessive.  $50 or less is more appropriate.

-Room is really showing its age.  They have the same furniture that they‚Äôve had since it was the 4 Seasons.  That was YEARS ago, and it‚Äôs time for an update or refresh.  Furniture is OLD, and there were only 2 small drawers in the console under the TV.  Otherwise, there was no place to unpack and put your clothes (yes, I like to unpack).  

-Fitness center WAS nice in the past.  Again, it‚Äôs showing its age.  They have removed several of the treadmills making it a challenge to find an open one in the morning.  Fitness equipment was in a state of disrepair (smith machine did not work).  The 1st time I used the fitness center, there were no towels.  2nd time, no cups for water.  The fitness center COULD be nice (it‚Äôs a decent sized room and plenty of space for equipment) but it is poorly cared for and it shows.  

While the hotel is a Hilton/Curio property, the new management doesn‚Äôt seem to be focused on making a great guest experience.  There are some simple steps and investments they can make to return this hotel to a high quality status.  If you like good hotel food, stay here for Urban Farmer.  If you want a more upscale feel for a hotel, you may want to skip this hotel and look elsewhere.

reviews.title: Great corporate holiday party!
reviews.text:
We just hosted our holiday party at The Logan Hotel, and we had a wonderful experience, from planning to execution. Matt was a very responsive rep during the months of planning, and Wil and his team took very good care of us onsite. The food was good and plentiful, and the bartenders were quick and generous. I brought florals for the tables, and the hotel decorated the room for the holidays and it looked fabulous! Lots of tasteful trees and lights and buffet pieces. 
ALSO we had a retirement party in a different space at The Logan this summer and had such a good experience that we came back.

reviews.title: The Hilton has made my list of preferred hotel brands!
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay. I had a business event in downtown Philadelphia and chose The Logan as my place to stay based on location. Honestly, I really didn‚Äôt want to stay at a Hilton hotel based on past experiences with the brand of hotel. Hilton went downhill years back and I just took it off my list of preferred brands.  Well!  I‚Äôm here to say this hotel and staff were Fabulous!!  My room was beautiful and clean.  It offered updated furnishings and artwork. It was quiet believe it or not and The Logan is literally in the center of the city.  But the true highlight was ALL of the staff. From valet parking, porter services, housekeeping, front desk staff, restaurants, the food, etc. All were excellent!!  The Logan is the place to stay if you are in downtown Philly!  Hilton has made it back to my preferred hotel brands!!  Great job Hilton!

reviews.title: Great Stay as Always
reviews.text: Checked in for the night and had another amazing stay at the Logan. Great property with an even better staff that will go above and beyond to make you feel welcome, and will go above and beyond to accommodate requests. Samirah and Catherine assisted us and they were gems!

reviews.title: Dated rooms
reviews.text: The customer service was excellent- both at check in and check out.  However the hotel is pretty dated.  Rooms were very dark and had that black/navy carpet that makes you wonder if its clean.  The shower didn't drain and the tv did not work very well-  picture was very glitchy.  We only stayed one night so it wasn't worth the trouble to try and fix.  But better options in the area.

reviews.title: Nice amenities such as indoor pool  and room sizes, felt lacking in other areas.
reviews.text:
+Excellent heated indoor pool and fitness center 
+ Common areas and library looked nice 
+ Bathrooms were nice, and the room was spacious. 
+ room was quiet 

- This is an old hotel. The room carpets looked like a 2-3 star hotel(not what I expected for the price/ star class) 
- Front desk did not say ONE word during check-in. No welcomes, no instructions on wifi, breakfast options. Rude. Housekeeping was nice though
- They charged us $12.95 for internet per day. We were asked to sign up for hilton honors or risk a possibility of being charged. I paid $300 per night, you can provide this basic amenity for free.. 
-  Self parking was $54 a night.

reviews.title: Awesome Team
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful everything was clean and the atmosphere was chill . I also was able to try the spa which was really nice and my massage was great.

reviews.title: Superb staff
reviews.text: Thanks especially to Samirah at the front desk! She went above and beyond to meet all our ‚Äòlittle‚Äô requests!  Wonderful location for family reunion with multiple generations having a great time!

reviews.title: Family 2 day trip for funeral
reviews.text:
The staff was exceptional and the on-site restaurant was an added bonus.
I'd like to personally thank Samitah for help during check out.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: For visiting Philly for the first time ever, this will be the only hotel I will stay at. The area is nice and close to transportation for going to an eagles game. Also close to great food and views. I have to mention the staff at check in was OUTSTANDING! Claire and Sonia went above and beyond to ensure my first time in Philly was great! Also the spa was great Ryan was awesome as well. Can‚Äôt wait to stay here again!

reviews.title: The Logan-Center City
reviews.text: I stayed one night at The Logan. They offer valet services upon arrival for $45. Unless you know of any other place to park in the area, I would suggest that service. The hotel is within walking distance from a lot of things. "Love" park is a few blocks away, The Logan overlooks Logan Square and a WaWa is a short walk away as well. The amenities are nice if you plan to stay in. My only con is the commons area is not that big so it can get crowded and loud fairly quickly. Other than that, the room was clean, comfortable and I would definitely stay again. Check in staff was amazing!

reviews.title: Amazing! Stay here!
reviews.text:
My experience at The Logan was wonderful from start to finish. The hotel itself is stylish and comfortable, but what really stood out to me was the front desk team. Destiny greeted me with such warmth and professionalism that it instantly set the tone for my stay. She was attentive, helpful, and genuinely kind‚Äîqualities that make such a difference when you‚Äôre traveling.
Beyond that, the hotel‚Äôs location is perfect for exploring Philly, and the rooms were spacious, clean, and inviting. I left feeling really taken care of and would absolutely recommend The Logan to anyone visiting the city.

reviews.title: Outstanding job by Samirah, Senior Manager and Destiny, associate.
reviews.text: We were at the Logan for our son's wedding in September.  Destiny did a great job in confirming all of our rooms (we had many).  Samirah, the Senior Manager, did an outstanding job in making sure that all our rooms were accommodating our families, couples, and siblings.  They both made a demanding but special weekend stress-free and made sure that we had what we needed as part of the wedding party.   Thank you so much Samirah and Destiny.  Greatly appreciated!!!!

reviews.title: First time at The Logan‚Ä¶
reviews.text:
SAMIRAH IS THE BEST! She ensured that I had the best experience, accommodations, information about attractions and tours. Just a breath of fresh air in a climate filled with horrible customer service üò≠
I will certainly be returning to The Logan. This was my first visit and can‚Äôt wait to come back. Thank you Samirah for everything.

reviews.title: Underwhelming
reviews.text: Stayed here for a 2 night stay.  Highly unlikely to return. The hotel staff was not partucarly friendly. The rooms were dated and lacking in modern amenities.  One of the nights when we returned to the hotel the valet was nowhere to be found and we had to wait outside until he got back    The lobby bar is weak and the bartender was about as unfriendly as they come. The rooftop bar is rather uninviting as well as when you go up there every table has a reserved sign on it.  I will say that the bed was comfortable and the shower had good water pressure.  There are better options in Philly including the Sofitel where I have stayed before.

reviews.title: The most luxurious Hilton option in Philly, but is it the best?
reviews.text:
It had been many, many years since I had stayed at this property, when it was still the Philadelphia Four Seasons hotel. I vaguely remember that it was a very nice hotel way back then. And I had my third-quarter Amex Biz Platinum credits that needed to be used. So I booked a recent stay here, instead of staying at either the Bellevue Hotel or the Philadelphia Hyatt Centric, my original two choices for this trip.

The Logan is still a very nice property. It is, no doubt, the most luxurious Hilton property in downtown Philadelphia. The rooms were large, the hallways were large, the desk was large, and the bathroom was large, with marble and plenty of towel hooks. I stayed at the Canopy By Hilton Philadelphia Center City earlier this year, which may be the best reviewed Hilton property in Philly. The Canopy may be "newer" because it was more recently renovated, but the room and hallways there there felt more crowded because they were much smaller.

A few issues have prevented me from giving a five-star rating to The Logan. The TV remote control in the room simply didn't work. If I were visiting for more than one night (which I was not), I would have called the front desk to seek to have that issue fixed. Instead, I just watched what I wanted on my personal devices. A desk lamp just wouldn't turn all of the way off, so I had to unplug it from the electrical socket, which wasn't what I was hoping to do right before heading off to sleep. Also, one piece of the garment closet's opener/closer hardware was nearly pulled off the door and then left that way instead of being repaired.

On the bright side, the bed was comfy, the room was quiet, and the shower worked great. And although this is no longer a Four Seasons hotel, the building in which the hotel is located is still very nice.

As a Hilton Gold member, I opted for the $15 food credit at check-in, and then had breakfast at the Urban Farmer restaurant in the morning. I arrived for breakfast at 7 a.m. when the restaurant opened, and I had completed breakfast and charged the meal to my room (which is what you need to do to get the food credit applied) by 7:40 a.m. Later that morning, when I arrived at the front desk to check-out of my room after 11:30 a.m., nearly four hours later, the food charge for breakfast had still not yet made it to my account.

As a result, I asked the nice folks at the front desk to please make sure that my $15 food credit was applied to the breakfast charges, totaling slightly more than $30 with taxes and tip, once they posted, since I wouldn't be able to confirm that had happened once I was long gone from the hotel. Unfortunately, for whatever reason, when the breakfast charge ultimately posted, the hotel failed to apply my $15 food credit. This really made me angry.

As a result, I had to call in to the hotel's front desk a few days later, and since the whole exercise ended up taking way too much time, locating my invoice in the Hilton App (which took multiple tries), tracking down the hotel's phone number, and speaking to multiple different people at the hotel about the issue, I asked that they simply remove the entire breakfast charge from my account as a customer service resolution. The supervisor in charge agreed to do that, and the full amount of the breakfast charge was later credited back to my credit card.

Apparently the issue with the untimely posting of breakfast charges from the hotel's main restaurant is something that The Logan regularly experiences, and if it causes Hilton Honors members with status to lose out on their food credits, as happened to me, the hotel would end up making far more money than it cost the hotel to simply credit back the cost of my one day's breakfast.

Hopefully they can fix the issue and have learn their lesson here -- namely, that in the hospitality and service industries, a hotel shouldn't make it impossible for valued, repeat Hilton-brand customers to obtain the small benefits of their earned status without having to jump through multiple hoops and waste a whole bunch of time after having checked-out.

Because the hotel physically is the nicest Hilton property in Philadelphia, I am definitely planning to give this property another chance. Hopefully my next visit won't present these same issues, so that I will feel comfortable making this my Philadelphia Hilton hotel of choice into the future.

reviews.title: Do not recommend
reviews.text:
I would never come back here. I spent my birthday weekend here, having to switch rooms when they gave us a room with chipped paint hanging from the ceiling. My boyfriend and I tried to watch a movie until we saw a lone going down the tv screen. I was able to get the rooms switched but since we had to move all of our stuff we also needed balloons moved because my boyfriend surprised me with a decorated room.
My boyfriend went to the front desk and one of the staff told him to tell the bell boys outside and they would take care of moving the balloons for us. We were heading out to dinner and couldnt be late. My boyfriend asked the bell boy outside and he said ‚ÄúWe dont usually take care of that‚Äù Once we got back to the room the balloons were never moved. Saturday we noticed this weird residue on the comforter and I found a ripped hole in the sheets.
The best birthday gift would to get my money back after not getting room service the entire weekend. For this to be the Hilton hotel, you would think this would be a good hotel to choose, but its not. Do NOT recommend.

reviews.author: Beatrice Doyle
reviews.text:
The W Seattle is amazing üòç
The staff are outstanding. Friendly, happy, and considerate.
We went to the Bar and Restaurant, The Living Room. Food and drinks are amazing. They're very generous with the cocktails.
Our view from our suite the Jackson suite (not Michael Jackson) is of the city with Mt. Rainier in the background.
Also, the murals are beautiful üòç‚ù§Ô∏è They depict the beauty of African Americans in such a beautiful way.
I would highly recommend the W Seattle.

reviews.author: Jonathan Pape
reviews.text:
I was really excited to stay in a W Hotel since I have heard so much about it.   I booked a ‚Äúspectacular room on a high floor with a city view‚Äù and I received a ok room with a ok view.  I am really disappointed. I booked through Booking.com and when I called Marriott to complain they said they don‚Äôt upgrade rooms booked on 3rd party sites.

The W Hotel has a good rep but the actually rooms are equivalent to a Holiday Inn. Definitely not worth it.

reviews.author: Laurie G
reviews.text: Just got back from spending three nights here.  We would go back.  Location was great and was within walking distance of many places.  Front desk staff were awesome. Shower was strong and hot.  Details such as the light fixtures in the room were fun. Seating in the room was comfortable and fun!  Loved the changing floor mat in the elevator!

reviews.author: London Gagnier
reviews.text: I‚Äôm staying at the W hotel in Seattle & was  here for my friends birthday. I‚Äôve had amazing service during my stay. I spoke with a woman named Angela who was working the from desk. Me & my friends had called pretty late in search for some champagne & Angela sent us a complementary bottle. She was beyond a sweetheart. I really enjoy this hotel & would absolutely come back

reviews.author: Taylar Wade
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights for my husband‚Äôs bday and it was a highlight of the trip. If you‚Äôre a platinum elite member you will get so many benefits. They upgraded our room to a suite and we walked in to a bottle of champagne, a card signed by all the staff, 2 free tickets to the Ferris wheel and a disposable camera. The views were amazing and we were credited $14 a night to spend at the hotel. This W location really exceeded my expectations and I will be coming back on my next trip to Seattle. Also, the beds were incredibly comfortable

reviews.title: 2 in a party is Large
reviews.text:
Walked over to visit the W‚Äôs hotel bar and stumbled upon what seemed like a birthday party bash upfront. There were no signs indicating the party was private so I ordered two drinks for a friend and myself. I closed the tab immediately. 

‚ÄúLarge party gratuity‚Äù was added onto the check. Apparently it was assumed we were there for the birthday party? Mind you, this is a hotel bar, not a restaurant. 

Shady business practice. Never again.

reviews.title: Awful customer service.
reviews.text: After picking my car up from the $75 a night valet we noticed a dent and scratch on a brand new car. After 1 month of poor communication they decided to not pay for the damage. The manager at the W stated they have nothing to do with the parking.

user.userLocation: South Haven, Van Buren County, Michigan

reviews.title: Friendly environment
reviews.text:
We stayed 2 night over new year eve and also celebrated our daughter's birthday. The number 1 positive is hospitality! Tania our receptionist was friendly, the caf√© stagg were very accommodating making our breakfast experience great. Finally Ian made our stay wonderful by going above and beyond to prepare the room to celebrate our daughter's birthday. Prepared balloons, cupcakes and mini donuts that surprised our daughter. The best bit was a signed card from the staffs, it really made it special. It was a really wonderful stay mainly due to the staff.

Affitionally the location was great, central to downtown activities. Trace market food had a Hawaiin twist which was really good and creative like a home made spam.

reviews.title: Mediocre stay for business in Seattle
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights for work. I found the front desk staff to be rude and the property to be in poor condition. I used SNAs and was able to get a suite but was told they couldn't give me 4pm late checkout. The food for breakfast was expensive and wasn't very good. No welcome amenity provided for Ambassador Elite members.  I had to fight to get breakfast made available to me as a welcome choice. I think there are better options in Seattle and I wouldn't rush back.

reviews.title: Easy, comfortable and beautiful with quality service
reviews.text: Welcoming service and staff. Beautiful design especially with the bar and fire pit/place. Our room was quiet and comfortable; good mattress and shower. One complaint! At a higher end hotel, shouldn't you have better quality toilet paper than a ...Hampton Inn? C'mon guys, step up your quality control in purchasing.

reviews.title: Expected better
reviews.text: This property is fine with no major complaints but the W brand is supposed to be part of Bonvoy's "luxury" hotels. This did not feel like luxury. It was typical W in many ways - lighting, lobby, upscale bar - but it also had some of the elements that I do not necessarily like especially a staff that seems to be bothered by anything you ask them. It was definitely off-putting when one of the front desk agents threatened that we would be charged $50 if we did not return the umbrella. I understand that guests should return items they borrow but that reminder can come in a friendly way, not as a threat. The valet was also never there when we drove up which was annoying. Lastly, the fitness center was small with old, well worn, and missing equipment - I wonder how much those guests were charged :)

reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, bellman needs help
reviews.text: The rooms are nice. The croissants in the breakfast restaurant delicious. Where they fail is picking up your luggage after a Seahawk game. Everyone checked out in the morning, had the bell station hold luggage. After the game all collecting at the same time. I counted 15 people in the lobby waiting on luggage, including a guy frantic he was going to miss his flight‚Ä¶.. after waiting 15 minutes. He got his, and I‚Äôm still waiting. One bellman to 15+ guests. They should have the General Manager down here getting our luggage. Do better W.

reviews.title: Overpriced for a moderate hotel
reviews.text:
Our group of eight couples booked four rooms at the W Hotel for a stay on 9/6/2025. While the hotel itself was nice and the staff was friendly, the extra fees quickly soured the experience.

The room rate was $400 ($450 with taxes and fees), which seemed inflated‚Äîlikely because of the Seahawks game that weekend. Parking was another frustration. There‚Äôs no nearby self-parking, so guests are forced to use the W‚Äôs garage. When we arrived, a sandwich board outside advertised overnight parking at $15 less than the $68 listed online. Despite this, valet charged us the full $68. Since we were using Uber during our stay, we had no choice but to leave our cars with valet.

The rooms were modern and clean, but the basics were lacking. Each room only had two bath towels‚Äîfine for a solo traveler, but inconvenient for couples. The pillows were flat and worn out, and the bed felt old and saggy, leaving several of us with the sense that our feet were higher than our heads. At least one couple in our group seemed to have a newer bed, but the majority agreed that the sleeping setup was poor.

The in-room fridge was packed with overpriced drinks and snacks, leaving no space for personal use. Removing anything triggers an automatic charge. After checkout, things got worse. While driving home, I received an invoice showing two valet charges at $68 each, despite the lower rate advertised at check-in. One of the charges was eventually removed after I called, but the other remained. On top of that, we were billed a $28 ‚Äúdestination fee,‚Äù which supposedly covered a $14 per-person drink credit and a Ferris wheel ticket offer we received at check-in. It‚Äôs essentially a forced bar credit, whether you want it or not.

In the end, the W looks great on the surface, but guests should expect to pay at least 25% more than the listed rate once hidden charges are factored in. For the same price point, there are nicer, more transparent hotel options in Seattle.

reviews.title: Good base for visiting the harbour area
reviews.text:
Short one night trip with family 

Hotel well located for the harbour and market

Helpful staff at check in

Rooms of reasonable size and comfortably furnished

We didn‚Äôt have a chance to check out the gym or restaurants

reviews.title: Nice Staff, Decent Room, Close to Subway and Waterfront
reviews.text: The W Seattle is a mixed bag: all of the staff were very nice, our room was in decent condition, and it is within walking distance of the waterfront and a light rail station (Symphony -- where you can get a train to/from SEATAC airport but takes almost an hour from terminal to hotel), but it more of a 3-star hotel than a "luxury" hotel, there is no apparent place to park your car for a few minutes while you are unloading your bags and checking in, and the valet parking is a mess. Bottom line: if you get a cheap rate, don't expect a 4- or 5-star experience, and don't have a car with you, it is worth considering staying here.

reviews.title: W was a nice visit, but needs a room refresh.
reviews.text: Great hotel with a need for an update. Clean, quiet rooms with good, quiet temperature control. The cafe was a surprise for us. Good cocktails, nibbles and morning breakfast. Free coffee in the morning.

reviews.title: Not great.
reviews.text:
I assumed W would be a great hotel in a good location downtown. We booked 3 rooms for our family months in advance. 

When we arrived (4pm) the rooms were in different levels, one was not ready. 

The food we ordered in from room service was terrible and we didn‚Äôt eat it.

Lastly, we asked for more blankets ( we had a baby in a crib), they said they are all out of blankets. 

Not sure how they run this W.

reviews.title: Terrible Experience
reviews.text: BE AWARE: bad experience at the W Seattle valet parking (no self parking) Our car charger adapter was left hanging still plugged in at the outlet when they pulled our car out of the parking. Parking attendant does not even know how to take it out of the port. He keeps yanking the adapter and forcing to open/close the port (I did let this slide, no big deal) however, the next day, at check out we were informed that the car was damaged the night before. They did not made us aware the moment it happened; instead they waited the next morning to tell us about it. They should train their staff better and make sure they know how to drive different types of car. We always stay at Marriot hotels but because of this bad experience we won‚Äôt be coming back to this specific hotel.

reviews.title: A Consistently Comfortable Business Stay
reviews.text:
I‚Äôve stayed at the W Seattle over 10 times for business, and it continues to be my go-to hotel in the city. The front desk team is consistently warm, professional, and genuinely hospitable ‚Äî they always make check-in feel personal, not transactional.

The rooms are reliably clean and comfortable, with great beds and all the essentials for a work trip. While the decor is starting to feel a bit dated compared to other W properties, everything is well-maintained and functional. Housekeeping does an excellent job every time.

What really stands out is the in-room dining. The menu is thoughtful and high-quality, and the in-room dining staff are prompt, friendly, and efficient. It makes winding down after a long day that much easier.

More than anything, I always feel at home when I stay here ‚Äî a rare and appreciated feeling for frequent travelers. Looking forward to my next visit.

reviews.title: Uncomfortable
reviews.text: The most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in, my back would have been better off sleeping in the floor or the sofa. Thin duvet, flat pillows and ripped sheet, plus a noisy AC unit which turns on and off just as you think you might eventually sleep.

reviews.title: GreatTripToSeattle
reviews.text: Great hotel with the most friendly staff.  Lauren, Drew and Sheila were incredibly helpful and always smiling willing to go the extra mile to help.  Room at the 7th floor was nice.  Our view to the parking garage was not an issue since we are hardly in our room.  Noises coming from the parking garage, usually at 03:00 AM, can be bothersome if you are a light sleeper.  The W is located at a walking distance to most attractions. Public transportation is amazing; you can get anywhere in the city with less than $3.00.

reviews.title: Very Good, Standard W Experience
reviews.text:
The W Seattle achieves all the marks of a premium hotel and is clearly a W, but doesn't shine within the W portfolio as some of the newer W's do (e.g., Philadelphia, Rome). Downtown Seattle is a bit of a mess with homelessness and what feels like very few tourists, so this doesn't add to the situation, but the W does feel like a lovely oasis in Downtown Seattle.

Upon checking in I was warmly greeted and thanked for being an ambassador guest. I was upgraded to a Studio Suite, which is by no means a suite, but still a decent room. As an Ambassador you get free breakfast, which was $40 a day that was available in the restaurant or as room service. Breakfast was great. I ended up having room service each day, and keeping it under $40. 

The room had enough space, but nothing felt as unique as the newer W's, though the views were good. The bathroom was very eh, achieving what I would expect out of a renaissance, not a luxury brand. The bath/shower were a combo and it didn't have any sexiness to it!
