All-in-all if you're looking for a Bonvoy property in Seattle this one does the job well, and at a decent price point. I think it achieves all the aspects of a good premium hotel, but doesn't really stretch to be a luxury hotel. I wish it did, but also, that's not really what the Seattle market seems to be looking for.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text:
We booked a day room before our late flight back. The lobby was full of check in at one person working. We waited quite some time to get our room. I did not feel the desk staff cordial whatsoever. The room was very nice, spacious and comfortable. We had the room until 3 PM. At 20 till there was an aggressive knock on our door. I opened it to hear a staff say ‚Äúwhen are you leaving?‚Äú I replied at checkout time and shut the door.
The location is quite a walk to the riverfront. 
Certainly not be ‚ÄúW‚Äù hospitality that we are used to. We were not recognized as being members.  I would not stay at this site again.

reviews.title: Recent Stay
reviews.text:
Location: Uber/Lyft is expensive coming from the airport. Take the Link light rail to the Symphony station. It‚Äôs a 3 min walk to the W, however, it will be uphill so be prepared but it‚Äôs definitely doable. The hotel is walking distance to the waterfront, Pike Place, and Westlake shopping area. It is about a 30 min walk to the Space Needle. 

Room: Spacious and comfortable bed. I was disappointed by the amount of dust on the desk, walls, and fixtures. Also for it being a W hotel (luxury) I was expecting a robe to be in the closet but it was not. 

Overall it is a good hotel but not the luxury standard I am use to. The staff member at check in was friendly and acknowledged my status level.

reviews.title: Great location for visiting the attractions in downtown Seattle
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for a 2 night stay due to its central location. We arrived off a cruise ship early in the morning, and we just expected to drop our bags off. However, the receptionist said whilst he did not have the corner suite we had against our name, he did have one ready on the 12th floor, which we accepted. The room was spacious and well appointed. The room was relatively quiet during the night with the exceptional occasional sounds of emergency service sirens. It did not disturb sleep thought as the beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was cafe style with you ordering at a counter and the food/drink delivered to you by a member of staff. Checking out was very simple and efficient, and they have facilities to store luggage. I would highly recommend this hotel.

user.userLocation: Whitley Bay, Tyne and Wear, England

reviews.title: Convenient location for a busy stay
reviews.text:
I stayed at this hotel in May for business reasons and overall had a decent experience. Some brief pros and cons below. I'd be overall happy to stay again. 

Pros:
- convenient location
- allowed a later checkout 
- spacious room 

Cons:
- there was a gym but no sauna, which is something that's always nice
- had a few bottles of water for free in the hotel room but also had a few bottles marked $5. Just felt a little tacky
- very long room, so configuration was a little odd 
- check-in took awhile

reviews.title: Great hotel and centrally located to many attractions.
reviews.text: Quick one day trip to Seattle prior to heading north to Vancouver and selected the W Hotel based on price and location. I have never stayed at a W Hotel. We arrived on an 8 am flight and used the light rail system to get to downtown and and used the Symphony station. it was 2 blocks from the hotel and cost $3 per person. Light rail for the win. We arrived at the hotel shortly after 9 am and our upgraded room wasn't available and the front desk staff assured us the room was worth the wait. The staff shared some great suggestions for brunch and we set out to explore. The hotel texted once the room was ready.  The hotel was amazing and the upgraded room was worth the wait.  The bed was comfortable and the location was central and within walking distance for a lot of attractions. I would 100% stay at the W again.

reviews.title: Great Stay!!
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful and historic. The staff was so personable and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We loved Drew, Ian, and Hannah at the Front Desk and enjoyed Nick at the bar! Great recommendations from all. Great city!!!

reviews.title: Great Service!
reviews.text: The service at the W in Seattle is second to none. Every single staff person welcomes you with a smile and is ready to help with whatever you may need. I'd like to make a special shout out to Tyler for going above and beyond to make sure I had a great stay and everything I needed.

google.address: 909 N Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60611, USA

reviews.author: Rick Skaf
reviews.text: I stayed in room 1024 last weekend. I was in town for the Lake F3 Half Marathon. This was my first time staying here. I have stayed at the Hilton Suites around the corner many times. I thought that I would stay at  the Westin this time. First, the hotel is in a nice part of town close to bus routes and the Red Line. The rooms are in need of a renovation. I‚Äôve stayed at other Marriott properties the past few months and once this place gets the rooms renovated it will be nice. My only complaint about the bathroom in my room was no grab handles in the tub area. I wanted to take a bath after my race and it was challenging getting up out of the tub without getting hurt. The lobby area is nice. I ate at the breakfast buffet one morning, I wasn‚Äôt too crazy about the food selection. The pancakes were tiny and hard as a hockey puck.  They should have bigger pancakes or maybe waffles.

reviews.author: Engjell Berisha
reviews.text:
The rooms do not represent the Westin brand well. As someone who often stays at Marriott properties and looks forward to the Westin product this hotel falls short. It is my least Westin to stay at and that is because of the rooms. The hotel is dated and in need of renovation. I have stayed her many times and each room smells like it‚Äôs been dowsed in fragrant cleaners to get rid of smell. The carpets and fixtures need to go. The bathrooms are also quite tired. Water takes quite a long time to heat up in some of the rooms and the shower heads leak at their bases. Lastly the windows are thin; such that you can hear the street noise readily. Admittedly the rooms are otherwise clean and the beds comfortable.

On the other hand the hotel staff is exceptional. They are genuinely kind, courteous and professional. Each time I check in they are accommodating and seem happy to be there. Amongst the great staff, April stands out as truly exceptional. Upon checking in on a recent stay I had requested a king room. I opened my door to see two beds and heard the phone ringing. It was April, she was calling to let me know they had made a mistake and she wanted to bring up a card for a room with a king bed so I wouldn‚Äôt have to go back downstairs. That‚Äôs five stars services right there. Employees like her deserve to be recognized and valued! She is exceptional.

reviews.author: Jwxzkgf Ghtdwv
reviews.text: I visit this hotel several times a month for business, and it never ceases to impress me. I‚Äôd like to give a special shout-out to Candice at the front desk; her bright and friendly morning greetings always start my day on a high note. Whether staying on the city side or beach side, the views are stunning‚ÄîI especially love the night view of  modern skyscrapers and the early morning beach view. Service requests are handled promptly, and the rooms are always spotless, leaving me with zero complaints after many stays. Plus, the location is perfect for balancing both shopping and relaxation. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Heather Wallace
reviews.text:
My stay at The Westin Chicago River North during the recent BRICs conference was exceptional and truly elevated the experience of attending a demanding professional event. The hotel perfectly balances high-level business functionality with top-tier personal comfort and an unbeatable location.
‚ÄãThe most crucial element for a conference attendee is a restorative night's sleep, and The Westin delivered completely. Despite being in the heart of a bustling city, the rooms were incredibly quiet, providing a true sanctuary from the city noise and the day's events. This was paired with the signature Heavenly Bed mattress, which lives up to its name‚Äîit was supremely comfortable, ensuring I woke up refreshed and ready for each day's sessions.
‚ÄãBeyond the room, the hotel's location is its greatest asset. The area is phenomenal and highly walkable, making it easy to transition from professional duties to urban exploration. The hotel is situated just steps from the vibrant Chicago Riverwalk, offering immediate access to stunning views and evening strolls. It's also a pleasant walk to the beautiful shores of Lake Michigan, providing a perfect contrast to the city's energy.
‚ÄãThe River North and Magnificent Mile neighborhoods boast an abundance of great eatery options within minutes of the lobby. From high-end dining and steakhouses like RPM Steak and Smith & Wollensky to casual spots and Chicago classics like The Purple Pig and Eataly, the culinary choices are endless and easily accessible on foot.
‚ÄãThis Westin location is highly recommended for any professional visiting Chicago, offering tranquility, comfort, and the best of the city right outside its doors.

reviews.author: Bert Green
reviews.text:
While in a great location, this is an old, dated hotel.  The staff is great overall, but at times seemed overworked.  My main issue is the ‚Äúsewer‚Äù smell that permeates several rooms and floors.  The first room we checked into (10th floor) was so awful We literally had to wait outside‚Ä¶ When a housekeeping manager came up, she immediately smelled it, and said that she will take care of it and move us to a different room.  Our next room, the ninth floor, was tiny!  Literally one of the smallest hotel rooms I‚Äôve ever stayed in.
It smelled better, but not great.
The bathroom was tiny and old, The carpets are kind of dirty.  It was depressing.
The hallways have an old, dusty, musty, smell, with a bit of sewer mixed in.
There were also some issues with our bill (Including a $17.95 ‚Äúcoffee cart‚Äù fee!)
Front desk was somewhat helpful, But overall, this wasn‚Äôt a great experience.
There are many other Marriott properties nearby that are probably a better choice.

reviews.title: Great stay!
reviews.text: Came to visit friends and decided to get a room for myself. I‚Äôve stayed here before and happily stayed again. Check in was easy and the gal was very nice. Not a fan of the resort fee, even if you do get half back a day to use on property. I did need to get back in my room after check out and asked the maid to open but she said she couldn‚Äôt. That was annoying but I appreciated the extra security knowing she wouldn‚Äôt just take my word for it that it was my room. It was a breeze to go to front desk and to let me back in for a moment. Location is great!

reviews.title: Exceptional # Huge Improvement
reviews.text: My previous stays, those in the past, were not so great, but this one was far better, as it seems, this particular property has been seeking for improvement, and they actually did better. Hotel grounds, facilities and the rooms are good and as they're supposed to be, definitely matches Westin standards. Member of staff has been friendly and supportive, all good.

reviews.title: Malodorous
reviews.text:
While in a great location, this is an old, dated hotel. The staff is great overall, but at times seemed overworked. My main issue is the ‚Äúsewer‚Äù smell that permeates several rooms and floors. The first room we checked into (10th floor) was so awful We literally had to wait outside‚Ä¶ When a housekeeping manager came up, she immediately smelled it, and said that she will take care of it and move us to a different room. Our next room, the ninth floor, was tiny! Literally one of the smallest hotel rooms I‚Äôve ever stayed in.
It smelled better, but not great.
The bathroom was tiny and old, The carpets are kind of dirty. It was depressing.
The hallways have an old, dusty, musty, smell, with a bit of sewer mixed in.
There were also some issues with our bill (Including a $17.95 ‚Äúcoffee cart‚Äù fee!)
Front desk was somewhat helpful, But overall, this wasn‚Äôt a great experience.
There are many other Marriott properties nearby that are probably a better choice.

reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, not super fancy but nice, clean and safe
reviews.text: Clean and safe, no frills, friendly bellhops, great location. Comfortable bed, large bathroom. Easy walk to just about everything you need, L was just a couple blocks. Lots of Cubs fans staying there for the Wild Card series. Would stay again.

reviews.title: Great stay!
reviews.text: Great location!! We had a very pleasant stay here. April at the front desk was amazing!! She was very personable and helpful!

reviews.title: It was a so-so experience...
reviews.text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Westin Michigan Avenue Chicago for three nights. Overall, I'd give the hotel a "B". The location was fine and the room was clean but the friendliness of the staff was very mixed, some staff members were excellent, others need a real tune up, particularly at the front desk.

Would we stay there again? Probably not.

reviews.title: Nope
reviews.text: Upside, restaurant adjacent/owned by the Marriott. Otherwise, a dreary resting place for those seeking a way out a painful existence.

reviews.title: Great Weekend in the Windy City!
reviews.text: Spent 4 days in the Windy City and stayed 3 nights at the Westin.  The front desk and the housekeeping staff were great, our room was cleaned each day.  We used the Club level Lounge for breakfast on Friday morning, eggs, oatmeal, sausage and assorted bagels and rolls.  Our room was on the 25th floor and had a view of Lake Michigan!  We will definitely stay here again!

reviews.title: Not so good experience.
reviews.text:
Upon arrival, it was already past 10 p.m. The hotel assigned me an accessible room on the fourth floor. As a result, both the room itself and the bathroom were very spacious. However, due to the low floor, there was hardly any natural sunlight. The bed itself was very comfortable, but the other furniture showed noticeable signs of wear and tear, making it look old.

What was most unpleasant, however, was that the room was very close to the staff supply room. As a result, I often heard the sound of items being moved and things bumping into each other. In addition, the noise from the water pipes was very loud, waking me up several times in the middle of the night and affecting my sleep quality.

On a positive note, the hotel‚Äôs location itself was excellent.

reviews.title: Typical Westin, great location, comfortable and quiet, nothing special.
reviews.text: Rooms here are fine.  Comfortable beds, typical Westin, location is great for Water Tower/Architecture/Michigan Ave shopping, etc.  Staff is nice, can usually get early check in.  It's a very large hotel.  We don't do much except sleep and shower here, it's great for that.  Convenient, clean, and quiet.  Can't speak to the restaurant, just got coffee/pastry at the lobby Starbucks each day.

reviews.title: Worst front desk person Jenieca
reviews.text:
I am here for a 3 day conference. Checked in on Tues Sep 9th 6pm.
I had to deal with the worst front desk person at a Marriott property. Front desk girls name is Jenieca. She was so rude. She was rushing to get rid of me. I came after a long flight. I was tired. I had a few of questions about restaurants & conference rooms etc. She was not ready to answer any of the questions. I turned around look behind me to see whether there are any other guest waiting. There was none. At the same time other girl who was very sweet & friendly to the guest she was helping. I wish I had her. 
Jenieca IS NOT FIT TO WORK THE FRONT DESK.
Some people are not made for that. She should be working back of the house. She may be racist. Or she was getting off her shift. I blame the management for hiring her. One employee could bring reputation of your establishment. I am a Hilton honors and Starwood member. 
This bothered me so much. I got up at 5am to write this.

reviews.title: Chicago hotel
reviews.text:
The hotel is in a good location.
It had good food options like Starbucks.
The rooms were good.
The service was good.
Definitely recommend this hotel

reviews.title: Unjust $350 smoking charge!
reviews.text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend for a concert and initially had a pleasant experience. However, after returning home, we discovered a $350 charge for ‚Äúsmoking in the room.‚Äù

He does smoke cigars, but at no point did we smoke anywhere on hotel property or inside our room. We enjoyed cigars only at a downtown cigar lounge and while walking in public outdoor areas( Miles from the hotel). One unlit cigar was placed on the dresser simply so my husband could take it with him when we went out again‚Äîit was never lit indoors. There were a couple times he forgot it there while we were out so I‚Äôm sure housekeeping noticed. 

The hotel claims they needed to bring in a machine to remove smoke,which is completely unfounded. If smoking had occurred, the smell would have been obvious immediately, especially to housekeeping, who cleaned our room every day during our stay (at our request!) It is unreasonable to equate the presence of an unlit cigar with actually smoking inside.

We travel frequently, are responsible adults, and have never had such an issue at any other hotel. This charge feels like an unjust and opportunistic attempt to collect additional fees without concrete evidence. Despite speaking with various different staff 
 member/managers no resolution or refund was offered. For this reason, I cannot recommend this hotel. Guests should be aware that even possessing tobacco products in your room could result in unwarranted charges.

reviews.title: Great rooms, highly recommend.
reviews.text: We made a last minute reservation here. The customer service was wonderful when we checked in. The rooms were beautiful, beds comfortable. Very convenient to everything.

reviews.title: Older property with attentive staff
reviews.text: First visit for a conference.  Definitely older property.  King room had a small bath, tub shower, one sink. Walls thin enough to hear our neighbors' 2am convo. Conference food was varied and adequate. Had the worst bagel ever from their ala carte shop and room service. Restaurant waiters fabulous, food very mediocre. Hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. Hotel very close to great shopping and Lake Shore Drive.

My wife and I stayed at the Westin this past weekend while in town for the Phish concert at the United Center. We stayed for three nights and had a great overall experience.

The staff was warm and welcoming, and they were able to accommodate our early check-in, which we really appreciated. Our room was clean, quiet, and very comfortable‚Äîhonestly, even nicer than we expected.

We booked directly through the Westin‚Äôs website, so we were aware of the destination fee, which was included in the room price. Like many big-city hotels, they charge a daily fee, but at least it could be used as a $25 daily credit at the hotel. We ended up using it at the Starbucks in the lobby for coffee and snacks each morning, which helped make it feel a little more worthwhile.

We want to give a special shoutout to the amazing woman doing housekeeping on the 25th floor (Room 2544) on Saturday, July 19th. She was incredibly kind, helpful, and went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable and taken care of. Her kindness stood out, and we hope she gets to see this‚Äîshe truly made a difference in our stay!

One unexpected bonus: being on the 25th floor, we had a great view of the Navy Pier fireworks right from our room. It was a fun surprise and added to the experience.

If we had to mention one small (and lighthearted) complaint, it‚Äôs that we didn‚Äôt get any Garrett‚Äôs popcorn in the room. We‚Äôre not sure if it was ever promised, but if anyone at the Westin feels like sending some our way, we definitely wouldn‚Äôt say no!

All in all, we had a great time and would absolutely stay here again. Highly recommend if you're coming to Chicago
Very nice accommodation:  quiet, well-appointed room, centrally located across from the John Hancock Center along the famous Magnificent Mile of classy stores and restaurants.

reviews.title: Great location, beware of destination fee
reviews.text:
This location was great and very central. We didn‚Äôt rent a car (because I saw beforehand it is $79/day for valet parking not including tip). It was easy to use public transit (download the Ventra app) and we used Uber/Lyft a few times. If you are a light sleeper, it‚Äôs helpful to know there are LOTS of sirens and unending honking at the corner of Michigan/Delaware. We got used to it and Chicago is a noisy city, but our city view was great from our room on the 7th floor. It‚Äôs across the street from the 100 story John Hancock building. 
I pre-paid for the breakfast everyday and was glad I did. It‚Äôs a waiter sit down meal and is a buffet on the weekends. The vouchers include tip as well but our server was phenomenal so I gave him a great tip on the last day. 
I would recommend this hotel. The one thing that caught me off guard was the $35 daily destination fee that they charge you when you check out. They did tell me about it at check in but I wasn‚Äôt sure if that was already included in the price I had paid to rent my room. It is not. They have ways you can try to use some of that money (like $15/day for food if you charge to your room..but it is not cumulative) and some nearby attractions like the sports museum, architectural museum etc. I would rather not have that be a mandatory fee. Other than that, it was a comfortable stay in a great location.

reviews.title: Restin' at the Westin
reviews.text:
The Westin Michigan Avenue is a wonderful midrange option in downtown Chicago.  I spent 4 nights here on a work trip and had a very pleasant stay.  Hotel is very average - there was nothing wildly amazing, but also nothing horrible.  Highly suggest Westin put some money into soft renovations and if so, they would have an exceptional hotel in downtown.  

As for HSH‚Äôs list:

Pro‚Äôs:
- Super cozy bed
- Loved little couch in room - gave some needed extra storage space for backpack, carry on bag, etc.
- Iron in the room was fantastic!  I am a terrible ironer and whatever iron this was made it very simple to get wrinkles out
- Bagel, egg, cheese at the fake Starbucks in the lobby was delicious

Con‚Äôs:
- Shower had mold
- Closet smelled funky.  So funky that I had to keep the closet door open so my clothes wouldn‚Äôt smell

Recommendations:
- Opportunity for housekeeping to deep clean bathrooms
- Lobby and guest room renovation would make this hotel shine again

I would definitely stay here again if I needed to stay downtown and would not be in my room 24/7.  Good choice for transient and business guests.

reviews.title: The Westin Michigan Avenue Chicago 909 North Michigan Avenue Chicago, Illinois
reviews.text: On our second night in the room, we had to call maintenance because the toilet smelled so bad. They had to come in late at night and were there for about an hour. I don't know what they did but I knew something was wrong when we checked into the room because the toilet had a wedge shoved underneath it because it was unstable. Why did they not fix it before we got into the room? The next morning the floor was soaking wet because something was leaking from whatever they did. We also ran out of body wash in the shower. Obviously, they don't check when they clean the room. In the bar they charge $2 for ice in your cocktail. What a joke. The only good thing of our stay was a server named Mike in the restaurant. He was very accommodating.

reviews.title: Low quality, high price
reviews.text:
Absolutely horrid for the price. I would expect this from a cheap $40 hotel. TV does not work. AC doesn‚Äôt work. Guest WiFi does not work. Mildew on the shower tiles. 

If you don‚Äôt mind not being able to watch TV, use the internet or stay cool. This is a great place with its location. Strongly advise against for anything business related

reviews.title: The worst hotel ever
reviews.text: The worst hotel experience I've ever had. The staff were incredibly rude and argumentative from the start. I was given a room that was in poor condition, and to make matters worse, I found a cigarette in my car‚Äîcompletely unacceptable. There were also unauthorized charges made to my account, which I consider theft. It felt like issue after issue, with no resolution or accountability. If I could give zero stars, I would.

reviews.title: Great staff, especially Oliver!
reviews.text:
I had a great 1 night stay at the hotel. Arrived at 2pm and wanted to explore the city for the remaining hours of the afternoon. Hotel staff recommended the big bus which was great. I saw all the attractions of the city in just a few hours.
Special thanks to Oliver who made my departure very convenient with a nice talk while waiting for my uber.

The only unxpected thing of my stay was the destination fee which I‚Äòve never heard of begore. I would have spent this credit anyways at the hotel so why make it a mandatory thing, such a pity.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: First, the Westin beds are phenomenal. This location has a great breakfast in the lounge with fresh juices and very good eggs. The best part of this hotel is the service. Jennieca at the first desk is absolutely exceeding the bar. She remembers her guest by name (without looking at the computer) and she is always friendly and helpful!

reviews.author: Nic P.
reviews.text:
I booked this hotel for a work trip specifically because of its proximity to the convention center, which has been convenient. I also typically have great luck with Westins, and have never had a bad stay. Unfortunately, the condition of the room has made my stay so far less comfortable than expected.

The room itself feels very dated and worn. The chair upholstery is peeling and damaged, the carpet has visible burn marks, and there are multiple areas of peeling wallpaper. The popcorn ceilings and overall finishes make the room feel overdue for renovation. No mini fridge to store personal items, only a mini bar.

The bathroom is exceptionally small, and the electrical outlets have had trouble with my hair dryer, and lighting is terrible. These issues are especially challenging given that I‚Äôm here for a multi-day business stay and need a functional, comfortable space.

I‚Äôm disappointed, as I expected a much higher standard for a hotel catering to business travelers. I‚Äôm here for the next four nights, hoping this room is a one off and the hotel can move me.

reviews.author: Nicole Tabak
reviews.text: My room was inadequate. It was freezing even though I had the temperature set at 78 for almost 5 hours. Ended up having to move rooms. Had to go down to the lobby twice because I couldn‚Äôt get a hold of anybody on the phone using the service express button. The indoor pool wasn‚Äôt even warm enough to put my feet in. The self parking for one night was still $60. I can‚Äôt even imagine what the valet would cost. I spent $72 on a meal at the downstairs bar and I‚Äôve had better food at Subway. I then was moved to a new room that smelled like someone smoked cigarettes in it. Then moved to a third room where I had to move the bed and box spring to reach an outlet. I thought this hotel would be a good experience based off of other reviews. The staff was amazing however. Very kind and made the situation right. That‚Äôs the only reason I give it 3 stars.

reviews.author: Robert Aylor
reviews.text:
Stayed here on NYE, and it is perfectly situated near the event venue we were attending that evening--also near a number of decent restaurants.
A large and generally well-appointed facility, it essentially occupies an entire block. Check-in was painless, there was never a wait for the elevators, and our room on the 37th floor was large and had a great view.
Bonvoy elite members also get a free grande coffee at the Starbucks within the lobby, which is nice after an evening of revelry.

reviews.author: Tonya Alston
reviews.text:
I was a guest here a couple of weeks ago for a conference; I was there for a week.
The rooms are very comfortable and the staff is attentive. I had a weird experience of returning to my room to find that the shower gel that had been mounted to the shower wall had been removed. I had already been there for 5 days and wasn't checking out until the following Monday.
The food at Relish is very good. I had the Waygu Smash Burger (Twice). 5‚≠êÔ∏è.
This hotel is very close to the Seattle Convention Center and the Pike Place Market, which I highly recommend.
The most problematic issue was the elevators in the North Tower. Each tower has 4 elevators. By Wednesday, only 2 of 4 elevators in the North Towers were working, and it took 15 to 40 minutes for the 2 working  elevators to circle back to my floor, with enough room for the rest of us to enter. Even by Sunday, when most of our nearly 900 delegates had checked out, the elevators were still slow.

reviews.author: Weili Shen
reviews.text:
Highly recommended!
The hotel is conveniently located in the center of downtown Seattle, with easy walking access to the Westlake shopping center, Pike Place Market and the Sphere. In less than 10-15 minutes, you can get to the waterfront as well.

We just had a birthday celebration, and the front desk receptionist graciously upgraded us to a room with better amenities.

We will remember the hospitality and revisit it in the future.

reviews.title: Best of the best!
reviews.text:
Our experience at Westin was beyond incredible. Scott checked us in and made us feel very welcomed. His attention to detail with our requests was amazing. The room had fabulous views. Our son enjoyed the pool. We had an amazing breath experience at the restaurant. Our server Fracis was a delight! We will absolutely come back again. 
Note: hotel is super close 2 min walk to the lightrail that u can access to and from the airport!

reviews.title: Needs an update/refresh
reviews.text:
Time for an upgrade. This place feels dated, dark but the location is ok. Rooms and bathrooms were old. Shower was making strange noises as though it was going to blast out of the wall. The gym is very tiny and limited. I saw people walk in and out because there was no space. Surprised with such a big hotel with so many rooms. I had to ask for toilet paper but they never brought it to my room as the roll left from the previous guest was less meager and they never had an extra roll sitting anywhere. 

Wouldn‚Äôt recommend it until they do an update.

reviews.title: Run down, rude service and good location‚Ä¶
reviews.text: Only positive about this hotel is location. Smelled a dusty carpet as I entered the room. It is so run down that they do not feel the need of replacing a peeling off chair. Sofa cushions had stain. Should not qualify ad Westin property. Service is non existent. Had to call twice to get an extra cup. Extremely rude server at lobby bar. Strongly reprimanded us for having a bottle of our own wine.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel and staff was friendly
reviews.text: The hotel was nice and the staff was helpful and friendly. At check in I was asked if I wanted an upgrade for 30.00 per night and was advised I had a 30.00 credit for food and beverage. I was upgraded to the 43rd floor facing the town. Don't waist your money. Maybe upgrade to the water side it might be better. I stopped the night before and was advised I was not due the food and beverage credit. The agent did recover the issue and gave it to me without a problem. Visit the waterfront and market it's nice. The downtown area not so much. It's dirty and stinks.

reviews.title: Mixed Experience: Dated rooms, poor customer service, great location
reviews.text:
This is a fairly typical American downtown chain hotel where you know what you are getting. A nice lobby, outdated rooms, and a feeling that you are just making up the numbers on a factory conveyer belt. The reception staff were devoid of any warmth and the person I spoke to was regurgitating memorized lines while checking me in. When I asked about breakfast options, he seemed totally thrown off, gave me an odd stare, and then just pointed in a generic direction with a ‚Äúyou can eat there if you like‚Äù.

The property clearly has little incentive to update their rooms due to a steady supply of corporate travellers. The rooms are big but very dated. The bathroom had a heavily stained tub accompanied by an unhygienic cloth curtain. There is no shower cubicle. Housekeeping is not automatically provided and needs to be requested (for ‚Äúenvironmental reasons‚Äù obviously, nothing to do with cost cutting). Having requested this, housekeeping did their best to keep their services environmentally friendly by not actually cleaning the room. I had the same bar of disintegrating soap next to my sink for 5 days which was never replaced. It was very obvious that the bathroom and bedroom surfaces had not been wiped even once during my stay. The only thing they appeared to do was replace the used towels.

The gym was very cramped and crowded, even at 6am. There was absolutely no space to walk around. Frankly, it looks like the gym was just crowbarred into a disused corner so the property could list the gym as an amenity. If you are serious about your daily gym workouts, do not stay at this hotel.

There is one restaurant at the hotel: Relish Burger Bistro. What is not made clear when you check-in is that this restaurant offers a very good breakfast buffet. There is a generic menu at the entrance so it is not immediately obvious that a breakfast buffet is available. The staff at Relish are exceedingly courteous and seem to be operating independently to the hotel staff. 

The hotel lobby is expansive and has a great atmosphere in the evenings once the bar fills up. 

The location of the property is fantastic, very central, and the surrounding area feels safe. Pike Place, South Lake Union, and the Central Business District are all within walking distance.

Overall, quite a mixed experience. Because I did not spend much time in the room, I was not too bothered about its general state. But I guess that is exactly what the hotel relies on. There was no additional benefit to being a Gold Elite member either.

reviews.title: Multiple issues before and during stay
reviews.text:
Our experience with the Westin Seattle began when we attempted to cancel our reservation due to plans changing and hoping that they had a 24-hour complimentary policy. We were stuck on hold for an hour only to get an outsourced call center, which was not helpful. Oh well, we decided to make it work and stay. 

We arrived at the hotel around 11:30 a.m. and attempted to check in or, at worst, leave our luggage to go out into the city. To our surprise, we were able to, which we were very appreciative of. The front desk agent that helped us was very helpful and nice. 

After receiving our keys and making it up to our room, we were surprised to see it was not the room we had booked. We received a room with two full-sized beds vs. the one king bed. Due to how busy the front desk was and how long the initial wait took, we decided to just keep the room as we had somewhere we had to be at 1. We were very disappointed that we did not receive the room that we booked. This was our first time staying at a Westin property. The room itself was an average hotel room and not exactly what I‚Äôd expect when I hear ‚ÄúWestin‚Äù. Our tv did not work. We attempted to unplug and look at the power strip, but we gave up and went to bed. The bed was pretty comfortable, and I enjoyed the pillows. The bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom. 

Overall, the total experience from before we arrived, trying to get customer service to having our room messed up with the rooms themselves being an average room at best, led to a 2-star review.

reviews.title: Fantastic view from room
reviews.text: I stayed at Westin for business travel. It is a slightly old hotel but the north tower is newer. My room was spacious, clean and had a beautiful view of both water and mountains. The room was quiet and it is centrally located across key areas. The bathroom was quite large with separate bathtub and shower. It is my favourite place for my next visit to Seattle.

reviews.title: Disappointing Stay
reviews.text: My second time staying there and both times disappointing.  Rooms need a refresher - stains on ceilings, wall paper coming off.  Plane arrived late after 1 am and front doors locked.  Poor signage on how to get into the hotel.  Walked around outside for 15 minutes before could get in.  Coffee maker was not working asked for another one right away since I had little sleep and front desk said that was not possible.  Work out room - all 4 peletons broken.  Myself and 2 other guests were trying to use them.  When I called down to front desk their reply was they had not heard anyone complain about these.  Well what can I say - all broken- maybe you should do some maintenance?  I'm a gold member but did not help - received poor service and responses from front desk on all 3 issues.

reviews.title: delightful stay
reviews.text: We traveled to Seattle for a nine day cruise to Alaska on Norwegian Cruise Line. Our stay was booked via Norwegian, and it was wonderful.  We had arrived before their normal check-in time, but they found us room.  The room was clean and quiet, and the beds were very comfortable.  The hotel was well cared for and the staff were very helpful.  We would stay there if we were travel to Seattle again.

reviews.title: Disappointing. Needs updating. Hot rooms.
reviews.text: Needs updating of rooms. Curtains perished and show light. Air conditioning set too hot. Too pricey for what you get. Reception staff mostly non interested in issues. Disappointed.

reviews.title: Feels older, but had a decent stay
reviews.text: We had a good stay at this Westin Hotel in Seattle. It is very conveniently located for downtown shopping and travel to Seattle Center to see the Space Needle. The hotel does feel older, but I found it had been well-kept.

reviews.title: Best Customer Service Everüòçüòçüòç
reviews.text:
Cheryl Cserepes is Amazingüòçüòç
We left some very expensive clothing in the closet. She went above and beyond to get them to usü•∞ She was so friendly and helpful all through the process!! They need more of her in the hotel!!

reviews.title: Night before an Alaskan Cruise
reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin Seattle on the night before we left on a Cruise. The room was booked for us by NCL as part of the cruise package. It was mostly an ok visit. There were a couple of issues. Our flight was very early, and even though the couple who checked in before us got a room, we had to wait until 3 pm to get a room. I think we were on the 10th floor of the north tower.  The signage said ice machine this way. We circled the floor and found no ice machines. We asked the maid who directed us to the 13th floor. Actually, Ice machines are on odd floors. Also, even though the sign at the concierge desk says they have cruise info, they could not correctly answer our question about the transfer to the cruise terminal.

reviews.title: Amazing pre cruise Hotel
reviews.text: Westin Seattle is an amazing hotel in the heart of Seattle.   Walking distance to almost anything.  Space needle, Pike Place.  Lots of restaurants and fast food also short walking distance.   It all started with Camila  in reservations.  She went above and beyond making us feel like a VIP helping find the perfect room and view as I wanted to see the cruise ships come in and out.   If you are taking a cruise, it‚Äôs walkable to Pier 66 and Pier 91 like ours was a short drive.   Amazing room, clean, comfortable bed.  No balcony but huge window views from our King grand water view room.  It‚Äôs worth the extra money to get this room.   Looking forward to our next stay in Seattle at the Westin.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.title: Not perfect but good
reviews.text: First stay at the Westin - I have always admired the hotel and discovered that it was designed by John Graham and Associates, the same architecture firm that designed the Space Needle and the Monorail. It does have that MCM feel and I appreciated the look of the lobby. We got a complimentary upgrade so we caught a bit of a water view. The night view with the city lights was a total treat. And the beds were dreamy! Of course the location cannot be beat. Which was good considering a room cost us $500 for one night. On the less than spectacular end of things, my kids went to the pool and said the water smelled horrible - so bad that they didn't even really want to swim in it. And the elevator situation is tragic. Lots of waiting for elevators. The elevators feel shaky and worrisome. Even though there were open stations at the check in desk they weren't staffed and there was a decent line to get checked in. On a Saturday, at 4:15. You would think there would be other staffing decisions made. The person who checked us in was an absolute sweetheart though so at the end of the day I had a great experience with the staff when I got to the checkout counter. There is no such thing as a perfect hotel and the Westin is a very good hotel.

reviews.title: Amazing Stay
reviews.text: Stayed for only 1 night but it was amazing. Great hotel. Clean rooms. Quiet rooms. Professional staff. Downtown location. Easy to find. Nice amenities Good value for what you get. Comfortable beds. Overall Amazing.

reviews.title: Pretty good hotel
reviews.text: The room was good, the check in and check out process was good. I was there for a conference and it was apparent that the hotel has difficulty handling large numbers of guests at the same time. This was evidenced by the extremely long waits for the elevators, and very long lines at the coffee shop. The staff was friendly and courteous and the location is pretty good for walking to Pikes Place. Overall a nice place if you‚Äôre just visiting.

reviews.title: Consistently great Westin Hotel
reviews.text:
This is my 2nd time staying in Downtown Seattle. It's right on 5th Avenue, conveniently located to Pikes Market, Nordstrom, Seaport and all the good stuff in Downtown Seattle. I'm lucky to be in the Hospitality Industry so getting to try out many different hotels in many different cities is the dream job!

Westin is owned and operated by Marriot Hotels. There are many other hotel brands within the Marriot group. 

Dining Outlets including 1900 FIFTH Bar + Lounge, Relish Bistro. Relish To Go, and Mobile Dining.

Complimentary Wi-Fi in room and/or public areas. ‚Ä¢ Complimentary local/toll free calls from guest room. Housekeeping makes each guestroom your sanctuary throughout your stay and if you prefer a Housekeeping Team not to service your room during your stay, simply place your "Do Not Disturb" sign. Westin Workout Fitness Studio is open 24/7 on the 5th floor in the North Tower. Westin also has a heated indoor pool that is open daily 5:00am-11:00pm.

Every single Westin property I‚Äôve stayed at is very consistent. Each room has a Heavenly Bed, Heavenly Towels, a Heavenly Robe, white tea toiletries, a Samsung Smart TV, and the night stand always has a Sleep Well Lavender balm for bedtime.

reviews.title: Awesome Stay
reviews.text: Arrived early from a cruise and they had a room ready for us (an upgrade). Before we traveled I called the Hotel and they found the location of a Catholic Church nearby! Good directions for the neighborhood. Because of a late flight they gave us a 2:00 pm checkout! After some sightseeing we were able to hangout in the lobby until our ride to the airport. Food at the hotel was very good (pizza and salad) and excellent service with storing our luggage until our shuttle ride. There was a mix up in a charge for the internet and they corrected it immediately. All in all a very good experience. The cruise line booked the hotel but the hotel credited my Bonvoy account for the stay.

reviews.title: Great choice in downtown Seattle!
reviews.text: The Westin was perfect for our stay in Seattle. Great location to waterfront. Only few blocks to Pike Market and restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful, room clean and spacious. All exceeded our expectations!

I stayed at The Westin Seattle in early July 2025 for a large business conference. My room was in the North Tower on a high floor. Check-in was polite, professional, and quick. The room was clean and the bed, as expected from Westin, was very comfortable. Housekeeping was consistent and well done, with bottled water replenished daily.

Despite the hotel being full, the Wi-Fi worked well and the elevators were fast, which made a big difference. Room service on my first night was fresh and prompt. The location was ideal for walking to nearby event venues.

The only real miss was the lobby-level bar and coffee shop. They were clearly not staffed for the full hotel and unable to handle the volume. I gave up on getting morning coffee or an evening drink at the hotel and found better options nearby.

Overall, the stay met my expectations for a Westin, but the hotel should consider better ways for its amenities to accommodate a full hotel.

reviews.title: Could have been better.
reviews.text: Good location. Main hotel and pool clean and well maintained. Room tired. Constant tapping noise in ceiling. Only one bed made up, and one coffee and cup replenished, although three people in room. Sink not cleaned. Some trash not picked up. Not the Westin experience I‚Äôm used to.

reviews.title: The Westin Seattle, while officially a 4-star hotel, regarding its service, with fall short of even a 3-star level 1)	Br
reviews.text:
The Westin Seattle, while officially a 4-star hotel, regarding its service, with fall short of even a 3-star level
1)	Breakfast service
1.1	When you book a room at Westin Seattle hotel, they vaguely tell you about breakfast service, or they tell you that it will be complete on check-in time.
1.2	When you check in you get no clear instructions about breakfast. Instead, they give you a one-page paper with instructions. When you read this instruction paper you find no clarification about breakfast. Instead, the paper explains where the restaurant is allocated and the time of opening.
1.3	With all this confusion in my mind on my first stay, I woke up in the morning and went to the restaurant to have my breakfast. There was a queue and a couple of barristers taking orders and I saw most people paying in cash, regardless of whether they were staying in the hotel or not. As I was staying in the hotel, I asked if I could have breakfast. The reply was, if I want a buffet, I have to pay $39.00 + service total of over $45.00. Other than buffet, I have to pay as I use like any passing by customer.
1.4	In hotel restaurants and any bars, they don‚Äôt use "Tap in" payment. Instead, they preferred in cash or taking your payment card and coming back with paper and pan to make you sign in a very backward way.
2)	4-Star Hotel standard
As worldwide, a 4-star hotel should also receive a personalised welcome, perhaps with fresh flowers or a small gift, and enjoy a turndown service, regarding complimentary beverages. Bottled water, tea, and coffee are standard offerings in 4-star hotels, but in the Westin Seattle hotel
2.1 At check-in, you may be offered a 500mil bottle of water.
2.2 When you get in the room, you find a full fridge with a different kind of drink which is chargeable. It is reasonably acceptable. On the top of the fridge there is a table and on that table there are diferent kind of Beverages, almost all of them chargeable.
The trickiest and deliberately planted items are beside those beverages. One bottle of water and a bottle of wine also chargeable.
As explained above, except for the items in the refrigerator, the rest are very confusing and easy to trick the customer and to use them without understanding that they are chargeable. 
In this regards the Westin Seatle hotel, under standard and use extrmly gridy system to get rip-off his coustomers.

reviews.title: RIP off hotel.. they add charges you don‚Äôt request for!!
reviews.text:
Avoid this hotel - Complete rip offs!! They push charges on you, you don‚Äôt opt for!!

I was charged $31 destination fee, which I did not authorise or request. On check in I was told it‚Äôs complimentary, no charges. Receptionist Jacob was very devious, he told us it‚Äôs complimentary $20 for us on food credits. And charged us destination fee.

Westin already has a spoilt reputation and won‚Äôt go here again.

To check out it took us 45 mins and we had to pay our driver extra to wait or we would have missed our cruise. It‚Äôs like they are paying us to stay there for free.

The manager on escalation was too pompous to come and resolve, sitting in his office. He told Jacob that he is busy and asked us to write to him. Thinking guests are jobless!!

Don‚Äôt spoil your holiday choosing them, there are many other good hotels in vicinity.

reviews.title: Lovely Seattle visit and Westin staff are always fabulous!
reviews.text:
Lovely visit to Seattle!  The Westin was great as always!  My 14 year old son visited for a few nights and have only good things to say!  Lee, the Westin guest representative, graciously reached out a few days ahead of time and made our stay even better!   We seamlessly checked in after train travel and were wowed with a room facing the water!   Westin staff was wonderful as always!  I always love staying here when I‚Äôm in Seattle!

Only reason for 4 stars was due to the AC being a little wonky.  To be fair, Seattles temp was high 80s which is very atypical.  

Overall great stay and will be back!

photos.caption: Experience a modern twist on an American classic at Relish Burger Bistro TO-GO. Quick breakfast, lunch and dinner options available daily.
Nourish your well-being with our Eat Well Menu

officialPhotos.caption: Experience a modern twist on an American classic at Relish Burger Bistro TO-GO. Quick breakfast, lunch and dinner options available daily.
Nourish your well-being with our Eat Well Menu

google.address: Westin Hotel, 70 3rd Ave, Waltham, MA 02451, USA

reviews.author: Ja Morant
reviews.text:
The Westin hotel is a nice high quality hotel that looks great on first glance, but the more you dive in it doesn‚Äôt look at great. In this review I will talk about many different parts of the hotel, good and bad.

First impressions: walking in the hotel is so beautiful with great rugs and flavored water and complimentary fruit. The windows and lookout on a hill is so beautiful.

Checking in: checking in is relatively easy, with the service seeming quite nice to start.

Getting to the room: the elevator is very nice, and the halls are very easy to navigate, unlike some other hotels.

The room: the rooms are okay, with the bathrooms being the highlight. But the walls and overall mood is nice, but some closer issues remain that I will state later.

Night and service: these are my main issues. At night, there were multiple people screaming and slamming doors; ranging from 9 pm-4 in the morning! I called telling them what happened, and they said they will take care of it. The same night it kept happening and I called been saying what happened and they said that there is ‚Äúnothing they can do about it‚Äù and it retained for the rest of my weeks vacation I called in multiple times kept saying why there‚Äôs nothing that they can do about it and they said that‚ÄúNothing was actually happening ‚Äú Which rightfully made me very upset because it literally was.

Overall: the Westin is a nice hotel with overall nice rooms and atmosphere and good room service not service for complaints and nice pool and great burgers. Some issues though hold this back from being a great hotel.

reviews.author: James Krenis
reviews.text: Truly, outstanding stays every time we come here. It doesn‚Äôt seem like it would be as good as it is, but the service makes you feel like you‚Äôre a king or a queen. The rooms are immaculate, and the prices are usually shockingly low for this high-quality brand. Highly highly recommend

reviews.author: Hendrix Yapputro
reviews.text:
The Westin Waltham Boston is a fantastic hotel located in the heart of Waltham's business district, offering a warm and inviting atmosphere. Guests rave about the hotel's cleanliness, spacious rooms, and friendly staff. The hotel features a range of amenities, including an indoor pool, fitness center, and on-site restaurant, Relish, serving delicious new American cuisine.

Key Highlights:

- Comfortable Rooms: Spacious rooms with premium bedding and amenities like air conditioning and bathrobes
- Excellent Servic: Friendly and helpful staff, with some guests praising their exceptional service
- Great Location: Conveniently located near major highways, with easy access to Boston and surrounding attractions
- Amenities Galore: Indoor pool, fitness center, business center, and on-site restaurant.

Overall, The Westin Waltham Boston is a great choice for business travelers and tourists alike, offering a comfortable and relaxing stay with plenty of amenities.

reviews.author: Sue Llewellyn
reviews.text:
Can I start by recommending this hotel on all levels.
The rooms are large and very comfortable The bed was the best bed I have ever slept in.
Everyone of the staff I met were so professional and very kind.
Big shout out to Rodney the Room manager on the front desk.........after 5 days of trying to retrieve my lost mobile he got it back to me at my next hotel.
He should be made the general manager (no offence to the current one).
The location would have been fine if I was on business but after 4/5 days I needed to be closer to Boston.

reviews.author: Melissa Castile
reviews.text: I have stayed at cheaper hotel with better amenities.   For the price you pay, no free breakfast or complimentary coffee.  The vanity in my bathroom was cracked and there was pubic hair in the tub and toilet which were not mine because I hadn't used the bathroom.  So much dust on the wall and mop boards I cleaned it myself. No microwave in the room so I dont know where they expect you to heat up left overs, oh wait, they dont, they want you to go down into their overpriced shoddy hotel restaurant.  And the beautiful comfy robe they provide for you to relax in after a long day, I wouldn't put that robe in to line my animals cage its so terribly scratchy and uncomfortable.   Staff was snotty and rude.  I asked a question and they looked at me like I was beneath them.  Much rather stay at a cheaper hotel with better amenities and service.  Not worth the price!!!

reviews.title: Pretty disappointing for a Westin
reviews.text: For a Westin, this hotel really leaves much to be desired.  There are a few good things: the beds are very comfy (though they are doubles, not queens).  The buffet breakfast was like a typical hotel buffet that you‚Äôd find most places (bacon, sausage, French toast, eggs, toast, oatmeal + toppings), but a bit elevated.  The fresh fruit was really nice, and the staff were attentive and friendly.  However, the rooms are cramped and pretty old.  The bathroom has definite signs of many, many years of poor ventilation (rusty door hinges and sprinkler heads, mildew in the shower grout), and there is a water stain in the ceiling of the  bedroom as well.  Maintenance is lacking as well: when we first arrived in our room after a long day of travel, the deadbolt didn‚Äôt work.  The front desk said that they‚Äôd have an engineer take a look, but neglected to tell me that it would be the next day.  So after waiting a long time and having no one show up, I called again and they were able to find someone to come and fix it so that I could finally go to bed feeling secure.  The next day, the toilet lever detached from the tank mechanism.  I tried to just put it together again myself, but it kept detaching, so I asked the front desk to send someone to fix it while I was out.  6 hours later I was back and it still wasn‚Äôt fixed.  Also, there‚Äôs no moisturizing cream, and the pumps for shampoo, etc in the shower are mounted way too high for this 5‚Äô1‚Äù person!

reviews.title: Well Run Venue with a professional staff !
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, the staff treated us with genuine hospitality and professionalism. The meeting room we rented was absolutely perfect for what we needed. Well prepared, elegant, and comfortable. It was a pleasure working with the Westin team and we truly appreciate how smoothly everything was handled. I would highly recommend this space for anyone looking for a beautiful and well-run venue.

reviews.title: Disgusted!
reviews.text:
Disgusted! Frequent flyer/traveler and Westin is my go to hotel. By far the nastiest property.
Literally fly in after a long flight to pubic hairs on the shower walls!

No accommodations because the hotel was booked!

reviews.title: Poor service and outdated rooms.
reviews.text:
I‚Äôll start this review to let everyone know that I base this review with extensive experience with Marriotts around the world - over 1000 nights stayed and I don‚Äôt typically write reviews unless the experience was that bad and I want to warn fellow travelers. I‚Äôm a loyal Marriott customer but would never stay here again. Service at this hotel was really bad. I blame management because the hotel is under staffed and the minimal staff they have are poorly trained.

Front desk staff was rude and not at all accommodating. We missed the beginning of the service because of them even though I checked in 24 hours early and requested a check-in time of 1:30. 

We didn‚Äôt get to eat breakfast because the restaurant was under staffed and the line for the buffet seating was out the door. 

The room was not in great shape - bathroom drains clogged, bathroom vent fan inoperable, desk AC outlets inoperable, etc.

Overall, the hotel is poorly managed. The staff is not to blame - they are doing the best they can with the limited resources provided.

reviews.title: Restaurant‚Äô experience
reviews.text: Many complements to Sheila Ramirez who works at the Relish Restaurant at the hotel. Besides her great knowledge of the menu in which helped me to make a great dinner choice, she is also very kind, helpful and generous. They‚Äôre lucky to have her working for them. She‚Äôs a great addition!

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Sadly, this hotel is rather shabby now.  I would not desctibe it as clean. Hallways are unvaccummed and generally messy. Not inviting. Internt in rooms is terrible!

reviews.title: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend, wouldn‚Äôt come back
reviews.text:
August 4th, 2025. The hotel and room was clean. We liked the bevy machine in the lobby. 

However, there was one major issue during our stay. Although the pool and gym were well kept, the singular shower on that level was locked and the restroom was not clean and it did not have toilet paper. 

When we told staff about this, I couldn‚Äôt believe the words that came out of this man‚Äôs mouth. He said ‚ÄúThere shouldn‚Äôt be a bathroom there.‚Äù Puzzled, I asked, ‚ÄúSo if I need to use the restroom while I‚Äôm exercising or swimming, where do I go?‚Äù  He replied bluntly, ‚ÄúYou have to come upstairs.‚Äù He apologized but said once again that there shouldn‚Äôt be a restroom there. I responded that there should be some sign indicating that. I was also dumbfounded because all hotels and resorts I‚Äôve been to have a shower and restroom open, available, and right next to the gym/fitness center and pool! Perhaps it was just his choice of words, but I found that to be very wrong, such an incorrect way of handling the situation. Hopefully the right changes will be made and that guests can have access to a restroom while they are working out or swimming or they should shut down the pool and fitness center.

This hotel is quite tired in its furnishings and carpeting. The rooms are dark, the bed linens are thin, and the pillows are uncomfortable. The shower curtain was so long that it draped 4 inches into the tub. If I were you, I would look at the nearby Marriott Courtyard or Embassy Suites.

reviews.title: Poor follow-through/communication!  Frustrating
reviews.text: Sleeping accommodations were fine. However, utilizing hotel for business groups was horrific.  I received complaints from my two groups about the food and meeting space. The worse part was the numerous billing errors for my individuals and final group billing. It took over two months to get a resolution after multiple communication to finance team, DOS, GM and hotel owners.  Sadly, the GM nor owners never responded.

reviews.title: Never Coming Back to this Location
reviews.text: the AC did not work on first room they gave me and when I found out about it and called at 3am, they told me engineering comed in at 7am. Turns out he came it a little pass 8am and I was not switched to a new room until next day. The door keys don't appear to work. You have to try multiple times until it works. I was tryng to rush into restroom and keys kept giving me issues to enter. The steam iron did not work properly as it leaked water all ovef my clothes. Las but not least my wallet went missing with $600 and credit cards. I had to file a police report. My room was entered and cleaned without my authorization.

reviews.title: Nice hotel but inconvenient for walking
reviews.text: Nice, comfortable hotel. Great Westin ‚Äúheavenly bed.‚Äù  Very friendly and attentive restaurant staff and excellent breakfast buffet. Overall good service from the front desk staff.  The only downside is the location if you do not have a car.  It is not really walkable to anything.  Also, since it‚Äôs hard to get to local shops, it would be nice if the hotel had a shop for toiletries, drinks and grab and go snacks.  Even a little marketplace like most Courtyards have would be helpful.

reviews.title: Nice hotel but ask for a room far from the bar
reviews.text: The hotel is fine. But the bar can become really loud during days when the hotel is full for a convention and if you're staying in the rooms that are right above it, it feels your still inside the bar. I had to ask to move to a different room because the noise was unbearable even at 10:30PM

reviews.title: Needs Work, More Updating!
reviews.text:
This was the first time I have actually stayed at this hotel.  I‚Äôve been there for functions but never stayed.  Yes, the entrance area has been updated.  The rooms have been somewhat ‚Äúrefurbished‚Äù, bathrooms still need work.  They literally shined an old penny here.  The building looks very appealing as you are driving on the highway past it.  So I would give it higher marks on curb appeal. First night we needed to change our room because of smell coming from bathroom.  The front desk was very helpful and apologetic.  We went to the lounge area for a drink and honestly we taken aback when we got our bill‚Ä¶$19 for a plain mixed drink - no top shelf liquor just a rum and Diet Coke‚Ä¶wow!  Like being at a nice high end resort hotel in Boston or on an island!   Buyer be ware! We had breakfast package but buffet seems to be about $25-$$30 pp, nothing special about it.   They definitely need to work on the restaurant.  We opted to park our car in a side parking lot as the garage was honestly in rough condition.  I am a loyal Marriott member and was disappointed in this one!   We did love the ‚Äúheavenly bed‚Äù which was the highlight of this stay.

Maybe someday they will spend some money and make this into a beautiful place to stay.

reviews.title: Great place but charge for basics.
reviews.text:
Room was nice , comfortable bed, and the extra amenities was a nice touch. The lavender bedtime oil smells amazing and I appreciate the bottle of water. Staff was 7/10. Room was clean and comfortable.
Things that could use improvement: pool says open at 6:00 am, we went down twice. At 6:00 am and again at 7:00am ;it was still not open. My daughter was disappointed that she did not get a chance to use the pool. 
No free breakfast which is provided by even the cheapest hotels. And you have to pay $20 for parking.

reviews.title: Best Breakfast Experience Ever
reviews.text: The room was quite comfortable, the cookies and sparkling water in the lobby were a nice treat but the breakfast experience each day was the best. The food was good but what made the experience so wonderful was our server. She greeted us each day with an extremely  friendly and welcoming "good morning" and made sure we had a pot of coffee on the table the moment we sat dawn.  Her cheerfulness was an absolutely delightful way to begin each day of our stay.

reviews.title: Very tired hotel.
reviews.text:
The Westin Hotel has gone downhill significantly over the years. Our latest stay showed us not only how dated and worn the hotel is.   We stayed there for two nights in a suite.  The room was ok, but the bathroom was so poorly configured, that two people could not be in there at once. If somebody was sitting on the toilet, the bathroom door swings open directly into their knees. 

Making matters worse, this week they cut services to the restaurant which has guests infuriated.  The morning buffet has been removed entirely, replaced strictly with table service. The overpriced menu aside, the restaurant only had one waitress for 60 guests. The kitchen similarly was woefully understaffed. when I asked the manager about this change, all he could do with shrug his shoulders.  We likely will not be staying at the Westin Hotel again.

reviews.title: Water damage?
reviews.text: The hotel lobby and restaurant must have had water damage there are dehumidifiers and fans plugged in everywhere - signs say being refurbished.  The entryway area floor is very dirty rock salt or maybe some other white drywall material all over. The ice maker on our floor is not working.

reviews.title: Better than I paid for
reviews.text: I stayed for the weekend and it was a great experience! The beds were cozy like falling into a cloud, breakfast was served in their restaurant and was served fresh, and the staff were helpful and friendly! Overall don‚Äôt hesitate to book your stay here at the westin! You‚Äôll get more than what you pay for!

reviews.title: Thank you, Farah
reviews.text: OK, let‚Äôs start with Farah. I came in really late and very cranky. She was kind enough to upgrade me. What else can I say? I went from a pedestrian room to a frigging palace. She also returned my bellhop cart to the right place.I could tell that she was really trying. I think this place is amazing. It is also cold. Not the room, but all of the common spaces‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs all windows‚Ä¶ Not a great idea for New England.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, outstanding staff
reviews.text:
Thanksgiving 2024. Clean, comfortable, well managed and a good experience overall.

In particular, Liz in the dining area, was a delight, turning what would have been a standard Bonvoy experience into a more memorable one. We had 20+ at breakfast on Friday morning and she was just the best in terms of making everyone feel welcome and offering great service and personal engagement even while zooming around trying to accommodate the growing crowd at breakfast.

reviews.title: Nice and Clean hotel - But doesn't have the services expected at a Westin
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location.  The staff is very lovely.  Parking is convenient, easy, and $20 a night self-park.  The rooms are in good shape, and it is a bustling hotel.  The fitness center is okay.  The two treadmills I tried to use did not work, but there are probably a dozen various cardio machines. The pool is tiny but warm.   There is no lounge floor.  There was no mini bar in the junior suite we stayed in.  Room service and all food service ends before 10 pm.  The $25 breakfast buffet was on par with a typical complimentary Residence Inn breakfast. There didn't appear to be enough staff to handle a la carte breakfast orders.  Overall, it is a nice, clean hotel, but not a top-tier Westin in terms of services and the price charged per room.

reviews.title: THEY HAVE NO INTEGRITY OR PROFESSIONALISM! FORGED CUSTOMER SIGNATURE TO PUT CHARGE ON CARD!
reviews.text:
Hotel staff never told us about the parking per night charges, not when we checked in, not when we checked out. When we checked in late the first night, the front desk clerk asked if we already parked our car and even said he doesn't need to take down our license plate. We have stayed there before and we were not charged for parking, despite being told they've had this policy for a long time. I asked the front desk twice (2 different people) when we checked out whether we need to sign anything and if our bill was all settled. They said yes, because we prepaid our stay through American Express Travel so we don't owe anything. We didn't sign anything (despite me asking) to indicate that we didn't owe anything upon check-out. 

A few days later, even the $100 temporary incidental hold they placed on my card came off. Then, a week later, I got a notification from American Express that my card got charged $40. I thought it was a mistake/fraudulent charge so I contacted AE and they said I needed to contact the hotel to have them take it off if it's a mistake. I contact the hotel, spoke to a guy named Rodney at the front desk, I asked why I just got charged $40 when I'm nowhere near the hotel. He then asked me if we parked our car during our stay and said that's what the charge was for. I said, no one told us about the parking fee, didn't take down our license plate and somehow a week later, someone just remembered that we parked our car? He said, "yeah, it's on our website". He just kept repeating that and said that he can't take the charge off, whether I authorized it or not. While we were talking, he proceeds to generate a receipt for it and emails it to me. On it, there was my signature, FORGED! I contact AE and they said it needs to show up on my bill so they can help me dispute it. I contact the hotel back, spoke to Rodney again at "guest services", and told him I didn't authorize this charge, no one informed us (and we would have happily paid the bill had they said something during check in or check out), AND that they forged my signature in order to get the charge approved! When I said that, he replied in a very condescending voice, "Oh, no! Really?" I can hear the smirk on his face. I told him it's a crime to forge someone's signature, he was like, "well, we can't take the charge off" and proceeds to hang up on me while I was still talking. Not once, did he apologize for not communicating properly or for the inconvenience he/they caused or for FORGING my signature (it was likely him because his name is on the receipt as the one who generated the charge), and was rude and condescending the entire time! AE has flagged the charge and will dispute it due to "fraud" and will block this merchant from being able to charge anything to my card! 

In the meantime, we will NEVER stay there again! These people have no integrity, are completely unprofessional, and to top it off, they don't clean the room when they come in to do housekeeping! We booked a room for 3 people and they give us 1 bottle of water. The coffee supply was for 2 people. These aren't even that important. The most egregious thing is they will forge your signature to authorize a charge to your card without your permission! Do you trust to do business with these people??? DON'T STAY AT THE WESTIN IN WALTHAM, BOSTON!

reviews.title: Unfortunate Experience
reviews.text:
I stayed at the Westin Waltham Boston for a work conference for one week and the experience was disappointing. 

First, they charged me almost $900 for my stay - which was supposed to be charged to the company - and all they could say is that it was a ‚Äúmistake‚Äù. It took all week for them to return the charge to my card. In speaking with other coworkers, warning them to check their accounts, they were also charged various amounts - one person was charged $1600!

Next, the Wi-Fi was terrible. I was unable to take calls via zoom with my camera on because the network was super unstable. 

Finally, we ate at the hotel restaurant for dinner and it took an hour to get a cocktail drink and then an additional hour to receive our food, which had to be recooked because it was cold. And no, it was not busy. 

I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll be staying at this Westin again.

reviews.title: DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 805
reviews.text: We got no sleep in room 805 because of some kind of equipment on roof above us ( 8 is the top floor). Despite complaining to front desk, absolutely NO concern. Would never recommend this hotel for that reason alone. If the staff makes no effort, it‚Äôs hard to recommend
